loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
La señora Dalila pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Bombonaje", se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en dos tiendas, una de ellas ubicada en el mercado central del distrito de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín y la segunda en su domicilio.  Lo que la motivó a dedicarse a este negocio fueron las ganas que tenía de seguir haciendo estudiar a sus menores hijos y además que le gusta estar en contacto permanente con sus amigos y clientes, así satisfacer sus necesidades primordiales. 

Tiene 39 años y 04 hijos, tres de los cuales son varones y una mujer, el mayor de los varones y la mujer son los que le ayudan en la atención del negocio en la casa, además de acompañarla algunos días en la compra de sus productos. Siempre se ha destacado por ser muy trabajadora y responsable con las labores asumidas.

El crédito otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/.2,500.00 ($790.00), será  invertido en la  compra de diversos abarrotes como:  cajas de jabón por cada marca (Marsella, Bolívar, jumbo, etc.), sacos de 50 kg de  arroz, azúcar, menestras de diversos variedades, papel higiénico en paquetes, conservas de pescado y de frutas en cajas, aceite por litros, además quincenalmente se traslada a la ciudad de Cajamarca para comprar granos,  frutas y verduras frescas para ofertar a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a general store.

loans.name: Norma Cecilia

texts.es:
Norma is a diligent, 38 year old woman who has a small business distributing breakfasts in the markets and to the public in general. She began three years ago, and feels very happy that she has been able to run this business. Thanks to her work, she has been able to gain many benefits and provide things for her small family, improving their quality of life because of her efforts.

With the sacrifice Norma makes every day, she can satisfy her requirements, but she needs to construct her own home with her boyfriend, whom she plans to marry next year. She is requesting this loan to grow her business, and begin a new business selling clothing door to door. With this she will be able to increase her savings and get closer to the day when she can have a family.

Norma es una diligente señora de 38 años, que trabaja en su pequeño negocio de distribución de desayunos a los mercados y público en general. Empezó hace ya tres años y se siente muy feliz de haber incursionado en esta noble labor, debido a que gracias a su trabajo a podido adquirir muchísimos beneficios y bienes para su pequeña familia que ha mejorado notablemente su nivel de vida gracias a su ocupación. Con el sacrificio de todos los días Norma puede satisfacer sus necesidades y no deja de esforzarse por cimentar sus bases económicas sin dejar de lado la construcción de su propia base familiar con su novio con el cual tiene planes de contraer matrimonio el próximo año. Hoy solicita un préstamo para implementar su actual negocio e iniciar uno nuevo con venta de prendas de vestir a domicilio con los que podrá incrementar sus ahorros y hará cercano el día de poder tener una familia.

loans.use: TO GROW HER BUSINESS SELLING BREAKFASTS IN THE MARKET, AS WELL A LAUNCH A NEW BUSINESS SELLING CLOTHING DOOR TO DOOR, INCREASING HER INCOME SO SHE CAN PLAN FOR HER FUTURE.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, 47, owns a secondhand sportswear stand in the market at Kasoa. He is requesting a loan in order to make a deposit for a box of secondhand clothing. Those who are able to make deposits on the clothing are able to choose from a better selection, thus making higher profits when selling.

With the extra profit, Jacob will help pay for the education fees of his three children. One is in junior high, another is training to become a teacher, and the oldest is studying at the university. Jacob also owns a palm oil plantation that he hopes to expand as well. In the future, Jacob hopes to shift from selling individual pieces of used sportswear to becoming a wholesaler.

Jacob is a member of the lending group, Voice of God. The group guarantees a loan through a group repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand sportswear

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina B. is a trader who sells food supplies (cooking oil, canned foods, washing and toilet soaps and other items). Christina is a single parent of two children. Her current income is not sufficient to meet the financial needs of her family. She therefore wants to increase her sales to improve her income. She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more food supplies for her shop.

loans.use: Buy more food supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married with an 18-year-old son and a 16-year-old daughter. She and her family live in Uzhgorod. Oksana is a small entrepreneur with a business in a local market called “Belochka," where she sells socks, umbrellas and other items. She has been in this business for 4 years. Oksana currently has about $3000 in inventory.

Oksana is very focused and determined. She is grateful for the loans she has previously received from “Nadiya Ukraine,” which have helped her expand her business. At this time, Oksana would like to receive a loan of $900 to purchase socks at wholesale prices, which she believes will promote solid growth in her sales.

Oksana has a very optimistic spirit. She never gives up and always cheers her fellow entrepreneurs. We believe her friendliness and persistence will help Oksana gain even more customers and keep her business competitive.

loans.use: Puchase a supply of socks from wholesaler

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
My name is Azra B. from a big city Lahore, Pakistan. I have several other women with me who are also in need of loans.  Sakina B. is borrowing for her husband to buy him a rickshaw. Rashida P. intends to use this loan to expand her partner’s embroidery business. Zumurad B. manufactures woolen sweaters and wants to buy wool. Nazia B.’s husband wants to buy a TV and DVD player for his business. I have known all these women for a long time and completely trust them. 	
I am a mother of five: three boys and two girls. All my daughters attend school whereas my boys are currently working. My husband is a rickshaw driver and I have a blankets sales business; I buy these blankets from another city, Peshawar, which is known for its cheap and high quality products. I would like this loan to buy blankets in bulk from this city for my business.

loans.use: Buy blankets in bulk

loans.name: Ruth Jenny's Group

texts.en:
Elsa, Ruth, and GracieL. have belonged to the Communal Liberty Bank gor 2, 3, and 1 years. Elsa is 23 years old and has 1 child who is 2 years old. Her occupation is to shave lamb so that it can be used to make typical food, which is then sold at the Nery Garcia Market.

Ruth is 29 and a single mother of one 12 year old boy. She is a baker and makes traditional breads like the chapL. (sweet breads or doughnuts) which she sells at the bus terminal. In addition to that Ruth sells Matamoras (a type of corn cake) at the Nery Garcia Market.

GracieL. is also a single mother and is 21 with a 2 month old son. She sells fire wood from her house. On top of that she also sells food in the market with her mother.

These three women need loans of 450 soles, 1250 soles, 300 soles. This money will be invested in the purchase of lamb, flower, sugar and fire wood. The hopes of Elsa, Ruth, and GracieL. are to increase the capital of their business, buy land, and build homes. They want to eventually become wholesalers and be able to send their kids to school.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Elsa, Ruth y GracieL. pertenecen al Banco Comunal Libertad hace 2, 3, 1 años respectivamente. Elsa es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo D. 2 años, Elsa se dedica a pelar cabezas y patas D. cordero (insumo para preparar comida típica), los cuales son vendidos en el mercado Nery García. Por otro lado, Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 29 años y 1 hijo D. 12 años, Ruth es panificadora, elabora panes típicos como L. chapL. que venD. en los terminales D. transporte interprovincial. Además Ruth por las mañanas venD. mazamorras en el mercado Nery García. Mientras que GracieL. es madre soltera, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo D. 2 meses, GracieL. venD. leña en su casa. Además GracieL. junto a su mamá venD. comida en el mercado Nery García. Elsa, Ruth y GracieL. necesitan préstamos D. 450 soles, 1250 soles, 300 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. cabezas y patas D. cordero, harina, azúcar y leña. Los sueños D. Elsa, Ruth y GracieL. son incrementar el capital D. su negocio, comprar un terreno, construir su casa, tener un negocio mayorista y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: These three women  need loans of 450 soles, 1250 soles, 300 soles.  This money will be invested in the purchase of lamb, flower, sugar and fire wood.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es:
Nela lives in Batahola Norte, is married, and has two beautiful children, aged 1 and 2. She is 27 years old and has managed to own a small general store for two years now; she began her business with the severance payment from her husband’s previous job. Nela’s husband is currently unemployed, and so the family depends directly on the earnings from her business.

Nela is going to use the money loaned to her to invest more in her store so that she can increase both her sales and her clientele. Nela hopes that her business will improve every day and that she can thus contribute to her children’s future schooling and their financial stability.

Translated by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Nela, vive en Batahola Norte es casada y tiene dos hermosos hijos una de 1 año y 2 años de edad, a sus 27 años de edad ya ha logrado tener una mini pulpería que tiene dos años ,comenzó el negocio con la liquidación del trabajo anterior de su esposo. Actualmente Bajo su capital al quedarse desempleado su esposo y depender directamente del negocio.

Con el dinero que le presten va a invertir más en la pulpería para incrementar las ventas y la clientela a futuro espera que cada día sea más grande el negocio y así contribuir con el futuro escolar y estabilidad de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing products for her business

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Mrs. Maimouna K. is 50 and a married mother of eight children. She lives in a monogamous family. As she never attended school, she began working at a very young age, namely selling “dégué” (a local type of porridge). With 20 years of experience, she is an expert in this line of business. She purchases millet and milk at the local market, and the other ingredients (sugar, flavoring, etc.) are also bought locally. Demand is high, and she earns a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs. With this income, Mrs. Sangaré Maimouna K. helps her retired husband meet their family’s needs. She believes that the Soro Yiriwaso lending institution helps many underprivileged communities get out of poverty.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Maimouna K. est une femme mariée de 50 ans et mère 8 enfants . Elle vit dans une famille monogame. N'ayant pas été à l’école, dès son jeune âge, elle a commencé l' activité économique notamment la vente de dégué (bouillie alimentaire locale). Avec une experience de 20 ans, elle maîtrise parfaitement cette activité. Elle s’approvisionne en mil et lait au marché local, les autres ingrédients (sucre et arôme etc.) sont aussi achètés sur place. La demande est très importante et elle arrive à réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA. C’est avec ce bénéfice que Madame Sangaré Maimouna K. aide son mari retraité à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Elle trouve que l’intitution de crédit de SORO YIRIWASO aide beaucoup les communautés pauvres à sortir de leur situation de précarité.

loans.use: Purchase of millet and milk

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en:
Khanim I. is a 40-year-old woman who sells fruits and vegetables on the streets in the village of Saatli. She started her business in 2002 and it is her main source of income. She also works as a teacher in the local school, but her salary is too small to cover basic family needs.

She would like to expand her business and increase the number of food products she can sell. For this purpose she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: To expand her business and increase the number of food products for resale

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Thoeurn S. is a 49-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a pig breeder while the other transports firewood to sell door-to-door.  Mrs. Thoeurn S. is a farmer in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her rice revenue now is very small because she owns a small rice field; thus, Mrs. Thoeurn S. requests a loan to buy more land in order to expand her rice production.

loans.use: To buy more land in order to expand her rice revenue.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn U. is 30-year-old widow with no children. She is a farmer in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside from farming, she sells desserts in the local market to supplement her income. On her farm, Mrs. Moeurn U. faces a small problem because she does not have the oxen to plow the rice fields for cultivation, so she needs to hire a labourer with oxen to plow her field. Unfortunately, Mrs. Moeurn U. does not have enough money to do this. Thus, she is seeking a loan to help her get her fields cultivated.

loans.use: To hire a labourer with oxen to plow her rice fields

loans.name: Asha's Tuwe Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Asha is 38 years old. She is married with 8 children, aged between 20 and 4. She has been a charcoal and coconut seller since 2003. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Asha now requests a loan to buy firewood and coconuts for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling firewood, snacks, charcoal, juice, clothes, and shoes.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and coconuts for her business

loans.name: Meak

texts.en: Meak S. is 41 years old, married, and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has business selling groceries from her home to earn an income and is able to make about $2.50 each day. Her husband is a traffic policeman, and typically makes $2.50 a day. Two of their children are employed, and one is currently attending school. Meak S. is requesting a loan of $700 to expand her grocery’s inventory and the also to purchase rice for resale as well.

loans.use: To expand her grocery’s inventory

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Adolfo Lobo Nº 288, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pollos. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de golosinas y gaseosas y también al cuidado de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 5 cajas de gaseosas Kola Real, 5 paquetes de gaseosas descartables, 2 cajas de galletas, etc.
 
Patricia manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para ella y para todas las socias de cada banquito.
texts.en:
Patricia participates in the Communal Bank Las Golondrinas, in Calleria, Coronel Portillo Province, In Ucayali. Patricia, 40, is a widow and has two grown children. The first loan that Patricia received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles) was invested in purchasing chickens to raise and sell. She has been working with the communal bank for a year. Currently, Patricia sells candy, sodas and other snacks, while taking care of her home. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to be paid back in 4 months. The loan will be used to restock with 5 cases of Kola Real sodas, 5 packages of disposable bottle sodas, 2 cases of cookies, etc. Patricia is grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos provides to her all all the other members of the bank.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sodas, cookies, etc., to restock

loans.name: Janett Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sr. Janett tiene 44 años de edad, habitante de barrio Laureles sur en la capital de Managua, casada su esposo se desempeña como albañil, tiene tres preciosos hijos de 14, 21y 24 años de edad solo el menor estudia. Su trabajo en la actualidad es su pequeño negocio de un kiosco en un colegio de la capital vendiendo productos como gaseosa, fritanga desde hace cuatro  años.  Sus planes es terminar la construcción de su casa para ofrecerle seguridad y protección a su familia. ya que su vivienda es de zinc y desea comprar materiales de construcción como: piedra, cemento, arena, hierro, perlinez y otros para comenzar a construir, su anhelo es ver su casita terminada y digna
 En el ámbito económico captar nuevos clientes y comercializar nuevos productos, ampliar el kiosco. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra que sus ventas aumenten y así brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Janett is 44 years old and a resident of the South Laureles district of the capital, Managua. She is married and her husband works as a mason. They have three lovely children, ages 14, 21 and 24; only the youngest is still in school. For the past four years, Janett has worked in a small kiosk at a school in the capital, selling soft drinks and fritanga, a fried meal including meat and vegetables. Janett plans to finish the construction of her house in order to provide security and protection for her family. Since her house is made of zinc-coated corrugated metal sheets, Janett wants to buy construction materials such as stone, cement, sand, iron, roof purlins, etc., in order to start construction. Her dream is to see her home finished in an acceptable manner. Business-wise, she hopes to attract new customers, market new products and expand the kiosk. Thanks to loans from Afodenic, she will achieve an increase in sales, and thus provide a better standard of living for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: G. Sophie s’est mariée avec De Souza Francois. Elle était scolarisée jusqu’au 3ème. Elle est née le 19 septembre 1963. Elle a 5 enfants, âgés de 27, 25, 22, 13, et 11.  Les derniers quatre enfants sont tous a sa charge, et tous scolarisés. Elle a commencé il y a 28 ans en ayant vendu les tissus. Actuellement, elle vend les pagnes et les basins, et elle est ambulante. Elle commande ses produits au marché Missébo. Elle a vu une mévente de ses produits. Ses autres crédits de Kiva lui a permis de faire entretien a sa maison pour ses enfants. Dans le futur, et voudrait louer une boutique et prendre le crédit plus vite qu’avant.
texts.en:
Sophie G. is married to Francois De Souza. Born on September 19, 1963, she was provided with schooling through the 9th grade. Of her five children (ages 27, 25, 22, 13, and 11), the last four are in her care and are all in school. She started selling cloth 28 years ago. Currently, she sells "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) and damask door-to-door, acquiring her goods from the Missébo market. Presently, she has seen a drop in sales. Her other Kiva loans have allowed her to maintain her house for her children. In the future, she would like to rent a shop and borrow money more quickly than before.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (traditional Beninese clothing)

loans.name: Buenaventura Ojetaciano

texts.es:
El señor Buenaventura Ojetaciano C. tiene la edad de 43 años, su estado civil es soltero, Don Buenaventura no tiene hijos, sus propósitos son de mantener siempre activo su negocio por lo que actualmente depende totalmente de este ya que solo así obtiene ganancias para darle la ayuda a su hermano y a sus sobrinos que son su familia, sus deseos son de establecerse en un mejor lugar ya que le gustaría obtener su propio lugar como una pulpería en donde ofrezca sus productos y le gustaría que el establecimiento fuera en su casa de habitación, sus sueños son de remodelar su humilde vivienda por lo que tiene que enseñarles a sus sobrinos los sacrificios que malogrado para conseguir estos propósitos por lo que ya tiene un record crediticio con la Fundación León 2000 por lo que el comportamiento que ha tenido ha sido muy bueno y todo esto lo ha logrado por su empeño en el trabajo ya que es un hombre luchador que le gusta el trabajo y reconoce que solo así se puede lograr lo que se propone.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de golosinas y gaseosas, la ubicación de su negocio es en el costado norte de la UNAN por lo que su venta permanece en las afueras de la universidad, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años, Don Buenaventura inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que desde muy pequeño le enseñaron a trabajar y dio inicio a este negocio con pocos productos ya que en una pequeña canasta donde introducía cigarrillos y caramelos el método que utilizaba para lograr vender era que recorría las calles mas transitadas de León y en donde se reunían mucho estudiantes ya que estos compraban los cigarrillos y esto era muy agotador ya que su casa de habitación queda a una distancia muy larga por lo que mas tarde decide buscar un en donde establecerse y esto le es posible porque tenia que encontrar un lugar donde transitaran muchas personas por lo que decide quedarse en las afueras de la UNAN en donde ofrece sus productos Don Buenaventura posee 2 créditos con la Fundación y su record ha sido bueno por lo que ahora solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que incrementar sus productos ya que ha tenido demanda de clientes además sus compras las realiza en las diferentes distribuidoras de León para conseguir le producto de manera mas favorable retribuye a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que se interesan en los pequeños empresarios.
texts.en:
Buenaventura Ojetaciano C. is 43 years old and single. His goal is to keep his business going because he totally depends on it as his only source of income and a means to help his brother, nieces and nephews, his only family. He most wants to set the business up in a better place because he would like to have his own shop, preferably in his house, a grocery where he can sell his merchandise. He dreams of remodeling his humble house and teaching his nieces and nephews the importance of hard work in reaching your goals. Buenaventura has borrowed from Fundacion Leon 2000 before and his performance has been very good. He's made a success of the business because he's persistent and because he knows that he can get what he wants if he works hard.

Buenaventura makes a living selling snacks and cold drinks. His business is located on the northern edge of UNAN, just outside the university. He's operated the business for 20 years. He started it on his own, having learned to work hard from the time he was a boy, with only a few products kept in a basket, selling cigarettes and candy to passers-by. He worked as a street vendor around Leon where he met a lot of students who were customers for the cigarettes he sold. The work was exhausting because his house was far away, so he decided to find a spot to set up permanently. He had to find a place with a lot of passers-by so he decided on the street near UNAN. Buenaventura has borrowed from Fundacion twice and has a good payment record. He's now applying for a loan which he will use for working capital. He'll increase the range of products he sells to meet customer demand and buy from different distributors in Leon so that he can get a favorable return for Fundacion Leon 2000 and the organizations that are interested in helping small businessmen.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Rk

texts.en: RK A. is a 70-year-old married man with six children.  To support his family, he sells stationery.  He is hoping to expand his business, so he is now requesting a loan in the amount of $275 (40,000 NGN) in order to purchase more stationery for resale purposes.  He thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional stationery

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Agée de 39 ans, Mme Akossiwa H. est mariée et compte (07) personnes à charge. Elle réalise comme activité la fabrication de la farine de manioc. En effet, elle achète du manioc dans les fermes chez les paysans et le transforme en farine de manioc. 
Afin de satisfaire la demande du marché, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter en quantité suffisante un grand champ de manioc.
texts.en:
Ms. Akossiwa H., age 39, is married and has seven people to support. Her work involves producing cassava flour. In essence, she buys cassava on farms from rural suppliers and processes it into cassava flour. To satisfy the market demand, she's requesting financing to buy a large enough cassava field.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell cassava flour

loans.name: Meafou

texts.en: Meafou I. is 52 years old and married with 9 children.  She has many years experience in the fishing business. She sells to the people in her village 3 days per week. She has1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Meafou’s only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This loan will be used to buy items to maintain the good standards of her business.

loans.use: Purchase a new canoe and fishing equipments

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic C. is a 35-year-old single parent. She and her husband separated two years ago and she was left with their two children: Mark Anthony, 12, and Antonette, 9. Both of them are in the elementary level of education. She promised herself to think in a positive way and to have a positive attitude for her children.

Marivic manages a little store in their village that supports the needs of her family financially. She wants to make her business grow and because of this, she would like to borrow PHP 5,000.00 so that she can buy more stocks of groceries for her store and hopefully be able to sell meat and fish. She is also engaged in selling eggs and ducks in their public market for additional income. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that her two children will finish their studies.

According to Marivic, she is now content with her life. She knows that she and her children can survive with the help of God and with her patience in working.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy work tools and raw materials

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Née dans la ville d’agomé séva, cette dame est venu s’installée  depuis 1988 dans la vile de Lomé. Elle est veuve et elle a la charge de ses 4 enfants. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de ses enfants est le commerce de charbons de bois. Une partie de son stock a été détruit par la pluie, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 27 sacs de charbons de  bois.
texts.en:
Born in the city of Agomé Séva, this lady came to the city of Lomé in 1998 to get established. She is a widow is alone in caring for her four children. The business that she has for earning an income, and that allows her to provide for her children, is commerce in charcoal. A portion of her inventory was destroyed by the rain. She wants to resupply herself and is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 27 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is fifty-two years old and the married mother of eight children: three sons and five daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She says one is in the university. Grace lives with her children and husband in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Grace is a baker - she bakes bread in her community. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi.

Grace has been in business for over twenty-five years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
Hà Lê Thị (1016071516) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Hà owns and operates a business running a food stall, primarily selling herbs and spices in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

In 2003, Hà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Hà is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter M. is married to Monicah Wanjiru and they have two school-going children. He runs a general shop that sells food and household goods in small quantities to the residents of a city council estate in Naivasha Town. Peter became interested in joining KADET after hearing some of his friends talking about it and how it had assisted them in boosting their businesses. This is Peter's second loan from KADET and he plans to increase the variety of household goods he sells to his clients so that they may get most of the things they need in his shop without needing to go far away to other shops. Peter's dream is to one day move into a bigger premises and open a mini supermarket. He also hopes to venture into the restaurant business. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy more stock for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
“Doing something better is producing a bundle of success”, this is the guiding principle of Solidad, a resident of Cutog Grande, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. For the past eight months, she has managed a general store in their village. According to her, she earns a weekly net income of PHP 1,200.00 that she uses as rolling capital for her business. She hopes for continuous growth for her store and is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 from Kiva lenders. She is hoping that her loan will be granted.

Solidad is 59-years old. She is married to Nicolas and they are blessed with nine children. The couple is happy from the blessings that they are receiving. Four of her children are already married, some are working and others are still dependent on them. Solidad is working hard, is determined to provide a better life for her family and to save for their needs as they grow older.

loans.use: To provide additional capital

loans.name: Inna

texts.en: Inna is married with two children. She sells clothing at small markets located in the area. Inna has been in this business for 13 years. She enjoys selling clothing. She has got many repeated clients that use her services. Inna is a hard working and much disciplined person. She makes sure that she has items that her clients would want to buy from her. Inna would like to borrow 6,100 UAH to increase the assortment. This business is the only source of income for Inna and her family.

loans.use: to increase the assortmetn

loans.name: Ayllin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ayllin es una persona dinámica y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 33 años, es madre soltera tiene un hijo menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y productos de belleza. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas ll” desde hace tres años. El primer préstamo que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en perfumes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3000 soles, utilizará una parte en comprar productos de belleza y otra parte invertirá en blusas, pantalones y polos. La meta de Ayllin es tener un bazar  con artículos para toda ocasión.

loans.use: Invertirá una parte en comprar productos de belleza y otra parte invertirá en blusas, pantalones y polos.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana tiene 45 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos. Desde pequeña ayudó a sus padres en las tareas del campo, tales como sembrar y cuidar a los animales. Ahora, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingresos económicos, ella tiene ganado vacuno y ovino, y también animales menores como pollos y cuyes. Los productos que ella siembra son la papa y el maíz y con ambas actividades ha venido solventando las necesidades de su casa durante todos estos años, trabajando junto a su esposo. Para más adelante, Maximiliana desea tener un establo más grande donde pueda albergar a más animales y más extensiones de terreno para incrementar su producción agrícola.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasmada con el trabajo en equipo que viene realizando en su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono para sembrar más maíz.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plaster and flooring for house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on bean, charcoal, wheat, and oil

loans.name: Lina

texts.pt:
Lina nasceu em Gaza tem 47 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 27 aos 12 anos, os três mais novos é que vão a Escola. Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue por mês poupar 1.500.00MT.
 Lina sai de Gaza para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Swazilândia com o seu irmão mais velho este que era trabalhador dos Regis to civil naquele distrito. Chegado a Namaacha ingressa a Escola, no mesmo ano fica grávida do seu esposo e teve que interromper os estudos porque na altura era proibido estudar nesse estado. Casa se com o seu marido e cinco dias depois este abandona­a emigrando se para a África do Sul, deixou uma carta que só foi descoberta 6 meses depois alegando que ia a procura de emprego ate então. A vida fica difícil ela pede ajuda ao irmão e este arranja um emprego para ela no Regis to Civil como servente onde trabalha durante 5 anos. Após findar o contracto, junta se com o actual marido este que passou a vier com ela em sua casa. Com o fundo colectado no serviço ela inicia o seu próprio negócio de venda de capulanas adquirida em maputo e revendia na swazilândia. O seu negócio foi crescendo e já não conseguia satisfazer a necessidades dos clientes, então aproxima a hluvuku e kiva solicitando um empréstimo pela quarta vez para aumentar o stock de mercadoria. Hoje tem como melhor produto (lençóis, mantas, duvetes e cortinas) adquirido a 400.00MT, a 500.00MT, a 350.00MT e revende a 1000.00MT, a 1250.00MT, e a 600mt consecutivamente. Tem tido um lucro mensal de 8.000.00MT. 

Este é o quarto empréstimo de lina na hluvuku e segundo com kiva. o  primeiro de 11.000.00MT foi para comprar diversos tipos de roupas tais como (blusas, lençóis, duvetes, mantas, calças e cortinas),o segundo de 15.500.00MT foi para aumentar o volume de mercadoria, o terceiro de 20.000.00MT foi usado para ampliar  a obra da  sua cozinha que já esta quase concluída. Estes 25.000.00MT serão usados para aumentar o volume dos seus negócios. Está construindo boutique, pois a idade já não ajuda para fazer entraga domiciliaria.
texts.en:
Lina was born in Gaza and is 47. She lives with her husband and her four children whose ages range between 12 and 27. The three youngest go to school. She isn't responsible financially for anyone else and saves 1,500 meticais a month.

Lina left Gaza for the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland with her oldest brother, who was working for the registry office in that district. When she arrived to Namaacha, she enrolled in school. In that same year, she became pregnant and had to stop studying because at that time it wasn't allowed to go to school while pregnant. She got married, and five days later, her husband abandoned her and left for South Africa. He left a letter that she only discovered 6 months later claiming that he was going to look for a job. Her life was difficult, so she asked her brother for help, and he got her a job at the registry office where she worked for 5 years. After she finished her contract, she married her current husband who now lives with her in her home. With the money she made from her job, she started her own business selling capulanas (robes/dresses) which she acquired in Maputo and resold in Swaziland. Her business has grown and she can't satisfy her customers' demand anymore. She is turning to Hluvuku and Kiva for her fourth loan so she can increase her stock of merchandise. Today she has better products (sheets, blankets, duvets, pants, and curtains). She buys these items for 400, 500, and 350 meticais and resells them for 1,000, 1250, and 600 meticais. She makes a monthly profit of 8,000 meticais.

This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku and her second with Kiva. Her first one was for 11,000 meticais to buy various types of clothing like blouses, sheets, duvets, blankets, pants, and curtains). Her second one was for 15,500 meticais to increase her volume of merchandise. Her third was for 20,000 meticais to expand her kitchen, which is now complete. This one is for 25,000 meticais, which she will use to increase the volume of her business. She is building a boutique because at her age she doesn't want to make deliveries to people's homes anymore.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell clothing and other textiles

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane M. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 28 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife O., 22, likes to cook different food. Married to Arvin Padayao, a sales clerk, she makes herself busy by managing her own mini food stand and helping her husband earn money.  She has been selling different kinds of homemade food for four years.

Marife has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than three years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently.

Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times from CCT’s Cooperative.  The reason why she was consistent in paying her dues was because she used almost all the money she borrowed as added capital for her food business.  Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 18,000 per month.  

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be mostly used as a source of added capital for expanding her business by buying different food ingredients and seasoning for the food that she sells in her food stand.

She dreams that one day her mini food stand will become a restaurant for their family business. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy different food ingredients and seasoning for the food she sells

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en: Lilybeth G. is from the village of Miputak. She is 49 years old. Lilybeth is married and has four children. Some of them are adults and one is a student. To make a living, Lilybeth operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Lilybeth has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2006, Lilybeth joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilybeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase construction materials for a house repair. Lilybeth is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This fishing activity is managed by her husband. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Lilybeth from PMPC and this is her third time published on Kiva. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 40 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, es profesora de manualidades, ya son 3 años que trabaja en el colegio. La socia también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de manualidades para compromisos sociales como matrimonios, bautizos y confirmaciones, ella nos cuenta que hace sus manualidades en su pequeño taller que implemento es su domicilio. La socia forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa, desde hace un año, ella requiere el préstamo de los 800 soles, que invertirá en la compra de materiales como detentes. La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
The member is a hard-working, entrepeneurial woman. She is 40 years old, married, has 3 children, and lives in the city of Cusco. She teaches others how to make handicrafts, work that she's been doing for 3 years. She also has a small business selling handicrafts for social events such as marriages, baptisms and confirmations. The member told us that she makes her handicrafts in a small workshop that she set up at home. The member has been a member of the Asociacion Arariwa's Inti community bank for one year. She needs an 800-soles loan that she will use to buy materials such as "detentes" (a patch or emblem of the Cross, often worn over the heart). The member is grateful for the opportunity that she's been given this way and, with that in mind, she is committed to repaying the loan on time. (Inti is a Quechua word that means "sun".)

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for handicraft business.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy S. is a local chef. She is also hired by people who need her to cook food for their parties. She is 60 and a widowed mother who has given birth to two daughters. One of the daughters is married and one is single. Suy S. also depends on income from both her daughters, who are garment workers in the industry at Phnom Penh. 

Suy S. has a very old motorcycle that is breaking down frequently. Because of this problem, Suy S. requested a loan of US $400 to be used to replace an old motor.

loans.use: To replace an old motor

loans.name: Morgana

texts.en:
Morgana Q. is a loving mother to her four children. She is married to her supportive spouse, Simeon, a tricycle (three-wheeled transport) driver, and lives in the coastal province of Teresa, Rizal. She and her husband have been running a general store for almost 8 years. Despite many challenges in their life, they never give up fighting against poverty.

Over the course of her membership in ASHI, Morgana has shown very good performance as a member, and she is trusted by ASHI for her solid record. Aside from maintaining an excellent performance in repayment, business, and attendance in ASHI, Morgana has also cared for the needs of her children at home and in school.

She plans to utilize this loan of Php 20,000 to expand and to support her general store as their primary source of daily income. This loan will be used as additional working capital to pay for groceries for her general store, for inventory such as school supplies, sacks of rice, canned goods, and other groceries.

Morgana hopes the loans from ASHI, KIVA's field partner, will support the education of all her children. Morgana also dreams of a growing business, of building their own house, having a good life and a happy family as well. She believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty, as well as providing for the educational needs of her children. She is very grateful to ASHI and KIVA for the continuous love and support of her dreams.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To pay for inventory for her general store such as school supplies, sacks of rice, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Grace Lukamika

texts.en:
Grace Lukamika M. is 56 years old, married, with six children. Her husband, Nahashon, is retired from his previous employment. 

In the past Grace was a fruit vendor, but she is now in the business of selling polythene-packaging paper bags. She decided to start her new business because selling fruit alone was not proving profitable and sustainable enough. Grace sells the wrapping bags in retail markets and she also distributes them to other small traders. 

Grace and her group joined Kadet from another microfinance organization. With this loan, Grace wants to establish her new business venture of selling wrapping bags.

loans.use: To buy more stock of polythene-packaging bags.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is a married woman who supports her family by running a general store. She lives in Balo Barangay Aguisan Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their 3 children who are between 15 and 20 years of age, all in school.

At 48, she has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family M. economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000.

Gloria is now borrowing PHP 16,000 to be used as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her 8th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gloria aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
La señora Efigenia Baez de 59 años está acompañado hace 30 años con el señor Claudelino Benítez de 55 años de edad, la pareja cuenta con cinco hijos  todos mayores de edad de los cuales dos trabaja en el exterior, uno  vive en forma independiente  y los otros dos viven con sus padres ayudando en el trabajo diario y actualmente nadie mas estudia en la casa. 

La Sra. Efigenia está en este negocio hace 26 años, realiza Confecciones de ropas sobre pedido, su esposo cuenta con su propia carpintería, juntos tienen buen ingreso mensual siempre ayudado por los hijos y con eso mejorar cada dia el nivel de la familia e ir mejorando la infraestructura de la casa.

Solicita este préstamos para compra de telas y maderas que cada uno utilizará en su negocio y asi ofrecer a sus clientes buenos articulos.
texts.en:
Sra. Efigenia Baez is 59 years old and has been married 30 years to Sr. Claudelino Benítez, who is 55. The couple has five adult children: two of them work abroad, one lives independently, and the other two still live with them and help with the daily work. No one in the household is currently attending school.

Sra. Efigenia has been making clothes by order for 26 years. Her husband has his own carpentry shop. Together they generate a good monthly income. Their children always help them, thereby improving both the standard of living for their family and the infrastructure of their house.

Sra. Efigenia is requesting a loan to buy fabric for her sewing business and wood for her husband’s carpentry shop so that they can offer their customers good products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for her sewing business & wood for her husband's carpentry shop

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a 27-year-old married man. He sells electronics to earn a living. In addition, he provides "boda boda" (motorbike) transport and is employed in a pharmacy. He strives to put a balance between his businesses and employment. For this reason, he has employed one person to help him in his electronic shop.  

He is a member of the Githunguri Hope group in Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner.  Being in this group, he can easily access loans from Faulu Kenya because the group members guarantee for each other to get loans. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more electronics. He hopes to grow his business so that he may be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy electronics for sale

loans.name: Vicenta Del Rosario

texts.es: Vicenta Del Rosario tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues a pesar de que tiene 59 años tiene muchas energías para salir adelante. Ella inicio esta actividad por su esposo quien anteriormente se dedicaba a esta actividad, pues tenía que mantener a su familia con el paso del tiempo su esposo fallece y ella y sus hijos decidieron hacerse cargo. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como pescados, jaibas, camarones, conchas y punches. Su deseo es tener un establecimiento en donde ofrezca comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vicenta Del Rosario sells seafood. She has been in this business for 14 years. Despite the fact that she is 59 years old, she has a lot of energy to get ahead. She started this activity because of her husband. He used to sell seafood because he had to support his family. Later, her husband died. She and her children decided to take over the business. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy raw material like fish, blue crab, shrimp, conch, and crab. She wishes to have an establishment where she can make her customers comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pedro Ricardo

texts.es:
Pedro de 54 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, para poder mantener a su familia el tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en víveres para una tienda, ya que su sueño siempre fue seguir los mismos pasos de sus padres que tenían una tienda cuando el era niño.  

Con esfuerzo y dedicación estuvo durante muchos años trabajando en su tienda para agrandarla, ahora el trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 23h00pm todos los días en su tienda, vende enlatados, arroz, azúcar etc. 

Para poder incrementar su tienda con mas víveres quiere comprar con el préstamo embutidos y bebidas y con las ganancias asegurar el futuro de su familia. Uno de sus sueños es tener un Minimarket.
texts.en:
Pedro, 54, lives in the peri-urban zone of Guayaquil. In order to support his family, he had to invest their savings in supplies for a store. His dream was always to follow in the same footsteps of his parents who owned a shop when he was a child. He has put many years of hard work and dedication into working in his store in order to enlarge it. Now, he works from 7:00 am until 11:00 pm every day in his shop selling canned goods, rice, sugar etc. He wants to use the loan to enlarge his store by buying more supplies such as sausages and drinks. The profits will secure his family’s future. One of his dreams is to own a Minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sausages, drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock up on merchandise to better supply her grocery store

loans.name: Apolonia Alejandrina

texts.es:
Apolonia tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el sector Tocororo, perteneciente al distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, provincia de Chepén, en la región La Libertad, una zona ubicada a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores relacionadas a la agricultura desde hace ocho años, ella cuenta con un terreno agrícola de 0.5 hectáreas en el cual suele sembrar todo tipo de granos, en esta oportunidad ella ha sembrado maíz, y esta trabajando arduamente para que su cultivo pueda brindar una buena producción. Es siguiendo este objetivo que ella desea amplicar a su cultivo abonos y foliares, por ello ha solcicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Apolonia es una mujer empeñosa y que da lo mejor de si para sacar a su familia adelante, su mayor anhelo es obtener una buena coseha que le permita seguir trabajando para lograr el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Apolonia, 48, lives with her family in Tocororo which is part of Pueblo Nuevo, Chepén province, La Libertad region. It is an area located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For eight years she has been involved in farming related activities. She has a 0.5 hectare plot of farm land where she grows all kinds of grains. On this occasion, she has planted corn and is working hard to insure a productive harvest. It is in order to reach this goal that she needs to apply manures and fertilizers so she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan. Apolonia is a dedicated woman who gives the best of herself to help her family get ahead in life. Her greatest wish is to obtain a good harvest that will allow her to continue working towards attaining her family’s wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and leaf fertilizers for her corn crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en:
Eline P. is 26 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Eline has 2 years of experience in this business.  Eline needs a loan of WST$1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.


In 2008, Eline joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.  SPBD's loans are Eline's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Señoras Del Sur Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “Señoras del Sur”, es un grupo que está iniciando el ciclo número 11, en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación, consta de nueve integrantes, a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora María Justina como Presidenta, la señora Catalina como Tesorera y la señora Fabiola como Secretaria de Actas.

La  señora presidenta, tiene como negocio la venta de electrodomésticos y celulares, desde hace seis años.  Inició este negocio acompañada de su esposo, quien actualmente le ayuda  en las ventas, en su puesto en la Feria de la zona 16 de Julio.  

Su primer crédito fue utilizado para la compra de celulares y artefactos. Su solicitud actual es de Bs. 5000.- para la compra de más mercadería.  Con respecto a su permanencia en Pro Mujer, ella ya está más de cuatro años en su asociación.
Las integrantes de la A.C. “Señoras del Sur” tienen diferentes negocios, entre ellos de servicio: venta de comida;  comercio venta de electrodomésticos y celulares.
texts.en:
The “Señoras del Sur” (Ladies of the South) is a group that is starting its 11th cycle in the Villa Exaltación Focal Center. It has nine members led by María Justina, President, Catalina, Treasurer and Fabiola, Recording Secretary. Madame President has sold home appliances and cellular phones for the last 6 years. She started the business with her husband, who still helps with sales, in her stand in the 16 de Julio Market. Her first loan was used to buy cellular phones and accessories. Her current request is for Bs.5000 to buy more merchandise. With respect to her history with Pro Mujer, she’s been in her association for more than four years now. The members of the “Señoras del Sur” communal bank have different service and commercial businesses among which are: food sales and home appliance and cellular phone sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances and cellular phones.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana B. is from the village of Plaridel. She is 63 years old, widowed and has 6 adult-aged children. Romana owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Romana has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Romana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. Romana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Romana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Tercer Cuartel Group

texts.es: La Sra. Olivia S. D. es integrante de este grupo.  Ella es originaria de esta comunidad ha vivido ahí 35 años y se dedica a  la elaboración de costuras desde hace 5 años.  Sus clientes frecuentes son sus vecinos y familiares que viven cerca de su domicilio. Ya que sus costuras las vende por encargos tales como: manteles, servilletas, carpetas, entre otros. Tiene 35 años, estudio hasta la secundaria. Es madre soltera de 2 hijas, que actualmente dependen de ella.  Quiere este crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que durante 5 años le ha dado la oportunidad de mantener sus hijas. Y desea que con el prestamo su negocio se siga fortaleciendo, ya que tiene varios pedidos de servilletas por elaborar.   La Sra. Olivia también se dedica al trabajo domestico, donde obtiene un ingreso para la educación de sus hijas. Y desea invertir el crédito en la compra de materia prima (estambres, hilos y telas) para la elaboración de sus costuras.
texts.en: Ms. Olivia S. D. is a member of this group. She is originally from this community, having lived here for 35 years. She works as a seamstress. Her regular customers are her neighbors and family who live near her house. The items which she sews and sells are tablecloths, napkins, and cloth book covers, among others.  She is 35 years old and has a high school education. She is a single mother of 2 daughters that currently depend on her. She wants this loan so that she can continue investing in her business that for the last 5 years has given her the opportunity to support her daughters. She hopes that with the loan her business will continue growing and already she has several orders for napkins to make. Ms. Olivia also works as a house cleaner, where she received an income to pay for the education of her daughters. She wants to invest the loan in buying raw materials (yarns, threads, fabrics) to make her products.

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Tiacaque Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama TIACAQUE porque es el nombre de la comunidad y el significado del nombre es “lugar donde nace agua entre peñascos” dado que la comunidad está en una lomita y se sitúa entre algunas presas. Está ubicado en la comunidad de Tiacaque, México, y se caracteriza por tener un centro turístico llamado por el mismo nombre de la comunidad, en donde se dedican a la cría de truchas; a un costado se localizan las comunidades de san francisco cheje y Ejido de Malacota  es un lugar donde las personas por lo general se dedican al ganado como cría de borregos, becerros, güilos, en general animales silvestres.  El grupo está conformado por  12  integrantes. Una de las integrantes del grupo se llama María Cristina O. M. Tiene 28 años estudió hasta la secundaria, comenta que busca ayudar a su esposo con su negocio para que sus hijos puedan llegar a ser unos profesionistas y su vez aprendan como se maneja el negocio para que ellos después puedan tener el suyo, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos (una mujer y un hombre). María Cristina  se dedica a la cría y venta de borregos que comercializa en, el tianguis de Ixtlahuaca los lunes y también con vecinos y parientes principalmente, se inicio desde hace 4 años en el negocio sin pensar que fuera a ser esta actividad una fuente de ingreso, le ha gustado mantener el negocio porque con el dinero que saca puede darle algunas comodidades a sus hijos y en especial que no les ha falta para comer. Su dedicación y perseverancia harán posible que tenga buenas ventas, puesto que anteriormente ha enfrentado diferentes dificultades como cuando enferman los animales y mueren, pero con el crédito se ayudará a salir adelante de esos problemas y tener su negocio a salvo.
texts.en:
This group is called “TIACAQUE” because that’s the name of the community and the name means “place where the water rises between cliffs” because the community is located on top of a small hill and between some dams.  

It is located in the community of Tiacaque, México, which has a tourist center of the same name noted for its trout hatcheries.  Adjacent are the communities of San Francisco Cheje and Ejido de Malacota.  It’s a place where residents, for the most part, raise livestock: sheep, calves, doves and wild animals in general.

The group has 12 members.  One of them is María Cristina O. M., 28.  She finished secondary school and she comments that she wants to use her business to help her husband so that their children can become professionals as well as learn to run a business so that some day they can have their own.

She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl.  She raises sheep that she sells in the Ixtlahuaca market on Mondays and also to neighbors and relatives primarily.

She started four years ago not thinking it would become a source of income.  She enjoys the business because profits she earns from it provide a few comforts for her children but especially guarantees that they have enough to eat.

Her dedication and perseverance will make good sales possible because she has faced difficulties, like animal disease and death, in the past.  However, with help from the loan she will rise above these problems and keep her business safe.

loans.use: To restart her cattle raising business.

loans.name: Fatimatou

texts.fr: G. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, son mari est un chauffeur de camion, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de  maïs, mil et sorgho. elle s’approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans le marché local d'anié. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce commerce. le crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre d'acheter 5 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de mil et 2 sacs de sorgho
texts.en: G. is a 36-year old woman. She is married and the mother of three. Her husband is a truck driver. She makes a living by selling corn and sorghum. She stocks up in the interior of the country at the local market of Anié. She has over 10 years of experience in this business. The loan she is seeking will allow her to purchase five bags of corn, two bags of millet and two bags of sorghum.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Alan

texts.es:
El señor Alan es  soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en anticretico junto a su madre ya que su padre se alejo de la familia, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Villa Fátima barrio Petrolero de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente tiene 23 años; después de titularse en la Universidad, trabajará como abogado en un buffet, actualmente es egresado de la carrera de derecho y la especialización dura un año.

El crédito lo utilizará para pagar su matricula en la universidad Andina, y trabaja actualmente como auxiliar en la corte suprema de justicia. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Alan is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives in anticretico (a special rental system offered in Bolivia) with his mother since his father left the family.  Their house is located in Villa Fátima district, in the Petrolero neighborhood of the city of La Paz.

Alan is 23 years old.  After graduating from University, he will work as a lawyer in a lawyer's office.  He has currently completed his law degree and his specialization course will last a year.

He will use his loan to register at the Universidad Andina.  He currently works as an assistant in the Supreme Court which is how he makes income for his household.

This is Alan's first loan and the socio-economic analysis we have performed qualifies him favorably to take a loan.

loans.use: Cost of registering at the Universidad Andina to pursue a specialization course

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Helen is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. She also buys and sells vegetables & fruits like tomatoes, squash, string beans & sweet bananas. Helen has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Roger Danilo

texts.es:
El señor Roger Danilo R. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Francisco de la ciudad de Choluteca y  es una persona muy honrada y trabajadora, Roger se dedica a la venta de productos para construccion arena, grava y ladrillos, distribuye su producto a la mayoria de las personas que construyen en su localidad. Roger tiene su propio camion para transportar sus materiales.
Roger cuenta con buenos principios morales y religiosos y trabaja muy fuerte para seguir creciendo y mejorando su calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de arena, grava y ladrillos.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Danilo R. is 54 years old, he lives in the San Francisco neighborhood of the town of Choluteca, and he is a very honest and hard-working man. Roger engages in selling construction supplies such as sand, gravel and bricks; he distributes his product to the majority of the constructors of his community. Roger uses his own truck to transport his supplies.
A man of good moral and religious principles, Roger works very hard to keep on growing and on improving the quality of his life.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy sand, gravel and bricks.
He needs the income to cover for his household expenses.

loans.use: To buy sand, gravel and bricks.

loans.name: La Buena Vida 4 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the coordinator of her group L. Buena vida 4 (The Good life). She operates a business selling catalog products, especially shoes and cosmetics. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. 

Ramona is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing new inventory. She will use the profits to re-invest and to save. She says that her most difficult challenge is to pay her daughter's fees at the university. She is working hard because she wants to see her daughter become a doctor. She thanks you all for your support. 

Ramona's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, shoes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong R. is a 52-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a fisherman in his community. She has seven children; five are married, the other two are single, and they are employed in various jobs. Kong R. owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. Kong R. uses this land to grow rice crop, and she could get the great result from her farming business almost every season. Kong R. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will use this land for doing farming. 

Note: Kong R. and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland for doing farming.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Mrs. Sem T. was born in 1984.  She lives in Prey Kduoch village, in Takeo province, with her husband and two children, who are too small to work or study. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sary Neam, is a construction worker and a duck breeder who earns some money from selling duck eggs to help sustain the family. Since his business is going well, she wants to help him expand it. To support this goal, she is seeking a loan to buy more duck food.

loans.use: to buy more duck food

loans.name: Velonique

texts.en: Velonique is 30 years old, and married to a mechanic. They have three children between three and eight years old. Velonique sells various items such as salt, cooking oil, and soap. She has been in this business for one year.She has requested this loan in order to add more items to her business.  She will use the profits to reinvest in her business for its continued growth.

loans.use: To buy salt, cooking oil and soap to resell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma ; la socia tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica a la agricultura ella siembra verduras como zanahoria, lechuga, tomate entre otros, la socia a la vez compra y vende fruta y otras verduras que no produce, la socia lleva su mercadería a vender a las distintas ferias que se encuentran en el Valle Sagrado y en el mercado de Huancaro de Cusco, la socia es una persona bien emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia .

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas para su chacra y para comprar otros productos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "LOS ANGELES” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Urubamba, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cuzco.

The member is Irma. She is 38 years old and in a common law marriage. She has 2 children. She works in agriculture, planting vegetables such as carrots, lettuce, and tomatoes, among others. She also buys and sells fruit and other vegetables that she doesn't produce.She takes her merchandise to sell at different fairs in the Valle Sagrado and in the Huancaro de Cusco market. She is a very enterprising person and really wants to get ahead with her family.  

She is asking for the loan to buy seeds for her plot of land and to buy pther products for her business. 

The member is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy seeds for her plot of land and to buy other products for her business.

loans.name: Sirida

texts.en:
Sirida N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Sirida has a business of selling fish. She has been in this business for three years, and she works six days out of every week. Sirida sells her products at the market. 

She has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of fish and firewood. The main business challenge for Sirida is seasonality. Her goal is to build her own home. Sirida lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy baskets of fish and firewood

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar: احمد في عمر 25 سنة اعزب يعمل في زرع الأرض وبيع المحاصيل له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب عمله ويحب ان يطوره من خلال استحداث اساليب جديدة في الزراعة له زبائن من المحيط يحب العمل يحلم في تأمين مستقبل جيد حتى يتمكن من ان يبني عائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مولد للكهرباء لدعم الزراعة في الأرض وايضا يصبح لديه مدخول ثاني طموح ولا يريد ان يكون محدود العمل
texts.en: Ahmad is 25 years old and unmarried. He works in agriculture, planting crops and selling the produce. He has 5 years experience in this. He loves his work and is always seeking to develop it by adopting the latest agricultural methods. He has many local customers. He aspires to secure his future so that he may settle down with his own family. With this loan he wants to purchase an electricity generator to support his work and hopes that it will become a second source of income for him and help increase his workload.

loans.use: to purchase an electricity generator to support his agricultural work.
