Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cool beverages, fresh fruits and other items for resale.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy, 50, is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She farms, earning $1.50 a day to help cover the family’s expenses. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $2.50 a day. Their standard of living has improved since Savy and her husband have worked in these businesses.

Savy is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase groceries to help one of her children expand their business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to help one of her children expand their business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is an honest and hardworking woman. She has one child. For 10 years Firuza has been running a farming business. She cultivates potatoes and sells them after harvest. Furuza tries to work harder because she wants to make a good profit and build a house. 

Firuza is requesting a loan of 3,000 TJS to purchase seed and fertilizer for her land to improve her harvest.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Edgar Omar

texts.en:
Edgar is 44-years-old and lives in the city of Tulcán, a bordertown on Ecuador's border with Colombia.  He is divorced and lives with his family which includes three children, ages 22, 13, and 11 years old.  Edgar is a hardworking, flexible, persistent, and humble person. 

His business is a butcher shop and he will use this loan to purchase a freezer.  His shop is located in a central position in the general market.  He began his business with the support of his parents and confirms that their support was fundamental in helping him begin his business.  Edgar's shop is an established business with a steady clientele.  This is his first loan and he hopes that having a freezer will increase his sales so that he can give a better life to his children.  His goal is to give his children a good education, to encourage them to do honest work, and to teach them to have faith in themselves.  In the photo, Edgar is providing a customer with his products in his butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for his butcher shop

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Momina, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, YAOUSSA, qui assise au milieu, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour (sarclage) pour entretenir environs 0,5  hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 20 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Group Benkadi I are married women who are on average 47 years old with four children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Momina, one of the villages in Massigui Township in Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (Mali's second administrative region).
They are partnering with micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate include rice and groundnuts. They are on their first collaboration with the organization.
The woman sitting in the middle, Yaoussa, intends on using this new loan to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment, and to pay for plowing and weeding costs to maintain about 1.2 acres of rice and groundnuts.
After the harvest, the production is sold in the town of Massigui to a clientele comprising men and women. This group expects to make an average profit of about 20,000 CFA per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and small equipment.

loans.name: Julieth

texts.es: Julieth con su anterior credikiva confeccionó uniformes y compró sabanas, cubrelechos y calzado, con el cual aumentó un poco su capital e incrementó el potencial de clientes con sus ofertas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará carnes frías, calzado, ropa para damas, y materias primas para confeccionar uniformes para los cuales fue contratada. Su experiencia en el mercado y en la confección, hacen que esta inversión cuente con una alta probabilidad de éxito. Julieth envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva:“Agradecimientos por la confianza en mi negocio, responderé con responsabilidad en el pago puntual del crédito.” Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Julieth ingrese al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/219029
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Julieth made uniforms and bought sheets, bedspreads and footwear, with which she increased her capital a little bit and expanded her customer base. Currently she is applying for another Kiva loan, which she plans to use to purchase cold meats, footwear, women's clothing and materials to make the uniforms for which she has been hired. She has experience in sales and in sewing, giving this loan a high probability of success. Julieth sends the following message to her Kiva lenders: "Thank you for your confidence in my business. I will respond by responsibly repaying the loan on time." If you wish to know more about Julieth, follow this link: http://kiva.org/lend/219029

loans.use: to purchase cold meats, footwear, women's clothing and materials to make uniforms.

loans.name: Aisse

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée. Elle est animatrice bénévole dans un programme de santé communautaire pour les enfants et les femmes en état de grossesse. Elle exerce en même temps une activité de commerce de produits cosmétiques, d'huile de palme, de tissus teints.Elle le mène avec une de ses trois filles qui a reçu une formation de trois ans en teinture et art ménager.Elle est membre de l'IMCEC depuis son installation et a été élu présidente du conseil d'administration de la caisse de sa localité.Elle a obtenu 4 prêts de l'IMCEC qu'elle a remboursé entièrement. Elle sollicite un autre prêt de 250 000F pour acheter 30litres d'huile de palme, 30litres de citron,60metres de tissus, 10 draps GM et des produits cosmétiques dont la vente lui permettra d'appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille mais aussi de satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Son ambition est de créer une grand magasin de commerce de produits agricole et de tissus teints.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman. She is a volunteer group leader in a community health care program for children and pregnant women. At the same time, she has a business involving cosmetics, palm oil, and dyed cloth. She runs it with the help of one of her three daughters who received three years of training in the dying of cloth and home economics. She has been a member of the micro-finance institution IMCEC since it was set up, and she was elected president of the administrative board of its branch office in her town. She obtained four loans from IMCEC that she repaid completely. She is requesting another loan of 250,000 francs to buy 30 liters of palm oil, 30 liters of citron, 60 meters of cloth, 10 GM sheets, and some cosmetics. The sale of these goods enables her to support her husband to meet the needs of the family but also to meet her own needs. Her ambition is to establish a large store for farm produce and for dyed cloth.

loans.use: to buy 30 liters of palm oil, 30 liters of 'citron', 60 meters of cloth, 10 'GM' sheets, and some cosm

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man; He is living with his wife and two children. He is the only income provider of the family. In 2001, he bought a special truck to be used for vegetables distribution. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 16 years. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his shuttle in order to continue his business operation properly. In the future, and because of his older age, Nazim is planning to hire a part-time employee to help him with the work and keep his truck a stable source of income.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his shuttle

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 20 años de edad, ella esta casada y todavía  no tiene niños ya que quiere tener su casa propia y tener su negocio bien establecido para darles una buena calidad de vida, estudio hasta el tercer año de preparatoria y dice que ya no pudo continuar con sus estudios debido a que se caso muy jovencita y su esposo ya no la dejo estudiar. Ella tiene un puesto de ropa desde hace 3 años y esta pidiendo un crédito para volver a surtir ropa para dama, niños y caballeros como playeras, jeans, chamarras trajecitos para niños y dama también ahorita quiere invertir en calcetas para niña y ropa interior para niño ya que pronto se viene el ciclo escolar y para venderles a los papas el uniforme que ocupan los alumnos. Ella ira a surtir a la ciudad de Moroleón Guanajuato ya que en esa ciudad dan bajos precios en la ropa y eso le conviene a ella por que le podrá gran un poco  mas a lo que venda ella. Angélica sale a ofrecer la ropa a sus conocidas en sus casas ya que no tiene un puesto establecido y es el sueño de ella mas adelante hacer o rentar un local para vender su ropa.
texts.en:
Angélica is 20 years old and married.  She doesn’t have any children yet because she wants to own her own home and have her business established so she can give them a good quality of life.  She studied up to the third year in preparatory school and says that she couldn’t continue with her studies because she married very young and her husband didn’t let her study any longer.  

She has had a clothing stand for three years and is requesting the loan to restock women’s, children’s and men’s clothing such as t-shirts, jeans, jackets, and outfits for children and women.  At this time, though, she also wants to buy socks for little girls and underwear for little boys because the new school term is about to start and she wants to sell their parents items for the school uniforms the students need.  She will go to the city of Moroleón Guanajuato to stock up as this city offers low prices for clothing and is convenient for her because she will be able to earn a bit more profit when she resells.  Angélica will go out and offer her clothing to acquaintances in their homes because she doesn’t have an established stand.  Her dream is to later make or rent a store to sell her clothing.

loans.use: to buy and sell women's, men's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Velmora

texts.en:
Velmora is 31 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 1 child.
Velmora has had a sari-sari store for 3 years. Each month, she earns 10000PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30000PHP to purchase more stock of  groceries to sell.

Velmora has been a member of PMPC for more than 1 year. In the future, Velmora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of  groceries to sell

loans.name: Kenia Yakelin

texts.es:
La señora Kenia tiene 32 años, vive en la aldea el Cerro de Marcovia ahi vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Kania es una mujer trabajadora y honrada, Kenia se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para realizar la produccion y asi tenerlas listas a las 7 de la mañana para repartirlas, trabaja muy fuerte para hacer crecer su negocio, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal, sus ventas han incrementado y su produccion es muy poca.
con una mayor produccion tendra mejores ingresos y asi podra darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Kenia is 32 years old and lives in the village of el Cerro de Marcovia with her husband and 2 children. Kania is an honest and hardworking woman. She makes and sells tortillas. She gets up very early every day to start making tortillas to have them ready by 7 in the morning for distribution.

She works very hard to grow her business. She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and slaked lime. Her sales have increased and her production is very small. With increased production she will have a higher income and will thus be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and slaked lime.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.en:
Katherine is 35 years old with three children all of whom are in  school. She is a widow who has a business selling beer in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.
Katherine has requested this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beer for sale. Katherine will use the extra income from this loan for building a house in future.

loans.use: to able to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Kindet Ole Kipiriro

texts.en:
Kindet is 29 years old and now married with two children. He is still practicing farming and getting god returns.

He is currently applying for his second loan, which he will use to buy more farm supplies like pesticides, seedlings and farming equipment for the next planting season. He serviced his previous loan well and he was able to repay his loan well and on time. He plans to use the profits from this current loan to ensure that his farm has a continuous harvest and is well taken care of.

He is an honest man who has plans to see himself continuing to prosper with his farm produce and grow to large scale farming in the future.

loans.use: to buy more farm supplies

loans.name: Nhuận

texts.en:
N. is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has 4 adult -age children.  To make a living, N. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.   The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  N. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8.736.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  N. is now requesting a new loan of 9.632.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the N. from SEDA.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.632.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Llauquen Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Llauquen”, está conformado por 20 emprendedores, quienes se desempeñan en los rubros de preparación de comida costumbrista, venta de ropa y perfumes. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Castro. 
Nilda integrante del banco comunal y quien en la foto se encuentra en la segunda fila del grupo,en el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha,estando de pie, además está usando anteojos y su cabello corto castaño oscuro. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida costumbrista de la zona del sur de Chile. Entre estas preparaciones se encuentran el milcao, chuchoca, empanadas, pan casero y el curanto. Se desempeña en este rubro desde hace 14 años, ocupa su casa para la preparación de esta comida, para esto cuenta con una cocina a gas, una cocina a leña, una extendedora de masa, fuentes, peroles (Recipiente de metal en forma de media esfera y generalmente con dos asas que se usa para cocinar) y ollas. Comenta que su horario es totalmente flexible y que la temporada de más alta demanda es durante el verano, ya que se realizan muchas fiestas costumbristas y ferias. Sus ingredientes los compra generalmente en supermercados, donde los precios sean más convenientes económicamente. Y de esta manera le ha ido muy bien.
El crédito lo invertirá para construir un quincho para ofrecer sus comidas en el mismo lugar para que sus clientes consuman directamente el producto. Además quiere adquirir un horno industrial para sus preparaciones. Ya que Nilda se dedica al Reitimiento consiste en la matanza y posterior cocción de un chancho (cerdo) y otros alimentos en un caldero para obtener manteca.
Ella vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad, quienes le ayudan a promocionar sus comidas y atraer nuevos clientes. Uno de sus sueños es que uno de sus hijos termine de estudiar, ya que así podrá optar a mejores trabajos. Además le gustaría viajar dentro del país para conocer algunos lugares. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, debido a que puede contar con un capital que le permita invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta con mucha alegría y cariño las reuniones del banco comunal, ya que el grupo es muy unido y solidario. 
Castro es capital de la isla de Chiloé (la isla más grande de América del Sur), en la región de Los Lagos, zona sur austral de Chile. Su paisaje natural se conserva casi en su totalidad sin intervención del hombre. Además posee una cultura de gran riqueza mítica y costumbrista. Uno de sus grandes atractivos son sus Palafitos, edificaciones (casas) construidas sobre pilotes de madera en la ribera, sobre el mar.
texts.en:
This communal bank is named Llauquen.  There are 20 entrepreneurs who work in the areas of preparing traditional food and selling clothing and perfume.  All of them live in the city of Castro.

Nilda is a member of the communal bank; in the photo she is in the middle of the group, in the third row from the bottom, wearing glasses.  She works preparing and selling traditional food in the southern part of Chile.  Among these dishes are "milcao" [potato pancakes], "chuchoca" [potato bread], "empanadas" [meat pies], homemade bread, and "curanto" [clambake].  She has been in this business for 14 years, and she uses her home to prepare the food.  She has a gas stove, a wood-burning stove, a dough spreader, pots (metal cooking containers in the shape of a half-sphere and generally with two handles), and pans.

She says that her schedule is totally flexible and that the season of highest demand is during the summer, since there are many traditional festivals and fairs.  Generally she buys her ingredients in the supermarket, where the prices are better, and in this way it has gone very well for her.

She will use the loan to build a "quincho" [thatched barbecue area] to offer her meals in the same place, so her customers eat the food right there.  Nilda also wants to get an industrial oven for her meals, since she also works in rendering, which consists of killing and later cooking a pig and other food in a cauldron to make lard.

She lives with her husband and two children, ages 19 and 17, who help her advertise her meals and attract new customers.  One of her dreams is that one of her children will finish studying, since in that way there would be better job options.  She also would like to travel throughout the country to know some places.

Nilda is very happy and grateful for the services granted by Fondo Esperanza, since she can count on capital that will allow her to invest in her business.  She also enjoys the communal bank meetings with great happiness and affection, since the group is united and supportive.

Castro is the capital of the island of Chiloé (the biggest island in South America), in the region of Los Lagos, in the south of Chile.  The natural landscape is conserved almost totally without human intervention.  It also has a culture rich in myth and tradition.  The "palafitos," structures (houses) built on wood pilings on the shore above the ocean, are one of the greatest attractions there.

loans.use: to build a "quincho" [thatched barbecue area] where her customers can eat their meals and to get an industrial oven.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva, de 40 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Esta casada y es madre de tres hijos de 20, 19 y 15 años, quienes son estudiantes y aún dependen de ella para su educación, alimentación y demás necesidades. Tiene una casa propia en que pudo comprar con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo, en donde comparte sus días a lado de sus hijos, mientras que su esposo viaja a otros departamentos a realizar trabajos eventuales. El trabajo de Eva consiste en la venta de productos alimenticios como piononos, pan integral, queques a las panderias. En su casa tiene su pequeño negocio, lugar donde se encarga de proveer a sus clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 8 años y lo hace sola, pero Eva es una mujer que no se queda ya que también se dedica a la cría de aves de corral además de sembrar tomates regionales por ciertas temporadas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades y generarse más ingresos asimismo afrontar todas las cuotas programadas. Le gustaría emprender un nuevo proyecto, el de poner un restaurante para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este será el préstamo numero 17  con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más productos para su venta, además de algunos ingredientes y materiales necesarios para incursionar en el negocio de montar un restaurante.
texts.en: Eva, 40, is a good woman, kind and very responsible. She is married and is the mother of 3 children aged 20, 19 and 15, who are students and still depend on her for their education, food and other necessities. She has her own house which she bought with a lot of effort together with her husband and which she shares with children during the day whilst her husband travels to other departments to perform odd jobs. Eva's work consists of cash sales and credit sales of bakery products. She is in charge of placing orders at a wholesale factory that bakes different kinds of products which include sponge cakes, wholemeal bread, cakes. She has a small business in her house where she distributes to her customers. She has been doing this work for 8 years and she does it alone. However, Eva is a woman who is never still as she also raises poultry and also plants regional tomatoes during certain seasons. What she likes about her work is that it allows her to use her time for other activities which gives her a good income and thus she can cover all the scheduled expenses. She would like to undertake a new project which is to set up a restaurant to improve her income. This will be her 17th loan with MFP and as such hopes for your collaboration to pursue her goals. On the other hand, she agrees once again to make her repayments as with the previous loans. With the requested amount she will buy more products for her store as well as a few ingredients and materials to start setting up her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy wholemeal bread, sponge cakes, cakes and other products as well as buy the materials necessary to set up a restaurant.

loans.name: Hector Manuel

texts.es: El señor Héctor Manuel de 44 años es casado y tiene a su cargo un hijo que depende de el económicamente. Hace 19 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, la cual fue haciendo mejoras y donde vio crecer a sus hijos. Para Héctor es muy importante tener en buenas condiciones su vivienda ya que es el lugar que lo cubre de las inclemencias del tiempo. En este momento quiere construir un portal en la parte de enfrente, para que al momento de querer descansar ahí poner su silla y respirar aire puro. El trabaja como voceador de un periódico de la localidad ofreciéndolo en una calle principal. Para que el proyecto se realice necesita comprar  cemento, arena y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Héctor Manuel is 44 years old, married and has a son who depends on him financially.  Nineteen years ago he acquired his home, to which he’s been making improvements, and where he watched his children grow, through a public housing project.  It’s very important for Hector to have his home in good condition, because it protects him from inclement weather.  At this time he wants to build a doorway in the front part of the house, so that he can relax there, set up his chair and breathe in the fresh air.  He works as a salesman for a local newspaper, selling on a main street in town.  In order to be able to complete his project, he must buy cement, sand, and pay for labor.

loans.use: to build a doorway in his home.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is a young entrepreneur from Lanjazat village.  She runs a hairdressing salon. Armine started her business a few months ago and during this period has attracted a large number of clients due to the quality of her services. 

Armine needs to add new equipment to her salon in order to serve all her clients. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase new hairdressing equipment. This loan will allow Armine to increase her income and develop the business further.

loans.use: buy hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 46 years old and is married to a businessman. They have seven children, all of whom go to school. For the past ten years, she has sold clothes. She has requested this loan to buy more clothes to sell. With her profits, she will renovate her house. She would like to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar nació en la ciudad de Sicuani pero actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Edgar tiene 41 años edad, es casado y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. 

Edgar es carpintero y tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde fabrica diferentes tipos de muebles de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Edgar requiere el préstamo para comprar madera. 

Edgar es integrante del banco comunal “Pillao”. Este  grupo está conformado con 13 socios que viven  en la provincia de Cusco del distrito de San Jerónimo.
texts.en:
Edgar was born in the city of Sicuani but currently lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. He is 41 years old, married, and has three children.

Edgar is a carpenter and has a small workshop in his home where he makes different types of wooden furniture. He has been in this business for several years and has done very well. Edgar is requesting a loan to buy wood.

He is a member of the Communal Bank “Pillao”. This group consists of 13 members who live in the District of San Jerónimo in Cusco Province.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Fannafa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Fannafa a été créé le 04 janvier 2010.IL est composé de 12 membres qui sont tous issus du même village. 

Madame Agna qui se trouve à l'extrême droite sur la photo et levant le bras gauche est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et âgée de 30 ans, elle a en charge 4 enfants dont 3 sont ses propres enfants.

Son activité réside dans le commerce des céréales(mil, maïs, arachide)elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années. 

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientéle.

Son objectif est d'accroitre son épargne et participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
The Fannafa community group was formed on 4th January 2010. It has 12 members, all from the same village. Agna, with her arm raised on the far right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 30 years old and married; she has 4 dependent children, 3 of whom are her own. Her business is the selling of cereal products (millet, corn, peanut), and she has been doing this for several years. 
Her loan will allow her to purchase sufficient stock to meet her customers' demand. Her goal is to increase her savings and to assist with covering the family's living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Thiarra's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 28 Décembre 2011. ils sont des membres habitant la même localité et exerçant ensemble la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo, la responsable est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 garçons et 04 filles. Son activité principale est le commerce de tissus brodés. 

Avec le prêt reçu elle va acheter des pièces de tissu et des fils de couleurs différentes pour la confection et elle revend le fini au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec les bénéfices générés, elle renforce ses épargnes, paie ses intérêts et améliore les conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The Sopp Mohamed Gawane group was created December 28, 2011. It is made up of members living in the same area and all running small businesses.

Standing up at the right of the photo is the group leader, a married women and mother of 6 children, 2 boys and 4 girls. Her main business is the sale of embroidered fabrics.

With the loan she receives, she is going to buy pieces of fabric and thread in different colors for sewing and she will sell the finished product at the weekly markets.

With the general profits, she will reinforce her savings, pay her interest and improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pieces of fabric and thread in different colors to sew and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on Business

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born on July 27, 1972 in Attitogon, Mr. K. Yaovi is married and father to one child. He is a driver by trade. Not having the means to practice in his line of work, he was hired by an import-export company where he worked for 3 years as a commercial representative. Today he manages his own store of traditional wrap around fabrics -pagnes- at the big market in Lomé. The responsibilities for his family (he is also caring for his elderly parents) but mostly the acquisition of his goods at retail prices are costing him a lot and is plunging him further into poverty.

He is requesting a loan of $900 to acquire a new store and to get a stock at wholesale prices -less expensive in Ghana- so he can satisfy his increasing clientele here in Togo and also in Benin. This activity is very profitable and deserves to be financed in order to increase his sales so he can achieve financial autonomy, which will likely change his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 27 Juillet 1972 à Attitogon, Monsieur K. Yaovi est marié et père d’un enfant. Il est chauffeur de profession mais n’ayant pas de moyens pour exercer son métier, il s’est fait engager dans une société import-export où il a eu à travailler 3 ans comme Agent Commercial. Aujourd’hui il gère sa propre boutique de pagnes au grand marché de Lomé. Mais le poids de la famille(ses parents devenus vieux sont à sa charge) et surtout l’achat en détail lui revient très cher et le plonge davantage dans la misère.

Il sollicite un crédit de $900 pour acquérir un nouveau magasin et pour s’approvisionner en gros et donc très moins cher au Ghana afin de satisfaire ses clients qui deviennent de plus en plus nombreux ici au Togo et même au Bénin. Cette activité très rentable mérite d’être financé pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires afin d’atteindre une autonomie financière susceptible de changer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Renting of a store and wholesale purchase of traditional fabrics -pagnes-

Location de magasin et approvisionnement en pagnes

loans.name: Samuel Nahum

texts.en:
Samuel is a hard working man who is married and has three children ages 8, 12 and 15. Previously, he worked as a driver, delivering freight that allowed him to rent a trailer. However, the work was scares and the income wasn’t sufficient to support his family and his children’s school expenses. Five years ago, by acquiring the necessary tools, he decided to open his own printing business. Today, he is expanding the products he sells, by including invitations, invoices, and calendars, etc.

Little by little Samuel’s printing shop has been growing, and with the experience he has gained to date his products continue to improve in quality, which has been noticed by his growing clientele. Samuel needs a loan for $475 dollars to be used for the purchase of the supplies and materials, necessary to continue working, and also to renovate his shop, as he lacks space for his machinery. Samuel and his family sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Martha Martinez, Kiva Volunteer.

Samuel es un hombre muy trabajador, es casado y tiene tres hijos de de 8, 12 y 15 años. Antes él trabajaba como chofer entregando fletes, ya que le facilitaban el préstamo de un trailer, el trabajo escaseaba y el ingreso que podía obtener de esta manera no era suficiente para el sustento de su familia y de la educación de sus hijos, así fue como decidió iniciar su propio negocio en la imprenta hace cinco años, adquirió las herramientas necesarias para esto y ahora ha estado ampliando los productos que vende, hace invitaciones, facturas, calendarios, etc.

Poco a poco la imprenta de Samuel ha estado creciendo y con la experiencia que ha adquirido en el negocio, sus productos cada vez son de mejor calidad y así lo hacen notar sus clientes que se incrementan cada vez más, ahora Samuel necesita de un préstamo por $ 475 dólares que empleara en la compra de los insumos que necesita para continuar trabajando y también para ampliar su local porque le falta espacio para la maquinaria que tiene. Samuel y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies, materials and remodeling/  Compra de insumos y remodelación

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 30 years old with two children.The first born is 6 years old and in Pre-Primary and the second born is 2 years old. He graduated with a diploma in electronical mechanics from Kyambogo University.

When he graduated he started a workshop that repairs radios, televisions, DVDs and video decks. He hired a cheap kiosk in Wandegeya, which is a Kampala suburb.The government of Uganda is preparing to host the Commonwealth Heads of State (CHOGM) in November, which has made the government clean the city. It came up with a plan of demolishing all the illegal structures in Kampala City.

Benson wants a loan to rent a better place to re-locate his business. He also want to renovate it so that he offers mechanical services but also sells new and reconditioned radios, televisions, DVDs and video decks.

He wants a loan of US $ 1200 to pay for rent in the new location which he plans to pay back in 6 months.

loans.use: To rent  new premises for expansion

loans.name: Bi Bi Takor

texts.en: Bi Bi Takor lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow, and her husband died 7 years ago. She has 4 sons. They are married and are living out of her home. She is working just for herself. She is a tailor. She has a lot of experience in her job. She wants to expand her business, so she wants to take a group loan to buy new sewing machines to work hard and make a good future for herself. She is happy.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Odalis Maritza

texts.es:
I have a small grocery store called Odalis, which I have run from my house for the last three years. Our clientele is satisfied with the service and attention we provide them, aside from the quality products and low prices. The profits earned with my sales help me cover my financial and family responsibilities.

Translated from Spanish by Wendy Wise, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo una pequeña pulperia llamada Odalis en mi casa de habitacion desde hace tres años. Nuestra clientela se siente satisfecha por la atencion que les brindamos, ademas por los productos de calidad y bajos precios. Los ingresos que percibo por las ventas me ayudan a cubrir los compromisos familiares y financieros

loans.use: Purchase milk, bread, eggs, corn flour, sodas, coffee, sugar and other things

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana is very enterprising and friendly. She has dedicated herself to the preparation and selling of food for many years and is well known for her exquisite cooking along with the courtesy and friendly customer service that characterize her business. This position along with her husband's hardwork has allowed them to open a small store in their home. She is the mother of two small children whom she is very dedicated to and with love and affection is raising them to have good values. Her strength and good spirits have made her well known throughout her neighborhood and every day her clientele increases in her two small businesses; this significant growth is a reflection of her love of cooking and work. However, being an enterprising woman, she wishes to expand into other markets such as cosmetics in order to increase her sources of income and continue building her house. She requests a loan to purchase new products for her businesses. Let us support Ana in realizing her wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Ana, es una mujer emprendedora y amable, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida desde hace muchos años y por la que es muy conocida debido a su excelente sazón y a la gran cortesía y amabilidad que la caracterizan. Este desempeño le ha permitido junto al esfuerzo de su esposo poder aperturar una pequeña bodega en las instalaciones de su hogar.Ella es madre de dos pequeños niños a los que se ha dedicado y con amor y sumo afecto les inculca buenos valores. Su gran fortaleza y ánimo la han hecho sumamente conocida en su localidad y cada vez acoge mayor cantidad de clientes en sus dos pequeños negocios, este significativo crecimiento es producto de su amor por la cocina y el trabajo. Sin embargo como mujer emprendedora, ella desea incursionar también en otros ámbitos del mercado como el de los cosméticos, con el propósito de contar con más fuentes de ingresos en su hogar para continuar con la construcción de su casita. Solicita un préstamo para invertir este capital exclusivamente en la compra de productos para sus actividades actuales. Solidaricémonos con Ana para poder hacer realidad su anhelada labor.

loans.use: Increase in capital to expand the amount of products in two small businesses.

loans.name: Bayramali

texts.en: Bayramali is a 45 year-old man who runs his small farm in the southern village in the Imishli region. He raises sheep and sells them to the local bazaar traders for meat production. Azerbaijani people like meat very much, especially mutton. It is in very high demand all across country. He works very hard to raise sheep and raise them as healthy animals. He has three years of experience in breeding animals and now he needs more funds to continue to improve conditions for his sheep. He needs 1200 USD for his repayment period of 18 months to build good herds.

loans.use: Going to build good herd

loans.name: Ni Luh Putu Ratnadi

texts.id:
As a Balinese woman, especially the one who is Hindu, Ni Luh Putu Ratnadi is expert in producing Hindu prayer materials. She uses the skill to earn money that help her husband, I Putu Ariyasa, in supporting their daily necessity. With Rp 500.000,- as her initial investment, Ni Luh Ratnadi purchases raw materials such as young coconut leaves and various flowers to be bunched into Hindu prayer materials. Ratnadi also acts as buyer of Hindu prayer materials from other producer around her home and sell them to the customers in the market. She is able to earn Rp 50.000,- income a day which is used to support her family living and to support their two children, one is a kindergarten student, and the other one is a two years old toddler. With the loan Ratnadi wishes to earn from Dinari, she plans to increase her capital, either to purchase raw materials or finished Hindu prayer materials products.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai wanita Bali, khususnya beragama Hindu, membuat Ni Luh Putu Ratnadi pandai dalam membuat berbagai macam sarana persembahyangan untuk umat Hindu. Keterampilannya ini ditekuninya untuk menghasilkan uang dan bisa membantu suaminya, I Putu Ariyasa, dalam memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya. Dengan modal awal Rp. 500.00,- Ni Luh Putu Ratnadi membeli bahan-bahan untuk sarana tersebut seperti daun kelapa muda dan aneka jenis bunga untuk membuat sarana sesaji. Ratnadi juga sebagai pembeli, yang setiap hari mengambil sarana persembahyangan yang sudah jadi dari para tetangganya kemudian di jual kembali kepada langganan Ratnadi di Pasar. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk kebutuhan 2 anaknya. Yang paling besar masih TK dan adiknya baru berumur 2 tahun. Dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Ratnadi akan mempergunakannya untuk menambah modal usaha baik untuk membeli bahan baku atau untuk membeli sarana persembahyangan yang sudah jadi.

loans.use: To increase business capital so that be able to purchase more raw materials and finished Hindu prayer materials products from other producers and sell it to the consumer

loans.name: Kry

texts.en:
Mrs. Kry S. is a 37-year-old vegetable seller who sells at the Takmao market in Kandal Province. She earns about $4 a day and has two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, Mr. Kay Leanghout, drives a motorcycle taxi and earns about $2 a day.

In order to increase her inventory of vegetables and thereby increase her income, Kry now needs a loan of $150. She promises to be prompt in repaying her loan.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of vegetables

loans.name: Elnura

texts.en: A. Elnura rents a small shop next to her house where she sells bed sheets, blankets and women's and children's clothing. She has 3 children. Her husband was in hospital for 2 weeks and had surgery. She had to spend money from the shop to pay for her husband's medical expenses. Now she needs a loan to purchase inventory for her shop. Her son is 21 years old and also supports them as much as he can. He is painter and works in construction of small houses.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her clothing store

loans.name: Orfina

texts.es:
Mrs. Orfina P., as all Nicaraguan women, is very hard working and has a business selling shoes and clothing from her residence or if necessary as a street vendor. She does need to travel to other places to be able to attain the income from the sales of these products.

She is a resident of the municipality Cinco Pinos of Chinandega where she attends to her customers offering them shoes and clothing in order to provide for the necessities of her home. Mrs. Orfina is currently in need of support due to her lack of financial resources for the purchase of merchandise. She has turned to Ceprodel to acquire a loan that will enable her to buy the products that she can sell. She is confidently waiting for this loan approval so that she can continue to maintain her home.

Translated from Sapnish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Orfina P. como toda mujer nicaragüense es muy trabajadora dedicándose al negocio de la venta de zapatos y ropas el cual atiende en su casa de habitación y a la vez ambulantemente cuando es necesario y le es de necesidad viajar a otros lugares para percibir sus ingresos por medio de la venta de estos productos.

Es originaria del municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega donde atiende a sus clientes para ofrecerle los zapatos y ropa para suplir las necesidades en el hogar. La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora Orfina es que a pesar que no posee recursos económicos para la compra de su mercadería ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito que le permita la compra de sus productos para así comercializarlos. Por esto es que ella espera muy confiadamente sabiendo que recibirá la aprobación para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou Y. is a vegetable farmer in Kampong Cham. She earns on average $3 per day, more than rice farmers usually make. Her husband is a laborer, also earning about $3 per day doing whatever odd jobs need to be done around the province, such as unloading trucks and working on small construction projects. The couple has five children, three of whom are already married. Out of the two that are single, one is still in school while the other is a laborer with his father. Nou Y. has a good farm but is requesting a loan to buy a nearby plot of land to begin growing beans, a high earning crop.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Dorothy Nayiga `s Group

texts.en:
N. Dorothy is the leader of a group of four MCDT borrowers. She has been a member of MCDT since 2006, and has received five previous loans. N. is a 40-year-old single mother with two children, aged 6 and 16, both of whom are in school. For the past 20 years, she has made a living selling produce.

Three times a week, she heads out early in the morning to buy sweet potatoes, Irish potatoes, cassava and other produce to sell at a small kiosk that she runs at the market a mile from her home. She works at this stall six days a week from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. Most of her customers live in the neighborhood, which is home to a mix of housing and small businesses like hers. Along with produce, she sells beans. With a new loan, she would like to add matooke (green bananas), a staple of daily life in Uganda, to her list of items to sell, and continue to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy produce for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, beans, charcoal, coconuts, oil, soap, toilet paper and eggs.

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en: Bahruz (his brother is pictured above) lives in Khachmaz town, where he is married with two children. He was born in 1965. Bahruz has been in the farming business for ten years. He is requesting a loan of  $1200 USD to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve his farming business

loans.name: Rhoda Group

texts.en:
These are Alimany B. and Zainab B.. (Other members of the group are now receiving loans from SMT as individual clients.) They named their group Rhoda. They have been with SMT for over five years now. Their previous loan with SMT was Le 1,000,000.00. This loan was a great help to these entrepreneurs. These people's businesses have been growing as a result of the continuous access to loans they have been getting from SMT. But they still need new loans as they are aware of the fact that it is the continuous access to financial services that can eradicate or reduce poverty.

Alimany B. is the leader of this group. Alimany owns a provisions shop at Pamlap, a village around the outskirts of Makeni. He has been in his current business for over 15 years now. Alimany was born in Binkolo, a village 7 miles from Makeni. He is 47, married with 4 children. Two of his children are in secondary school and the other two are in primary school. His previous loans with SMT helped Alimany a great deal. Out of the proceeds of his business, he was able to solve his numerous problems. He could send his children to school, attend to them when they fall sick, feed and clothe them. Though he faces some few challenges in his business, like that of bad debtors, Alimany is nevertheless expecting a lot of improvements in his life with this new loan. His immediate goal he told me is to start building himself and his family a house. Even if he can not accomplish this desire now, he continued, with continuous loans from SMT, Alimany is optimistic that he will be able to accomplish his goal.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en: Allah Rakhi baji is a wife of M. and lives in a city named Kasur, Paksitan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and saint places. She has been living in this city for the last 40 years. Allah Rakhi baji’s husband has a power loom machine with which he manufactures clothes and bed sheets. His monthly income is $600. He has been in this business for the last 15 years. Allah Rakhi baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She is applying for a loan to buy thread to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy thread to make clothes and bed sheets

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom K. is a villager in Krang Roung village in Takeo Province. She is 58-year-old widow and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is a ticket checker.

She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. Mrs. Khom K. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living condition with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a vender todo tipo de artículos para el hogar y también como abastecimiento a las tiendas, vende todo tipo de dulces, prendas de vestir, artículos de limpieza, etc., de esa manera puede tener los ingresos económicos necesarios para educar a sus hijos. Nelly se traslada todos los sábados con una camioneta de muchos años de uso para  repartir todos estos productos, su principal almacén es su casa, donde cuidadosamente selecciona lo que ha de vender, y reparte principalmente a los pequeños comerciantes de las ferias de cada zona local, su meta es tener una gran distribuidora a nivel de la ciudad que le permita ser una empresaria de éxito. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con los pagos. Con esta cantidad incrementará su mercadería para aprovechar esta campaña navideña .
texts.en:
34-year old Nelly lives with her husband and children. For the last three years her job has been selling all types of household items and also supplies for stores. She sells many sorts of candy, clothing, and cleaning supplies and in this way earns enough money to pay for her children’s education. Every Saturday Nelly travels in a much-used truck to deliver these products. Her main storage place is her house where she carefully selects what she has for sale, and takes these goods to small business owners in the local markets. Her goal is to have a widespread distribution network in the city and become a successful entrepreneur. This is the first time that she has asked for a loan from MFP, and she promises to be a responsible client in regard to repayments. With the loan she will buy more merchandise to sell during the upcoming Christmas period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Christmas products

loans.name: Mekhti

texts.en: Mekhti B. lives in a small village of Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Mekhti is the sole provider for his family and earns his living by raising and selling livestock. Every year he purchases young calves from local livestock bazaar, raises them for 8 or 9 months, and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers or bazaar traders. Today Mekhti is thinking about expanding his business because his current earnings are not enough to provide for his family. He wants to purchase more calves and fodder. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. Extend your solidarity to Mekhti so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: purchase two cattle

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 32 years old. She is married to Nelson Gamolao, who works as house carpenter in their village and sometimes is hired to work on houses in nearby villages. However, her husband’s work is not regular. So, Lucresia needs to grow a small business to assist him in earning a livelihood. At the moment, the couple has two children: Criscel Joy, 10; and Kristine, 8. They are both in the elementary level of education in their village. According to Lucrecia, her current family situation is happy and she strives for a better future in their village at Barangay Cabisera 14-16 Ilagan, Isabela.
 
Lucrecia wants a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 for her snack vending business in the village. She cooks cassava cakes, sugar coated banana and other types of cooked snacks. She will use the money that she earns in the said business for the education of her children and family’s daily basic needs. She hopes to maintain the business and someday be able to develop it into a larger vending business. What she will need to do is to strive, "work harder and have faith to God in order to become successful”, she said.

loans.use: For additional capital to grow her snack vending business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Bancomunal  Siempre Juntas.
Margarita es conviviente tiene 33 años, tres hijos de 11,10 y 8 años que están en la escuela estatal.
Margarita se crió con sus tíos por que sus padres fallecieron; su  suegro  empezó el negocio de transporte de materiales de construcción con carros alquilados.  Ahora los hijos continúan el negocio  su esposo maneja un camión, ella va haber a los clientes y hace las cobranzas.  
Necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para  comprar petróleo y pagar al botadero.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió a manejar el negocio, trabaja mas ordenada, ella le explica a su esposo lo que le enseñan en los Bancomunales.
El sueño de Margarita es tener un volquete para ella.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the Bancomunal Siempre Juntas. She has a live in partner and is 33 years old. She has three children ages 11, 10, and 8 who all attend public school. Margarita was raised by her relatives because her parents past away when she was young. Her father-in-law started a construction materials transportation business with rented cars. Now his children continue to run the business and her husband drives one of the trucks. Margarita visits the clients and collects the payments. She needs a loan of 3,000 soles in order to purchase gasoline and pay for the garbage dump. Since working with FINCA, she has learned how to operate the business, be more organized, and has been able to teach her husband what she learns at the Bancomunales. Margarita's dream is to own a dump truck.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan for 3,000 soles to purchase gasoline and pay for the garbage dump.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph B. is 27 years old. He is married and has two children, a set of male twins. He says his children are already in the basic school. His wife produces palm oil for sale. He lives with his family in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the dwellers, the men in particular, is farming.

Joseph owns a cocoa, palm nut and food crop farm. He does not sell the harvested palm fruits in the raw state but adds value to it by producing palm oil. He procures additional palm fruits from nearby farms to increase his production. Joseph distributes to customers who come to buy in bulk and retail. He wants a loan to procure palm fruits in large quantities so that he can produce the oil in bulk and distribute to his increasing number customers. He aspires to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри закончив кредит ,хочет получить повторный кредит на один месяц. Она считает что ей пока лучше получать займ на один месяц.Она торгует тканью.Кредитуется уже четвёртый год, и погашает без проблем.По торговле ей помогают её дети, которые иногда даже привозят ей товар Мехри надёжный клиент в Микроинвест, с которой мы рады сотрудничать.За четыри года кредитования её оборот заметно увеличился и улучшился уровень жизни.
texts.en:
Mehri, having just paid off one loan, wants to take out another loan for one month. She thinks that right now it would be better for her to take out a loan for a month. She sells fabric. This is the fourth year she has borrowed money without any problems. Her children help her in her business and sometimes even transport her goods. Mehri is a reliable client with whom MicroInvest is glad to cooperate. During four years of financing, her sales have increased considerably and her standard of living has improved.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabrics

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline A., 37, is married with four children. She and her husband are farmers. She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (about $120).

SPBD loans are Pauline’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks, and this is her first SPBD loan. The loan will be used solely to support the business, specifically by purchasing chemicals, bush knives, spades, an axe, fertilizer, and a new weed-killer.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, bush knives, spades, an axe, fertilizer, and a new weed-killer.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La Señora. Maria B. tiene 60 años de edad, vive en el barrio hialeah en la ciudad de Managua,  casada  su esposo es pensionado. Tiene una pulpería la cual le genera los ingresos, las dificultares que ha tenido es la falta de financiamiento para el incremento del volumen de su venta. Su negocio lo tiene desde hace quince años iniciándolo con dinero propio y el apoyo de su esposo. Gracias a la oportunidad que le ha brindado los prestamos en Afodenic le a permitido poco a poco obtener mayores cantidades de productos con este préstamo va invertir en su negocio en la compra de: productos lácteos, productos de cosméticos y perfumería, también mayores cantidades de granos básicos, abarrotes e ingresar verduras y aumentar sus utilidades brindando mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria B. is 60 years old, lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua, and is married. Her husband is retired. She has a store which generates income but she has had difficulties because she lacks financing to increase the volume of sales. She started this business 15 years ago, initially financing with her own money and the support of her husband. Thanks to the opportunity that AFODENIC loans have provided her, she has been slowly purchasing larger quantities of products to sell. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of milk products, cosmetics and perfumes, and larger quantities of basic grains, groceries and vegetables to increase her revenues and improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, milk products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Martha Lorena A. G., Victoria del Carmen C. C. y Lucía del Carmen M. G...

El grupo solidario Victoria está conformado por tres señoras, todas ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, originarias del departamento de Masaya, sus condiciones de vida son humildes, trabajan con Adim porque les gusta que confíen en ellas, expresaron..
Son vecinas, de confianza, se conocen hace muchos años y son muy unidas. 
. 

Doña  Victoria vende ropa variada, nueva y usada, como pantalones, camisas, fajas, ella tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad , ella tiene seis  hijos adolescentes y pequeños para quien ella trabaja, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de guarda de seguridad y le ayuda con los gastos. Ella es la coordinadora del grupo porque es muy responsable, vive con su mamá a la que ella le ayuda económicamente. Ella sueña con poder  tener un buen negocio para mantener bien a su hijo y darle estudios

Doña Martha Lorena  joven mujer vende cosméticos variados de diferentes marcas, con esta actividad ayuda a los gastos del hogar, con el crédito compro perfumes, pinturas labiales, cremas perfumadas, etc. Sus ventas se han mejorado porque ofrece de todos los gustos de sus clientes. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Doña  Lucía del Carmen  vende productos varios como perfumes , ropas, zapatos, estos los ofrece en su comunidad y ya tiene muchos clientes que le piden encargos, el crédito lo utilizará para ofrecer perfumes en las festividades de las madres.Ella tiene tres hijos a los que mantiene sola y sueña con darles estudios a los tres y tener su propia vivienda, es la coordinadora del grupo por ser muy responsable.

Este grupo está comprometido a pagar puntual y así seguir obteniendo créditos con Adim, están seguras que con el crédito saldrán adelante porque incrementan sus ventas y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Victoria group is comprised of three women, all of whom are hard workers from the state of Masaya. Their living conditions are very modest. They work with Adim because they like the fact that "the organization trusts them," they said. "They are trustworthy neighbors who have known each other for many years and who are very united." Victoria sells a variety of clothing, new and used, like pants, shirts and sashes and has been working in the business for several years. She has six adolescent children to support. Her husband works at a business as a security guard and helps with the expenses. She is the coordinator of the group because she's very responsible. She lives with her mother who she also supports economically and dreams of having a good business in order to support her children and provide them with an education. Martha Lorena is a young woman who sells various brands of cosmetics and that helps with household expenses. With the loan she will buy perfume, lipstick, scented lotions, etc. Her sales have increased because she offers products to her clients to suit all tastes. Her husband helps her with the expenses at home. Lucía del Carmen sells a variety of products like perfume, clothing and shoes to members of her community and she already has many clients that place orders. The loan will be used to buy perfume to sell in the festivals where they celebrate motherhood. She has three children whom she takes care of alone and dreams of giving each of them an education and having her own home. She is a coordinator of the group because she is very responsible. This group is committed to pay on time in order to continue to receive loans from Adim. The members are sure that with the loan they will get ahead because they will increase their sales and their income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfume, clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Ciudad de los tres Pisos”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 254, Provincia de Lamas Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 38 años, 01 hija pequeña que aun depende de ella.

Irene, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de panes, cuenta con su propia panadería y nos comenta que para empezar tuvo que pasar por muchas dificultades, empezó con pocos panes y ahora ya tiene un negocio establecido en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado tanto para ella como para sus clientes, esta muy orgullosa y contenta por haber salido adelante con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos que la ayudo bastante a mejorar su servicio.

En la actualidad continua con la venta de panes y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa a comprar sus panes y es ella quien personalmente las atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00, lo invertirá comprando harina y azúcar en sacos, levaduras, manteca, huevos en javas y otros. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá pagando la cuota inicial de su amazadora eléctrica, herramienta principal para preparar sus panes.

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada y con el apoyo de su esposo salieron adelante y hoy se siente con ganas de hacer realidad sus demás sueños.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irene is a member of the communal bank “Ciudad de los tres Pisos.” She lives in Jr. Alfonso Ugarte # 254, in the Lamas province of San Martín. She is a 38-year-old mother of a small daughter. Irene bakes and sells bread for a living. She has her own bakery, but tells us that if was very difficult starting out. She was only able to sell a few loaves of bread at first, but now she has an established business located in her home. She has put in air conditioning, for both herself and her clients, and is very happy and proud to have come this far with Manuela Ramos’ support. Manuela Ramos really helped her improve her business. She continues to sell bread and has loyal clients who come to her house everyday to buy bread. She takes care of her clients personally with her habitual charm. With this loan of 1,800 soles, she will buy sacks of sugar and flour as well as baking powder, lard, eggs, and other things. She will also use part of the money to make the first payment for her electric mixer – a key appliance for baking bread. Today she feels like a very accomplished woman who together with her husband has gotten ahead. Now she wants to make her other dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara insumos (harina y azúcar en sacos, manteca, levaduras y huevos en javas) para preparar sus panes.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma.
Sara es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Sara junto a su pareja tienen una empresa llamada Inversiones Alex Aroni SAC. Que se dedica a la administración de servicios higiénicos, alquiler de tiendas, todo ello a través de concesiones.
Sara necesita un préstamo de 3600 soles dinero que será invertido en la remodelación de un local.
Los sueños de Sara son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir una casa para cada hijo.
texts.en:
Sara is a member of the Paloma (The Dove) Communal Bank. She is 37 years of age and living with her domestic partner and her three children. Together with her partner, they have a business called Alex Aroni Investments, S.A., which is dedicated to restrooms, commercial rentals, and all those things having to do with concessions. Sara needs a loan of 3,600 Sols which will be invested in remodeling a commercial location. Her dreams are that her children will become professional people and that she will build a house for each of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel a location.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Lucia es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, un grupo de mujeres que reside en la comunidad de Turi, aproximadamente media hora fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur de Ecuador. Es un grupo de señoras que se llevan muy bien entre ellas; pasan sus reuniones riéndose y haciendo chistes. Si la risa es la mejor medicina, Mujer y Fortaleza es un grupo bien saludable. También hacen pequeñas fiestas y actividades entre ellas para ocasiones como el día de la madre, y son bien colaboradoras. Hasta toman turnos barriendo después de cada reunión en la casa de la socia donde se reúne el grupo cada 2 semanas. 
Ana Lucia tiene 23 años, es casada, y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Su esposo es albañil. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica para una familia en la ciudad de Cuenca. Ana Maria trabaja en Cuenca de lunes a viernes, allí deja su hijo con los suegros o en el jardín infantil. Además, estudia los fines de semana para poder graduarse del colegio. Ella dejó el colegio cuando tenía 14 años porque se puso a trabajar a esta misma edad. Después de que se casó decidió retomar sus estudios porque tiene como meta ser veterinaria, entonces necesitará estudios superiores. Ya tiene 2 años de estudios completados, y le falta 4 años para terminar el colegio.  
Aparte de su trabajo como empleada, Ana Lucia también cría cuyes, ovejas y una vaca en su casa. Dice que le gusta mucho trabajar con animales, y por eso quiere ser veterinaria.  
Ana pidió 220 dólares para invertir en las  matrículas para el colegio de ella y para pagar el jardín para su hijo. Para el futuro, tiene pensado comprarse un computador porque es una necesidad para los que estudien.
texts.en:
Ana Lucia is a member of the communal bank “Mujer y Fortaleza”, which is a group of women living in the community of Turi, located about half an hour outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. These ladies get along well with one another, spending their meeting time laughing and making jokes. If laughter is the best medicine, then “Mujer y Fortaleza” is a very healthy group. They get together to celebrate occasions such as Mother's Day, and they are good members. They even take turns sweeping the home of the group member who is hosting their regular meeting, which takes place every 2 weeks.

Ana Lucia is 23 years, married, and the mother of a 4 year old child. Her husband is a mason. She works as a maid for a family in the city of Cuenca. Ana Maria works Monday through Friday, leaving her son with her in-laws or at kindergarten. In addition, she studies on the weekends to obtain her high school diploma. She left school when she was 14 to start working. After she got married, she decided to resume her studies because her goal is to become a veterinarian, which requires higher education. She has already completed 2 years of study, and will need another 4 years to complete college.

Besides her work as a maid, Ana Lucia also raises guinea pigs, sheep and cows from her home. She says she enjoys working with animals, and therefore wants to become a veterinarian. Ana is requesting $ 220 to pay for her school fees and her son’s kindergarten. In the future, she would like to buy a computer because it is a necessity for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her school fees & her son's kindergarten

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa A. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 64 years old. Josefa is widowed and has 1 adult-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety home products to local community members. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josefa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Josefa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon G. is from the village of San Jose in  Camiguin. She is 42 years old. Ma. Corazon is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ma. Corazon owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food and daily-use products in the local community. Ma. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ma. Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emprendedores De Sicuani Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL 
EMPRENDEDORES D. SICUANI
La Alcancia Comunal  "EMPRENDEDORES D. SICUANI" está representado por la Sra. Miguela C.  y conformados por 11 miembros los cuales cursan el quinto ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, unión, honestidad y sobre todo ganas D. salir adelante. 
La Sra. Miguela C. se dedica al rubro textil hace muchos años, negocio que le permite brindar educación  a sus 4 hijos. 
La tesorera Elizabeth Ríos es una socia que venD. productos D. acuerdo a la estación, por ejemplo en invierno venD. turrones y miel D. abeja, y en verano se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales. Este tipo D. negocio le ha traído muchos beneficios ya que pueD. sustentar los gastos en casa. 
Los socios D. este grupo tienen diferentes actividades tales como venta D.  comida, venta D. cosméticos, productos naturales, venta D. ropa, servicios D. sastrería. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda pero gracias a su experiencia, pueden salir adelante vendiendo productos que van D. acorD. con las exigencias del mercado. 
Ellos solicitan financiamiento para la adquisición D. mercaderías, e insumos que les permitan generaran mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL EMPRENDEDORES D. SICUANI The communal bank "EMPRENDEDORES D. SICUANI" is represented by Mrs. Miguela C. and formed by 11 members who are in their fifth loan cycle, proving their responsibility, unity, honesty, and above all their desire to move forward in life.
