Mrs. Miguela C. has been working in the textile industry for many years, a business that has allowed her to proviD. education to her 4 children. The treasurer Elizabeth Ríos is a member that sells products according to the season. For example, in the winter she sells nougat candy and bee honey, and in the summer she sells natural products. This type of business has brought many benefits so she is able to support the household expenses. The members of this group have different activities such as food sales, cosmetic sales, natural products, clothing sales, and tailor services. As in any commercial industry, there is always the competition between supply and demand, but thanks to their experience, they can move forward selling products that sell according to the needs of the market. They are requesting financing for the acquisition of merchandise, and goods that will allow them to generate greater incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of inputs and products

loans.name: Alexa Doris

texts.es: La señora Alexa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 31 años y es madre de 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.Alexa, se dedica a la venta de Refrigerios, como: jugos, juanes, tamalitos, arroz chaufa, arroz con pollo; dulces y golosinas; chifles, canchitas y en bebidas gasificadas, refrescos y jugos, ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente tiene muy buena acogida, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia, fue quien decidió emprender su propio negocio.En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.Con este préstamo de S/ 2,600.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos en kilos y huevos en javas, aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  Se siente muy bien, para seguir con sus ventas de refrigerios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Alexa is a member of the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank located in the Tarapoto District, San Martin Province, San Martin Department. She lives with her life partner, is 31 years old, and has three children all of whom are still dependent on her. Alexa sells meals and refreshments such as: fruit juices, juanes (a chicken dish made of chicken, rice, olives, and eggs wrapped in a leaf), tamales, arroz chaufa (a rice dish), chicken and rice, candies, snacks, chewing gum, canchitas (unpopped pop-corn), soft drinks, juices, etc. from her home in a well-conditioned site where daily she has a good customer response. She began her business with an initial investment of 300 new soles. She continues with her work and she tells us she is doing quite well. With this new 2600 new soles loan she will purchase raw materials for her prepared meals such as: sacks of rice and sugar, chicken by the kilogram, eggs in crates, olives by the dozen as well as kitchen utensiles to provide a higher quality product and service. She feels very able to continue with her refreshment sales and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for its contrbution to making her dreams come true and meeting her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Filomena Juliao

texts.pt:
Filomena M. nasceu em Chipongo, distrito de Massinga, província de Inhambane, no sul de Moçambique, tem 34 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 03 filhos de 15, 09 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão à escola. Fez 7ªclasse parou por causa da gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta os 05 irmãos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Massinga em 1989 com a mãe, quando perdeu o pai para se juntar ao irmão mais velho que já vivia na cidade de Maputo. Actualmente é comerciante e dona do negocio a mais de 09 anos. Trabalha sozinha das 06h às 18h, aprendeu a fazer o negocio por iniciativa própria e tem um rendimento mensal de 5.000,00MT a 6.000,00MT com o qual consegue poupar para investir no seu negocio.

Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições de créditos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua prima que também e cliente da instituição. Este e o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 11.000,00MT para compra e venda de roupa diversa, nova para meninas e senhoras. 
Compromete-se a pagar bem o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros financiamentos e construir um murro na sua casa.
texts.en:
Filomena M. was born in Chipongo, district of Massinga, province of Inhambane, in the south of Mozambique, she is 34 years old, and is married and has 3 children who are 15, 9 and 6 years old, they all go to school. Filomena stopped studying when she was in 7th grade due to her pregnancy. She lives in her own house and besides her kids, she supports her 5 brothers who live with her. She left Massinga in 1989 with her mother, when she lost her father, and they joined her oldest brother who already lived in Maputo. She owns a business for the last 9 years. She works by herself from 6 am to 6 pm, she learned it by herself and started it from her own initiative and has a monthly profit of 5.000MT to 6.000MT and she is able to save and re-invest on her business. She never worked with another credit institutions, she learned about Hluvuku thru her cousin who is a client too. This is her first loan for 10.000MT to buy and sell diverse clothes, new clothes for ladies and girls. She will pay well the loan in order to access to other loans and build a wall at her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Amig Chaco Group

texts.es: Martha M. integrante del grupo  Amig Chaco que pertenece al Centro Focal Collpani, se dedica al tejido de ropa de bebe y niño hasta los 5 años, en sus inicios ella tejía  a mano y con el pasar del tiempo se compró una máquina y su producción ha incrementado, Martha estima que por las fiestas de fin de año la compra de ropa se incrementará por lo que necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima como la lana, ella compra los insumos de la 16 de Julio y vende sus productos también el la 16 de Julio, sus clientes son señoras que tienen lugares  de venta fijo, es decir, ella entrega al por mayor y son otras personas las que venden por unidad, Martha tiene 5 hijos a los cuales cuida y protege. Otro ejemplo es  Evelyn L. con solo 19 años ella estudia  y  costura ropa como faldas y con el apoyo de su madre los vende en Desaguadero, los Yungas y Santa Cruz, ella es soltera y desea seguir estudiando y ampliar el negocio, por lo que necesita el préstamo para comprar tela. Las demás integrantes del grupo también necesitan el préstamo para comprar productos.
texts.en:
Martha M. is a member of the Amig Chaco group, which belongs to the Collpani community center. She knits clothes for babies and children up to 5 years old. When she started, she knit by hand. As time passed, she bought a machine and her production has increased. Martha estimates that the purchase of clothes for the end of the year festivities will increase, and she needs a loan to buy the raw material like wool. She buys her supplies at the 16 de Julio (a fair), and also sells her products at the 16 de Julio. Her customers are women who have fixed sales places. That means that she sells wholesale, and the other people sell by the unit. Martha has five children that she takes care of and protects. Another example is Evelyn L., who is only 19. She goes to school and she makes clothes like skirts. With her mother’s help, she sells them in Desaguadero, Los Yungas, and Santa Cruz. She is single, and she wants to continue studying and expanding her business. She needs a loan to buy fabric. The other members of the group also need the loan to buy products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material (wool, fabric) and products

loans.name: Myralyn

texts.en:
Myralyn B. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel Misamis Occidental.  She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Myralyn runs a general store, mainly selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  Myralyn has been engaged in business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Myralyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myralyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myralyn from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue to support her family. 
-----------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 34 años, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su hija Nicol de 3 años, a quien desea dar una buena calidad de vida.El negocio de venta de ropa de Elena esta ubicado en un  mercado importante de la ciudad donde vive, vende jeans para todas las edades y es una de las vendedoras más solicitadas de dicho mercado, ya que los novedosos modelos que tiene en almacén  y los precios  accesibles que brinda a sus clientes, la han hecho de muy buena cantidad de clientela .Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los modelos que mejor les quedarán, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que llevar sus jeans hasta otra ciudad, ya que también vende ahí. Para el futuro, espera que su negocio crezca y pueda aperturar una tienda de ropa, donde pueda atender a sus clientes con más comodidad.Es el primer préstamo de Elena con  MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, y en su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de socias, ya que es muy alegre.Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más jeans para tener mayor cantidad de  mercadería para vender.
texts.en:
Elena is 34 years old and lives in a rented house with her three year old daughter Nicol, for whom she wants to provide a good quality of life. She sells clothing at a major market in the city where she lives. Elena offers jeans for all ages and is one of the most sought-after vendors in the market. Since she keeps the latest models in stock and offers them at affordable prices, Elena has been able to build up a large clientele. What she enjoys most about her job is giving advice to her customers as to what styles would look good on them. She has been in this business for five years and believes the hardest part is having to carry her merchandise with her to another city where she sells.

In the future, Elena hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to open her own clothing store where she can serve her customers more comfortably. This is her first loan with MFP and she expects to make her payments on time. Elena is admired by the other members of her Communal Bank because of her cheerfulness. With her loan of 800 soles, she plans to buy more jeans so that she will have a greater amount inventory available to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jeans to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda M. is from Bliss Baybay, Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Luzminda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as sugar, candies, salt, bar soap (laundry and bath), soap powder, coffee, noodles, rice, baby oil, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month. In 2000, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 60,000 PHP from GDMPC. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This loan will be her seventh from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Calixta Eduvis

texts.es:
Calixta Cedeño de 33 años, vive en la casa de sus padres en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Calixta trabajaba en una peluquería, pero decidió renunciar para poner su propio salón de belleza con los conocimientos aprendidos. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 23h00 todos los días en su salón de belleza haciendo cortes de cabello, tratamientos, tinturados, etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector del negocio.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar silla peinadora, shampoo y tratamientos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere tener ya empleados en su negocio.
texts.en:
Calixta Cedeño is 33 years old, and lives with her parents in the semi-urban area, Paraíso (Guayaquil), where they have basic services. Calixta used to work in a hair salon, but decided to leave, using what she had learned to set up her own beauty salon. She now works in her salon every day from 8 in the morning to 11 in the evening, with hair cuts, hair treatments, coloring, etc. One of the complications in that line of business is delinquent payment. She would use the loan to buy a hairdresser’s chair, shampoo, and hair-treatment products for her business. She would like to have employees for her business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Salon chair, shampoo, gel

loans.name: Florepe

texts.en:
Florepe N. is from the city of Pagadian City. She is 45 years old. Florepe is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Florepe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita L. is 44 years old and married with four children. The eldest is a college graduate, two children are in high school and one is attending elementary school.  Juanita lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines.  Her husband works long hours as a fisherman to support the family.  To supply additional income, Juanita wants to expand the family fishing business through additional working capital. 

Juanita would like to receive a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase an inventory of fish nets, rope, bamboo, fingerlings (small fish), and additional raw materials.  With additional equipment, Juanita believes that her fish supply will increase, bringing higher revenue.

Over the course of her membership since 2008, Juanita has achieved strong performance with regular attendance at center meetings and steady repayments.  Juanita is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that their expanded business will continue to flourish, to improve the family’s quality of life, and fund all of her children’s expenses in school until college education.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of fish nets, rope, bamboo, fingerlings (small fish), and additional raw materials

loans.name: Safia Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Safia parveen lives in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband's name is M. A. and he sells used clothes in the market and earns income. Safia is not only a housewife but she also manages her embroidered clothes business. She prepares embroidered clothes on order and earns income. She earns approximately Pak Rs. 10,000 every month. She uses her income to pay for the utilities and the education expenses of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy used clothes to expand her husband’s business. 

She has two other ladies in her loan group. Guldan wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. Yasmeen wants a loan to buy timbers for her timber-selling business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel has a shop where she sells children’s ready-made clothes as well as clothing materials for both men and women. She sees this as her means of livelihood and has been in this business for over ten years.

Mabel makes sure her customers’ demands are met while indirectly improving herself financially. With her proceeds from the business, she is able to assist her husband, who is retired officer, in the upkeep of their home.

Mabel hopes to improve and expand on her business. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more children’s ready-made clothes and clothing materials to sell.

50-year-old Mabel is married with four children and they are doing fine. She says thank you to all lenders and promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more children's ready-made clothes and clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguari se reunieron unas mujeres con el objetivo de  aumentar su capital de trabajo y otras para emprender alguna actividad productiva.

El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Aty, cuyos objetivos es trabajar en grupo, mejorar la actividad que las mismas actualmente realizan, actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo integrada por 22  mujeres, quienes trabajan a diario para brindarle lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. 
Cada integrante realiza una actividad para generar su ingreso individual, una de ellas es la señora Balvina quien es peluquera y tiene instalada su peluquería en su domicilio.
Ella dedica un tiempo parcial a su casa y el resto de su tiempo a la atención de su negocio. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la peluquería, en la compra de elementos de trabajo como sillones para peluqueria, secadoras y otros.
texts.en:
In the city of Paraguari some women got together with the aim of increasing their working capital and carrying out other productive activities. The group is called by the name Kuña Aty, and among their goals is to work as a group to improve the economic activities that each of the members currently performs. The group is now in its fifth loan cycle. The group is made up of 22 women who work every day to provide more for their respective families. Each member carries out an activity that allows her to generate her own income. One of the members is Balbina, who is a hairdresser and has installed a hair salon in her home. Balbina spends some of the time taking care of her home, and spends the rest of her time tending to her business. She is asking for a loan so that she can invest in her business by purchasing items such as armchairs, hair dryers, and other items for her hair salon

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing meat products, dairy products, canned foods, items for a clothing store, items for a bookstore, and wholesale goods.

loans.name: The Power Of God Group

texts.en:
Annie N. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called The Power Of God. She is 51 years old and married, with 2 children who are 22 and 26 years old. Annie did not have the opportunity to go to school.

For 20 years she has been selling lappas ( (fabrics used by African women to wrap around their body or made into clothing) on a table at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia. Annie started selling with 1,500 Liberian Dollars in worK. capital and now has about 25,000 Liberian Dollars in worK. capital.  Annie encourages her customers with good words in order to keep them returning. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollar-portion of this  group loan to purchase more lappas.


Her goal and dream is to expand her business to a bigger table and improve the living condition of her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Abel is holding the sign. And Musu is inset at the lower right because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To purchase more lappas.

loans.name: Gladis Noemí

texts.es: Gladis Noemí M. G. de 39 años de edad, se dedica a mejorar la imagen de las personas, haciendo cortes de cabello, tintes, alisados y todo lo que tenga que ver con belleza. Ella posee un salón de belleza en el cual esta ubicado en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Apopa, en donde vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante, y junto a sus dos hijos uno de 13 años el cual estudia y la mayor de 19 años de edad, quien le ayuda a Gladis con el negocio. Debido a que Gladis elabora un trabajo muy bueno, ella posee muchos clientes, así mimos cuenta con la ventaja de ser la única con un negocio de este tipo en los alrededores. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar secadoras profesionales para el cabello, así mismo unas planchas para el cabello que sean profesionales y que cuiden el cabello, esto es lo que más le urge poseer a Gladis, debido a que son los servicios que más se solicitan en el lugar, así mismo espera comprar cosméticos y cremas para el cuerpo, todo con el deseo de mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladis Noemí M. Galdámez, 39, is dedicated to improving people’s image by providing haircuts, hair coloring, hair straightening and everything else that has to do with beauty. She has a beauty salon located in her home in Apopa where she lives with her husband, who is a merchant, and their two children, a 13-year-old who is a student and a 19-year-old who helps Gladis in the salon.Because Gladis’ work is so good she has a lot of customers; she also has the advantage of being the only provider of this kind of service in her area. She is asking for funds to buy professional hair dryers as well as straightening irons that are of professional caliber and won’t damage hair; this is what is most urgent for her to have because they are the services that are most requested in the place. She would also like to buy cosmetics and body creams in order to improve her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair dryers and straightening irons.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Sigamos Creciendo Group

texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Sigamos Creciendo” and it is made up of 15 members (14 women and 1 man) who live in the Victoria community of the city of Temuco.  Their businesses are, primarily, selling dried fruits and nuts, used clothing, vegetables and salads, desserts, and doing sewing.

The group member interviewed was Edith, who is the group’s president.  In the photo she is pictured in the third row on the left, wearing a gray sweater over a red shirt.  From her home she runs a business selling pinecones and firewood.  

Edith posts advertisements in places like schools and restaurants around her community.  After the forests around Temuco are cut for timber there are many pieces of wood and pinecones left, so she pays people to go in and collect this for her.  She has been doing this business for approximately three years. Edith will invest this loan in a chainsaw because she and her husband also cut wood themselves.

Edith’s greatest motivation is to maintain the health and well-being of her family, especially of her three children who are 15, 11, and 10, because with only her husband’s income they are unable to make ends meet. She is content working with Fondo Esperanza, because it has been a great support for her and for her business.

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometres south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and possesses a series of lake-side spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: To buy a chainsaw

loans.name: Arcoiris De La Cruz Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Arcoiris D. L. C.”  nombrado así por que son un grupo alegre y todas son  originarias D. L. Ranchería L. C.. Es integrado por cinco mujeres. Los representa doña María RemeD. López Sánchez, todos sus hijos están casados, elL. se dedica a L. venta D. pescado junto con su esposo. Doña Doris D. D. V., tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a L. venta D. cerdo junto con Martha C. O., doña Martha tiene 1 hija; María D. Los Santos D. L. C. L. tiene 1 hija  y Araceli D. D. López tiene 2 niñas,  ambas se dedican  a L. venta D. pollos que crían en sus respectivos domicilios. 

Doña Mello (como le llaman a Maria Remedioa)junto con su esposo tienen su venta D. pescado D. manera ambulante que sale a vender su esposo en un triciclo en L. misma ranchería y comunidades vecinas  y también tiene su venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en su domicilio como azúcar, arroz, leche, galletas, refrescos, etc. Sueña con tener una tienda D. abarrotes bien surtida.

Todas ellas son mujeres  muy trabajadoras, alegres  y sus actividades son algunas variadas, es un grupo  solidario y se conocen desD. hace años.  

Agradecen el apoyo que le brinda L. Fundación y KIVA por ser considerados para poder realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
The Arcoiris D. L. C. (Rainbow of the Cross) group got its name because they are a happy group, and all of them are from the C. settlement. The group is comprised of five women. María RemeD. López Sánchez represents the group. All of her children are married. She and her husband sell fish together. Doris D. D. V. has two children. She sells pigs together with Martha C. O.. Martha has a daughter. María D. Los Santos D. L. C. L. has one daughter, and Araceli D. D. López has two daughters. They both sell chicken that they raise in their respective homes. Mello (as they call Maria Remedioa) and her husband have a business selling fish. Her husband sells in an itinerant way. He leaves on his tricycle to sell in the same settlement and neighboring communities. She also sells basic needs products in her home. She sells products like sugar, rice, milk, cookies, and soft drinks, etc. She dreams of having a well stocked grocery store. They are all very hard-working and happy women. Their activities are varied. They are a supportive group, and they have known each other for years. They are grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the support they have provided and for considering them so that they can continue their small businesses and make their dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, vaccines, food, fish ( (perch and gar fish), pigs, vitamins, lipstick, eyeliners, perfume, and eye shadow

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino es un padre de familia de 54 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Amaru Inca - Valle de Los Incas, una zona agrícola del distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito que tiene como actividad principal el cultivo de plantas frutales, las cuales son debidamente tratadas y exportadas al exterior, la zona pertenece a la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde joven a labores asociadas a la agricultura, actualmente tiene dos hectáreas de cultivo en las cuales ha sembrado árboles de mango y de limón, el, como todos los agricultores de la zona, vende las frutas que producen sus árboles a las plantas de tratamiento, las cuales procesan las frutas para exportarlas a diversos países del exterior.

El depende de esta actividad para poder solventar los gastos económicos familiares, por ello trabaja arduamente para obtener una buena producción en cada cosecha. Actualmente el desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de limón aplicandole fertilizantes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Paulino es un hombre trabajador y honesto, sumayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, las personas que lo conocen en la zona donde vive le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Paulino is a 54-year-old father who lives with his wife and three children in the area Amaru Inca - Valley of the Incas. This is an agricultural area in the Tambogrande district, a district where people make a living primarily by growing fruit plants, which are adequately treated and exported abroad. The area is part of the province of Piura, in the region of the same name, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Paulino has worked in farming since he was young and currently has two hectares in which he has planted mango and lemon trees. He, like all farmers in the area, sells his fruit to the treatment factories, which process the fruits for export to various countries abroad. He depends on this work to take care of his family's financial needs, therefore he works very hard to get a good yield out of each harvest. Currently, he would like to maintain his crops and apply fertilizer to his lemon trees. Therefore, he is taking out a loan for the first time from "Edpyme Alternativa" of 1,000 soles to help him achieve his goal. Paulino is a hard worker and is honest and his greatest desire is to give his family a better quality of life. People who know the area where he lives consider him someone you trust.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertalizer to put on his lemon crop.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena B. is from the village of New Dapitan, Rizal. She is 35 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena owns & operates a general store selling dry goods in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lorena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for capital for fruit vending. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lorena from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for fruit vending

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is from the city of Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old. Esther is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Esther owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport "habal-habal" services. Esther has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esther joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esther from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Es socia del Banco comunal “Dulce Amanecer” desde hace cinco años atrás, ubicado en la provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 46 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y tiene tres hijos de: 21, 18 y 13 años respectivamente.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Se dedica a la venta de productos artesanales de alpaca como: chompas, casacas, cojines, bolsos, maletines, adornos para sala, alfombras etc., estos productos los vende en su puesto de artesanía que tiene en una zona comercial en Puno. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró lana de alpaca para tejer.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar productos artesanales.
Su sueño es exportar artesanía a otros Países, a la vez salir al mercado Nacional. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las Charlas educativas y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of community bank “Dulce Amanecer” for five years. She lives in the province and district of Puno, is aged 46 years, married, and has three children aged 21, 18 and 13 years. Francisca has completed her secondary education. She sells handicrafts made from Alpaca wool such as jumpers/sweaters, jackets, cushions, bags, briefcases, ornaments, carpets, etc. She sells these products from her handicrafts stall located in one of Puno’s shopping districts. Francisca used her first loan of S/.300.00 (Peruvian Soles) received from Movimiento Manuela Ramos to buy Alpaca wool to weave. She is requesting a loan of S/.1000.00 (Peruvian Soles) to buy handicrafts. Her dream is to export handicrafts to other countries. What she likes most about the community bank are its educational talks and sporting events.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Jane Wangari

texts.en: Jane has run a food stall in Naivasha town for the last two years. She is 30 years old, married to Michael M., and they have four children. She was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the cash to buy beans, maize and peas in bulk to later sell to her customers who buy in small quantity. Jane also plans to start supplying cereals in the future as this will boost her income.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize and peas in bulk

loans.name: Teresa Esperanza

texts.es: Teresa Esperanza L. D. R. D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como taxista. Ambos son personas muy trabajadoras, quienes se esfuerzan día con día para vivir D. una forma digna. Teresa cuenta con un chalet, en el cual elabora diferentes tipos D. comida rápida como: hamburguesas, hotdog, papas fritas, y así mismo platillos típicos como pupusas y otros más. El negocio está ubicado en las cercanías del estadio Cuscatlán, el estadio más granD. del país, el cual es un lugar D. mucho comercio y afluencia D. personas por lo que ella cuenta con varios clientes. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. la comida como: carne, salchichas, salsas y otras más.
texts.en:
Teresa Esperanza L. D. R. is 57 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband who works as a taxi driver. She and her husband are both very hardworking people and put in effort everyday to live a decent life.

Teresa has a place where she sells different types of fast food such as hamburgers, hotdogs, French fries, as well as traditional dishes such as pupusas and others. Her business is located near the Cuscatlán stadium, which is the country’s biggest and is a place with a lot of business and people that pass by, meaning many customers for her.

Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can purchase materials for making the food such as: meat, hot dogs, sauces, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Wilma Mariana

texts.es:
Wilma Mariana C. C. tiene 30 años. Es soltera vive sola vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  No Tiene  hijos.  

Wilma pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Wilma trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz y el arroz  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la comprar maiz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar una casa y comprar un carro.
Le gusta viajar.
texts.en:
Wilma Mariana C. C. is 30 years of age.  She is single and lives alone in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios.  She does not have any children.   

Wilma belongs to the Nueva Inspiración (New Inspiration) communal bank located in the Anchoveta precinct, which belongs to the Puerto Pechiche parish, Pueblo Viejo canton.  It is a group dedicated to farming crops in a short growing cycle, mainly corn, rice and 'gandul' beans (similar to black-eyed peas).  The group has 13 members. 

Wilma works in agriculture.  She sows corn and rice in short growing cycles.  She buys seed in Guayaquil and sells her crop in the area surrounding her home and in the market of Ventanas. 

She requests a loan to buy seed for rice and corn.  The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her needs.  Her dream is to buy a house and a car.  She likes to travel. .

loans.use: To buy seed for corn and rice.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Ángel P. G. tiene 42 años casados con la Señora María Sonia Olivera Villarroel mas de  6 años, tienen 3 hijos menores dependientes que estudian en nivel primaria, en la escuela rural de la comunidad, actividad principal es la agricultura produce papaliza, papa, haba en 2 hectáreas en la comunidad de Toncoli 2, tienen 2 cabezas de ganado vacuno que utiliza en las faenas agrícolas,  son de familia humilde de pocos recursos pero muy trabajadores, están a 55 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba para ellos  acudir a los bancos para un préstamo de dinero es muy difícil.  

Se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona rural. donde Don Ángel P. G. necesitaba dinero para comprar abono orgánico, semilla de papa para la siembra de este año, don Ángel nos comenta que la producción agrícola en este año ha sido poco por factores climáticos como la sequia, si este año no siembra no tendría alimentación ni dinero tampoco ahorro para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ángel P. G. is 42 years old. He has been married to Mrs. María Sonia Olivera Villarroel for more than 6 years. They have three minor dependent children who are in primary school at the rural community school.  His main activity is agriculture. He grows papaliza, potatoes and beans on 2 hectares in the community of Toncoli 2. They have 2 heads of cattle that they use for agricultural work. They are a humble family of few resources but very hardworking. They are 55 km from the city of Cochabamba. For them, going to a bank for a money loan is very difficult.  

There was an initiative to go to this rural area where Ángel P. G. needed money to buy organic fertilizer and potato seed for this year's planting. Angel tells us that the agricutural production for this year has been low due to waether factors such as drought. If he doesn't plant this year, he won't have food or money to support his family.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and potato seed

loans.name: Arling Melissa

texts.es:
La Joven Arling M. se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, Joyas de Plata, para Damas y caballeros, actividad que realiza de manera domiciliar en la aldea de Jutiapa, Jamastran, aldeas y caseríos circunvecinos y de igual manera con clientes de la ciudad de Danlí.
Arling se a sabido ganar la clientela, mismos que la prefieren por las facilidades de pago que les ofrece y por la buena calidad de productos que vende ya que son de marcas reconocidas.
El crecimiento en su negocio es notable. Arling tiene muchas metas y sueños que piensa cumplir por que es una joven muy luchadora y no se vence a los obstáculos que le presenta la vida.
Arling es madre soltera tiene una niña de 3 años la cual depende a un 100% de ella y que con los ingresos que le genera su negocio cubre todos sus gastos personales y los de su hija.
Actualmente se encuentra cursando sus estudios universitarios mismos que se paga con los ingresos que le genera su negocio,  su meta es graduarse de la universidad de Licenciada en Pedagogía, para prepararse mucho más y poder brindar después el estudio que su hija desea, su pequeña hija le dice que cuando ella sea grande quiere ser Doctora.
texts.en:
Arling M. is a young woman who has a business selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics and silver jewelry for men and women.  She sells her goods door to door in the village of Jutiapa, Jamastran, in neighboring towns and villages and also to customers in the city of Danlí.

Arling has known how to attract customers who like doing business with her because of the payment facilities which she offers and the good quality of the products she sells which are well-known brands.  The growth of her business has been outstanding.  Arling has many goals and dreams which she would like to fulfil as she is a fighter and she doesn't give up when life puts obstacles in her way.

Arling is a single mother who has a 3 year-old girl who depends on her 100%.  With the profits she makes in her business, she covers her own personal expenses and those of her daughter.

Currently Arling is pursuing her university studies which she is funding with the profits which she makes in her business.  Her goal is to graduate from university with a degree in pedagogy (education) so that she can prepare herself much more and then be able to provide her daughter with the education that she wishes for.  Her young daughter says that when she grows up she would like to be a doctor.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, creams, lotions and perfumes

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita R. is from the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a clothing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling general clothing services to local community members. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Nenita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 42 - Đông Lân 2- Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Hanh C. T. (204) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hanh is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 42 - Đông Lân 2- Dien Bien (03.03.42 Dien Bien).

Hanh is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, Hanh owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Hanh has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. T. Long (202) is a 54-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her grocerry store.


2.  N. T. K. Chung (203) is a 21-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support  her service-based business (rent small room).

3.  Phan T. Hong (205) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


4.  L. T. Chinh (207) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her haircut service business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Hanh C. T. (204) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 42 - Đông Lân 2- Dien Bien (03.03.42 Dien Bien).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hanh kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 0,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. T. Long (202) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  N. T. K. Chung (203) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh dịch vụ cho thuê phòng trọ.


3.  Phan T. Hong (205) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


4.  L. T. Chinh (207) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc dịch vụ cắt tóc, gội đầu.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Yonny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Yonny; ella tiene 23 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otros productos más, de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar mas su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Qori Orcco communal bank. The bank is located in the Urcos district which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.

Yonny is 23 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business where she sells basic needs items such as rice, sugar and milk, among other items. This is how Yonny gets her family ahead.

She is requesting the loan to set up her store more.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan repayments.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell to expand his business

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona A. lives in the Kawaala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters).    Phiona  has a business selling second-hand clothes.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Phiona sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail.     

Phiona  has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes.    She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenges for Phiona include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land and also to start selling at wholesale only. Phiona lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Phally Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group consists of seventeen people in Thkov village in Takeo province. Mrs. S. P. is the group's president, selected by the other members who will use their individual portions of the loan for different purposes to improve their families' living standards. Mrs. S. P. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family; her husband, Mr. Trok On, is a teacher in a local village where he makes a small salary to contribute. Although they work hard, they can only make a small income. So Mrs. S. P. is seeking for a loan to buy some piglets, pig food, and to build a pigsty to breed pigs. She is the mother of three children all of whom attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy some piglets, pig food, and build a pigsty too breed pigs

loans.name: Julio Samuel

texts.es:
Julio Samuel  Agencia de A. tiene 49 años y  una familia conformada por su cónyuge y tres hijos en las edades de  diez, trece y quince años, con los que tiene firmes esperanza de apoyarles la consolidación de un futuro exitoso; él  tiene en el centro de la ciudad, una de las zonas mas comerciales de la ciudad de Barranquilla, un negocio donde ofrece los servicios de marquetería.  
Julio se inició trabajando con un comerciante de cuadros y en ese negocio fue  donde recopiló toda su experiencia  que le sirvió para conocer el oficio y el arte de la marquetería, por eso  antes de dos años  de trabajar allí, se independizó y emprendió su propia aventura de negocio con el que hasta hoy,  ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
 En la actualidad tiene cinco financiamientos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado financiar su cartera y responder a la demanda de sus clientes con mayor  variedad en los diseños, porque uno de sus sueños es   organizar una galería para ampliar su mercado y lograr una oferta bien exhibida, que impacte a sus clientes.  Con su primer credikiva, al que esta aplicando en la actualidad, comprará madera, clavos, puntillas, moldes y pegantes para hacer cuadros que tiene encargados, pues  cada inversión la hace sobre la base de su preventa lo que augura que esta sea exitosa .
texts.en:
Julio Samuel Agencia de A. is 49 years old and has a family that consists of his wife and three children (ages 10, 13, and 15). He has high hopes of supporting them and providing them with a successful future. In one of the most commercial areas in central Barranquilla, Julio has a business where he offers detailed inlay services.

He started his career by selling paintings. Through this business, he gained experience and knowledge in the art of detailed inlays. Julio has practiced this trade for two years, which allowed him to become independent and start the business he manages to this day. This business has helped his family move forward.

To date, Julio has received five loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The loans were used to finance his portfolio so that he could respond to the demands of his customers by offering a wide variety of designs. One of his dreams is to organize a gallery where he can expand his market and effectively display his work so that his customers will be impacted. His first loan through Kiva will be used to buy wood, nails, tacks, molds, and adhesives for making artwork that has already been requested. Each investment he makes is based on the level of successful pre-sales he has completed.

loans.use: Purchase wood, nails, tacks, molds, and adhesives for his artwork

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida M. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Adelaida owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Adelaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Adelaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anifath

texts.en:
Anifath is 39 years old and lives in the Sagbo district of Porto-Novo, Benin's administrative capital. Together with her husband, Tidjani, she looks after their three children, all of whom are in school.

For the past 20 years Anifath has sold meals from her stall outside her home. This is her fifth loan with ALIDE, following successful repayments of past loans, and it will allow her to purchase raw ingredients for her meals from Cotonou, Benin's largest city. Her aim is to eventually build her own home. She cites her welcoming nature as her strength as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa D. is a 50-year-old widow with nine children.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sardines and groceries.

Josefa has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from selling rice, corn and native coffee beans.

Josefa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tom's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen members. Mrs. Tom was born in 1951 is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the others members. 

Mrs. Tom is a farmer who owns a plot of land. She grows rice and vegetables for a living. In order to improve her farming, she would like to ask for a loan for supporting her farming crops. Aside from being a farmer, she also earns her living by selling vegetables in the local market. 

Mrs. Tom is a widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is farmer.

loans.use: For supporting her farming crops.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. runs a provisions store in Elmina, a fishing town in Ghana’s Central Region. Her income from this business, which she’s been in for two years now, helps pay for her three children’s school fees and the household utility bills. Her husband is a farmer. 

She sells a variety of items, including soap, tinned tomatoes, tinned sardines, soft drinks, diapers and toothbrushes. 

Sarah is keen to increase the variety of items she sells to attract more customers and to keep existing ones coming back. Her loan from Kiva will allow her to do just that. She plans to add items such as Milo (a brand of malted milk), sugar and milk, among other items, to her inventory.

loans.use: to increase the variety of items she sells.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Angeles is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her stall.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia prepares rice for sale in the early hours of the morning in Ayensudo, a village near Elmina. She displays fruits on a table for sale as well. She has been in this business for 2 years. Felicia has been through junior high school. She has a child. Her husband is a teacher. She assists her husband in paying the household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy oranges, watermelon, pineapple and other types of fruits to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit.

loans.use: to buy oranges, watermelon, pineapple and other types of fruits to sell

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Don Ines se dedica a la agricultura desde hace barios años,el siembra,maiz frijol etc, el nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le a hido bien en sus cultivos ahora el quiere sembrar un poco mas ya que tiene la oportunidad de dedicarse solo a la agricultura por eso el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono y de la misma manera comprar un poco mas de semillas, le sueño de el es darles lo mejor a sus hijos para que tengan mejores aportunidad en el futuro.
texts.en: Ines has been a farmer for many years.  He grows corn, beans, etc.  He tells us that thanks to God he has done well with his crops.  He now wants to plant a bit more since he has the opportunity to dedicate himself only to farming and this is why he’s asking for this loan to buy manure and to have a bit more seed.  His dream is to provide the best for his children so that they will have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Saitoti

texts.en:
Saitoti has been practicing farming in Narok, Kenya, for the last eight years. He is 33 years old, married and supports seven people in the family.

He has been a good client, and he repaid his previous loan well. He has applied for his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and also to hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting. From his anticipated profit, he plans to add stock of seeds and fertilizer. 

In the future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the region.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elsa Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Elsa es socia del banco comunal Más que Vencedoras, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que cuenta con una hermosa estructura arquitectónica,  su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señora. Elsa tiene 27 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de un año y siete meses. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Elsa se dedica al cuidado de su hijo por lo que aun esta pequeño y tambien en su casa cría  pollos, en esta actividad  se encuentra hace un año.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su sueño es  tener un negocio propio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank "Mas Que Vencedoras", meaning "More Than Victorious". She lives in the outskirts of the city of Azogues. The city possesses a beautiful architecture and its people maintain their culture and traditions. They are very kind and charismatic people.

Elsa is 27 years old, married, and from her relationship she conceived a son. He is 1 year and seven months old. her husband works in the field of construction, as a bricklayer. They do not own a house of their own so they rent.

Elsa dedicates her time to the care of her son because he is still little and she also raises poultry from her house. She has had this activity for the past year. 

This is the fist loan that she accesses with her communal bank and she will invest it in the purchase of poultry had their feed.

Her dream is to have a business of her own, such as a store.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and their feed.

loans.name: Papa

texts.en:
Papa is 40 years old and lives in Bardnersville. He is married and has 2 children, ages 16 and 18. They all live at home. His wife has been working as a social worker. 

For the past 7 years, Papa has been selling shoes and used clothes. He is requesting a loan to purchase shoes and used clothes for his business. His plans are to send his children to school and build his house.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and used clothes for his business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is 47 years old. He is married and has five children to educate. To generate income, he raises crops primarily planting and harvesting rice for future merchandise. He usually merchandises it to local traders in the village. He earns a yield twice a year during the months of May and November. Profits earned are used for the education of his children, daily meals and bills at home.

Manuel is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides used in farming. Through his patience, determination and help of this loan, he will be able to improve his crop production. 

In the future, Manuel would like to earn consistent profits and make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Santiago Leonardo

texts.es:
Santiago Leonardo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero vive con los padres en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Santiago se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol compra de insumos, abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio.

Le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el indor.
texts.en:
Santiago Leonardo is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

The members of the Communal Bank “Unido Somos” (We Are United) meet in the neighborhood of El Marañón in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and beans.

Santiago is a farmer who grows corn, rice, and beans. He buys his supplies at the Agro Karlita Commercial Center and sells his products at the Castillo Commercial Market.

Santiago is requesting a loan for planting corn, rice, and beans. He plans to buy farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for his crops. With the financial support of this loan, he will be able to purchase what he needs. Among the challenges he faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to increase his business.

Santiago enjoys practicing sports, especially indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, composts, and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Joanes

texts.en:
Joanes is 43 years old, married and has four children.  To earn a living, he sells fish.  He has been in the business for 13 years.  He has managed to retain his business because of his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He also employs two people in his business.
Joanes hopes to grow his business into a wholesale operation in the future.  He has requested for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy fish.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Guillermina Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Guillermina de 47 años de edad, trabaja como docente en la colonia Rio Rama impartiendo el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa comunidad, està solicitando su 2do credito para  comprar  materiales de construcciòn y  asi poco a poco mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda, su compañero de vida trabaja como albañil, el le ayuda con el pago de sus gastos familiares y con sus compromisos crediticios, esta humilde docente es muy querida por los padres, alumnos y compañeros de trabajo por su gran amor a la docencia y ser una mujer muy sencilla, su sueño es tener un porvenir mejor y tener estabilidad laboral para asi ayudar a su linda familia.
texts.en: Guillermina is 47 years old, a teacher in the suburbs in Rio Rama. She teaches the rural children of this community. She is asking for her second loan in order to buy construction materials and thus little by little to improve the infrastructure of her house. Her life partner works as a brick layer, and helps with the family expenses and loan commitments. This humble teacher is loved by her parents, students and colleagues because of her great love for teaching and being a simple woman. Her dream is to have a better future and stable working conditions so she can provide for her beautiful family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James used his previous loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy seedlings. His farm produced a lot of vegetables, which he sold and got more income to pay off his loan and cater for his family's needs. He was also able to pay school fees comfortably for his children because his business improved.

James has requested for another loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy two cows and animal feeds.

loans.use: To buy two cows and animals feeds.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a businessman and has operated a kiosk for the past two years. He is 28 years old, single, and supports his parents.

He was introduced to KADET by the KADET staff and he has applied for his first loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he plans to use to purchase more stock of goods. He hopes to make more profit and invest the income by expanding his business to a wholesale business. 

His dream is to be rich and live a better life than he is now. He is hardworking guy who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 5 children. He has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from Natasha & Boardwalk. He has had this business for 5 years. 

Ronie has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more stock for his store.  He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his store from Natasha & Boardwalk.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence  lives in Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her brothers). 

Florence has a business selling cereals.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Florence sells her products in a shop, retail.  She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of beans, groundnuts and maize. She also generates additional income through owning a cosmetics shop.

The main business challenges for   Florence include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease transportation of cereals and to be a wholesaler.    Florence lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Cookery Women Group

texts.en:
Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Cookery Women” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 1,400,000.00 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu is 40 years old and married with two children who are attending secondary school. Isatu sells cooked rice. She has been in the rice-cooking business for 15 years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will invest in her business by buying cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil, onions, tomatoes, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc., in bulk in order to enable her to cook a larger quantity of rice and sauce for sale.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like rice, palm oil, onions, tomatoes, margi, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, tiene 37 años, esta casada con Paulino de 36 años; viven en su casa propia, junto a sus 04 hijos a quienes les dedica mucho esfuerzo. Catalina, junto a su esposo, es el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niña sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, Catalina es una mujer de arduo trabajo que cuenta con un terreno donde cultiva cacao. Viene trabajando 25 años en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de cacao. En adelante, desea comprar plantas de cacao para poder incrementar su producción. Este será su préstamo numero 08 con MFP, asimismo se siente agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan ya que así puede continuar con su trabajo; al igual que en su banco comunal es puntual y responsable en las reuniones que se realiza. Con el crédito solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar más plantas de cacao para incrementar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Catalina is 37, and married to Paulino, 36. They live in their own house, with their four children, who they do their very best for. Catalina, along with her husband is the support of the family.  

From a very early age her parents taught her to work their small farm. Catalina is a hard-working woman who has a plot of land where she grows cacao. She has been working on her own land for 25 years, and at harvest times, she needs the help of day laborers to move forward with the extraction of the crops. 

What she likes best about her work is harvesting her crops; since this way, she feels she is rewarded for the months of hard work by the quality of her crops. 

She considers that the hardest part is transporting her crops from her small farm to the town of San Francisco, a place where they offer better prices for her cacao. In the future she wishes to buy cacao plants, in order to increase her production. 

This will be her eighth loan with MFP, and she feels grateful for the support she is being offered, since this way she can continue working.  As well, in her communal bank she is on time and responsible in the meetings that are held. 

With the loan of 2,000 nuevos soles she is applying for, she will be able to buy more cacao plants in order to increase her crop.

loans.use: To buy more cacao plants.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth forma parte del Banco comunal “Ilusión 2011” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva para niños y adultos, desde hace dos años. Su mercadería la compra cada dos meses en el barrio Meiggs ubicado en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Comenta que comenzó con el negocio cuando se jubiló de su trabajo dependiente, en ese momento se percató que debía seguir manteniendo sus ingresos. 
La modalidad de sus ventas las realiza desde su hogar, los clientes solicitan productos y ella se encarga de comprar la mercadería. Además cuenta con un gran número de clientes, quienes prefieren su modalidad de trabajo. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa de temporada, específicamente jeans y poleras.
Las metas en su negocio son tener buenas utilidades para comprarse un vehículo, que le permita trasladar su mercadería.
