Ruth vive junto a su madre y su hermana. Uno de sus sueños son obtener su casa propia, para esto ya postuló al subsidio habitacional, por lo que ahora se encuentra a la espera del llamado para que comiencen a construir. 
Las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que debe costear los gastos de la casa y para solventarse ella también.
Ruth comenta que desde hace tres años debe cuidar a su madre quien debe recibir cuidados especiales, ya que se encuentra postrada, por lo que su negocio le permite cierta flexibilidad de horarios para atenderla. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda entregada por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha podido invertir en su negocio, lo que le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos y por ende una mejor calidad de vida. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones ella ha aprendido a administrar de mejor manera sus ingresos, lo que le ha permitido organizar la contabilidad de su negocio. Por lo que comenta, la institución ha sido una ayuda integral. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Ruth is part of the “Ilusión 2011” communal bank belonging to the city of Viña del Mar.  She has been selling new clothes for adults and children for two years.  She buys her merchandise every two months in the city of Santiago’s Meiggs neighborhood.  She comments that she started the business when she retired from her salaried job; at that time she noted that she had to continue earning income. Her sales are home-based.  Customers place orders and she then goes out and buys the merchandise.  

She has a large number of customers who like her way of doing business.  She will use the loan to buy seasonal clothes, specifically jeans and t-shirts.  Her business goal is to earn good profits to buy a vehicle that will make it possible for her to transport her merchandise.

Ruth lives with her mother and her sister.  One of her dreams is to have a house of her own and to do so she’s already signed up for a housing subsidy and is waiting for the approval to start building.  Her motivation to stay in business is that she must be able to pay the costs of the house as well as support herself.

Ruth comments that she’s had to care for her mother who is bedridden and needs special care for the last three years.  Her business affords her the flexibility in schedule that she needs to be able to care for her.

She is very happy and grateful for the help Fondo Esperanza has given her because she was able to invest in the business which has led to improved income and thus a better quality of life.

With respect to the training, she’s learned how to better manage her income which has allowed her to organize her business’ bookkeeping so she mentions that the institution has been an integral help.

Viña del Mar is a city and commune located on Chile’s central coast.  It’s knows as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios some of the city’s older homes have.  It is also considered to be Chile’s tourism capital.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Acuario Group

texts.es: Sinónimo de perseverancia es el grupo "Acuario", un grupo de mujeres y hombres optimistas y  luchadores. Este grupo lleva ya formado 1 año y medio, con 9 socios que vienen siendo ejemplo de personas inteligentes, se encuentran emprendiendo negocios que están transformando su entorno. La confianza que hay entre ellos no solo transcurre por el tiempo que llevan como grupo, también son vecinos y viven en la misma zona. Seria grato comentar de cada uno de las integrantes pero faltarían palabras. Por tanto mencionaremos al señor Rodolfo, un integrante de 61 años de edad y padre de 3 hijos. El se dedica al servicio de transporte el cual le ha dado muchos frutos económicos desde hace más de 10 años, pudiendo ahorrar para los gastos de la casa y arreglos de su carro. Con el presente préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de repuestos y remodelación del auto. Acuario un grupo personas  que con esmero y dedicación saben salir adelante con el paso de cada día.
texts.en:
The communal bank Acuario is synonymous with perseverance. They are a group of optimistic women and men. This communal bank was formed one and one-half years ago, with nine members who are examples of intelligent people that are launching businesses that are transforming our environment.

The trust that is between them not only comes about through the time they have been a communal bank, but also because they are neighbors and live in the same area. 

They would be happy to comment about each one of the members but they would lack the words. And so we will mention Rodolfo, a member who is 61 years old, who has a wife and three children. 

He works in the transport service which has given him many economic benefits for more than ten years, and he is able to save money in order to pay household expenses and repairs for the car. With the money from this loan he will buy spare parts for restoring the car. 

The communal bank Acuario is a group of caring and dedicated people who know how to face each passing day.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Djromahuton 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJROMAHUTON 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mondukpè Reine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mondukpè Reine est mariée à un certain Justin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mondukpè Reine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Mondukpè Reine n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais a appris la coiffure, activité qu’elle exerce depuis quatre ans dans un quartier du Bénin et qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. De façon secondaire, Mondukpè Reine vend des mèches, des produits de beauté, des tissus et des bijoux. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Mondukpè Reine s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mondukpè Reine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJROMAHUTON 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The DJROMAHUTON 2 group is made up of three people who live in the same area. This is the second time this group is seeking financial aid from ALIDé in order to increase the level of its business. The group representative, Mondukpè Reine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Mondukpè Reine is married to a man named Justin. The couple has three children, all of whom attend school and are in their care. Mondukpè Reine lives with her husband and children. Mondukpè Reine did not attend school, but instead learned hairstyling, which she has been doing for four years in a neighborhood in Benin, and from which she has been making significant earnings. Secondarily, Mondukpè Reine sells hair extensions, beauty products, fabrics, and jewelry. This business helps her contribute without difficulty to the needs of her family. Mondukpè Reine stocks up in Benin and in Nigeria. In the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her revenues, Mondukpè Reine is seeking a second loan with ALIDé with the other members of the DJROMAHUTON 2 group. The first loan was properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy boxes of hair extensions.

loans.name: Theourn's Group

texts.en:
Theourn, residing in Kampong Cham province, is 50 years old and married. She is a mother of three kids; two are in school and one is working as a factory worker. To deal with the daily living cost, she grows rainy season rice and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

This is the first loan for Theourn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now in a group of two, she is a leader. 

She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne dreams of getting her family out of poverty, and to that end, decided to practice mixed farming. Everlyne is a native of the village of Kipsaina in the Kitale area of Kenya where she lives with her lovely family. Her upbringing was challenging and she never went to college or had a formal job. She has farmed for five years and is able to take care of her family. She sells milk and grows crops.

She is able to support her family as the only breadwinner. Everlyne loves farming and has nicknamed one of her animals. Although she has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious woman. She is challenged to meet the demand for cereals which is really high in her remote village. Everlyne is kindly requesting for a loan to cereals. Through the loan she will be able to meet the demand and also sell cereals in other markets hence improve her income levels. Cereals such as maize are very popular because they are used in preparing flour which is a commonly used commodity in all homes hence Everlyne will have ready market
Increased profits from the loan will allow her to repay the loan fully, permanently change her living conditions, and assure her children aging parents of a secure future.
You can help Everlyne to accomplish all her dreams with a loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on business

loans.name: Edoh

texts.en:
Edoh A. was born in Agbodrafo (in Les Lacs prefecture) on November 22, 1982. He is single with no children. He left school because of frequent headaches that prevented him from studying. So he entered an apprenticeship for cutting hair in order to support himself. He is a master barber, and as a result, he is renowned in his neighborhood. Parents want to send their children to him as apprentices, but he does not have a shop in which to teach them. He therefore is requesting a loan of $600 to open his own shop and to buy certain indispensable supplies and tools of the trade. He can then get a start in his business. Once his plan is realized, he will be financially independent.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 22 novembre 1982 à Agbodrafo dans la préfecture des Lacs, Monsieur A. Edoh est célibataire sans enfant. Abandonnant ses études suite à de fréquents maux de tête qui l’empêche d’étudier, il se lance dans l’apprentissage de la coiffure pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins. Il a une maîtrise totale de son métier, ce qui lui confère une bonne renommé dans son quartier. D’autres parents veulent envoyer leurs enfants en apprentissage chez lui mais il n’a pas un atelier.

Alors, il sollicite un crédit de $600 pour l’ouverture de son atelier et l’achat de certains matériels de travail très indispensables pour le démarrage de son activité. Avec la réalisation de ce projet, il aura une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To open a barber shop and to buy barber supplies

loans.name: Mónica

texts.en:
Monica sells gas tanks for household use out of her home. She started her business with a small sum her mother provided. She is the only one operating this type of business, which has a strong demand. Monica will use the loan to purchase more gas tanks. She is confident this loan will help her grow the business. Monica is 24 years old, single and lives with her mother. She hopes that with this loan she can improve her family's quality of life and save to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Mónica se dedica a la venta de gas domestico en su domicilio. Empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital que le dio su madre. Es único negocio en su sector tiene mucha demanda de compra. Mónica usara el préstamo para invertir en compra de tanques de gas. Ella tiene la confianza que su negocio crecerá. Mónica tiene 24 años, es soltera vive junto con su madre. Ella tiene la esperanza que con este préstamo mejorara la calidad de vida de su familia y le permitirá ahorrar para la construcción de su vivienda.

loans.use: To purchase natural gas tanks

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.es:
Ms Rosalia lives near a brick factory. She started her business with the help of her sister and father, who learned from their predecessors. Right now, Rosalia helps her children, who also work in the brick business.

She asks for a loan to purchase high-quality material necessary for the production of bricks. She hopes to store these until the winter when the rain season begins and makes it difficult for production. She also hopes to attract more customers by improving her business' advertisements.

Ms Rosalia is 50 years old and has 4 children, two of which are in school. With the advancement of her business, Rosalia hopes that in the near future she can finish the construction of her cement house.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Rosalía tiene cerca de su casa una fábrica de ladrillos. Ella comenzó el negocio con la ayuda de su hermana y papa que aprendieron el trabajo de sus antepasados quienes se dedicaban a este negocio desde siempre. Actualmente a Rosalía le ayudan sus hijas quienes también hacen ladrillos

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas materia prima pues necesita hacer ladrillos para tener guardado para el invierno que por las lluvias le resulta difícil hacer además espera poder mejorar los anuncios que tiene y así llamar mas clientes

La Sra. Rosalía tiene 50 años y cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estudian, su casa es de caña y tiene estabilidad familiar. Ella aspira que con el mejoramiento de su negocio podrá en un futuro cercano terminar su casa que esta empezando a construir de cemento

loans.use: To purchase high-quality material for the production of bricks

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru:
Omina J. has been in business selling eggs for 8 years. She is married and has four children. She has a post-secondary education. Her husband is a salesman. Her eldest daughter is married and the rest of the children are going to school. Omina started her business with $30. Omina received her first loan of $70 from MLF “MicroInvest” in 2004. She slowly increased sales turnover and attracted many clients which helped her to improve her standard of living. She has doubled her assets and she is planning to start selling eggs wholesale with the new loan.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Чураева Омина занимается продажей яиц вот уже 8лет. Замужем, имеет четверых детей, образование среднее. Муж занимается торговлей, старшая дочь замужем остальные дети учатся в школе. Начала она заниматься этой деятельностью с 30$. В МЗФ «Микроинвест» первый займ в размере 70$ получила в 2004году. Постепенно она увеличила товарооборот, приобрела много клиентов, и улучшила уровень жизни. Сейчас её активы возросли в два раза больше, и в будущем она планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Wholesale trade of eggs

loans.name: At

texts.en: Mrs. At  P., age 55, works with her husband growing rice crops in their rice paddy, earning together about $5 per day. They have six children: three who are working in undisclosed jobs, two who are students, and one who is married and lives separately. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to repair her house after the rainy season and reinforce the walls. In the background of the photo is part of a wall that she has started to reinforce.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 70 years old. She is married and has 10 surviving children and 22 grandchildren. Her husband, Alfredo, used to be an agricultural worker, but cannot work anymore because his vision is fading. Lita has a fifth grade education and is illiterate, but she was able to put her children through high school. She lives in a small concrete house next door to her restaurant with her husband and two of her grandchildren.

Lita has owned a small restaurant for over 40 years; it is located on the main road outside of Samana and most of her customers are her neighbors and people she has grown up with. She also sells plantains, which grow on plantain trees she has behind her house. Now that her husband can no longer work, her restaurant has become her family’s primary source of income. She is seeking to take out her first loan from Esperanza to restock her shelves and increase her profits.

loans.use: To invest in her small restaurant

loans.name: Ni Komang Murni

texts.id:
Besides being a farmer, Ni Komang Murni also has an activity of raising a mother cow. Today Ni Komang Murni only owns 1 mother cow because of capital shortage. Today Ni Komang Murni needs additional capital of Rp 4,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00), which would be used to buy one additional mother cow, so that within a year she could harvest 2X. From her experience with 1 mother cow, within a year she could bore calf only 1X. And, after 5-6 months the calf could be sold. Calf prices differ - depending on gender. If it were a male calf it would sell more than female, whose price would fluctuates between Rp2,200,000-2,500,000. If Ni Komang Murni raises 2 mother cow, surely within a year she could harvest about 2X, with more income. Then those cow income sales would be used to pay for their living expense, and also for future schooling expenses of their small children, who are still pre-school age.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Selain sebagai petani, Ni Komang Murni juga memiliki kesibukan memelihara induk sapi. Saat ini Ni Komang Murni hanya memelihara 1 ekor induk sapi karena kurangnya modal yang dimiliki. Saat ini Ni Komang Murni membutuhkan tambahan modal Rp 4.000.000 yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli tambahan satu ekor induk sapi supaya dalam setahun bisa panen sebanyak dua kali. Dari pengalaman yang lalu satu induk sapi dalam setahun hanya bisa melahirkan anak satu kali. Dan setelah 5 sampai 6 bulan akan bisa dijual. Harga anak sapi berbeda – beda sesuai dengan jenis kelaminnya. Jika anaknya jantan maka akan laku terjual lebih mahal dibandingkan sapi yang betina yang harganya berkisar Rp. 2.200.000.- sampai Rp. 2.500.000.- Jadi Jika Ni Komang Murni memelihara dua ekor induk sapi tentu dalam setahun bisa panen sebanyak dua kali dengan pendapatan yang lebih banyak lagi. Dan nantinya dari hasil penjualan sapi ini akan dipergunakan untuk biaya hidup mereka dan juga biaya sekolah anak –anaknya kelak karena sekarang memang masih kecil dan belum bersekolah.

loans.use:
To buy a cow

Membeli sapi

loans.name: Thi Minh

texts.vi:
Mrs. Minh, 41 years old, has two school age children. She has a general stand at the market in Chờ for many years. Everyone knows her at her stand. The daily income is about 6USD. She would like to apply for a loan to buy more goods for her stand. She likes the weekly repayment schedule that she can fulfill easily. Currently, she has a educational loan for her children.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Minh, 41 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Cô bán hàng tạp hoá tại Chợ Chờ nhiều năm nay, nên có rất nhiều khách quen. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cố là 100000đ/ngày. Cô mong muốn vay vốn để mua thêm hàng. Hiện gia đình cô đang vay vốn của Ngân hàng chính sách xã hội theo diện học sinh sinh viên nghèo cho con cô đi học. Cô thích vay vốn ở Chương trình tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc hơn vì được trả góp hàng tuần và lâu dài.

loans.use: bán hàng tạp hoá

loans.name: Leah's Ngeta Group

texts.en:
Leah is a 34 year old married woman with two children, ages 8 and 4. Leah is a maize flour seller; she started this business in 2003. Every day she works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, where she earns a monthly profit of about $110.

In the past, Leah has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for another loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have small businesses selling clothing and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Nyaso

texts.en:
Nyaso is 45-years-old and is a married woman with 3 children; ages 14,7, and 4. She and her husband also take care of one other person. Nyaso makes coffins, a business she started in 2000. She works from 7AM to 8PM ands earn a monthly profit of approximately $450.

Nyaso has taken out one successful loan to expand her business. She now hopes for another loan to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Mrs. C. lives in the neighborhood of “Villa de Reconciliacion”. She is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children. Two of them work in the construction business, and help her with the basic daily expenses. Mrs. C. is a seamstress (with six years of experience) who started her business with money that her husband gave her, and who is fighting to get ahead for her children. With this loan, she would like to build a bathroom and a kitchen in order to improve their home and their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. C. habita en el barrio Villa de Reconciliación con 48 años de edad es casada con tres hijos, dos de ellos trabajan en la construcción y le ayudan para los gasto básico. Ella es costurera tiene seis años de experiencia luchando `para salir adelantes con sus hijos. Comenzó su negocio, con dinero que el esposo le dio, el préstamo lo va invertir para construir baños y cocina. Para dar aspecto a su vivienda y mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: To improve her home.

loans.name: Chhit

texts.en:
Chhit D., 37 years of age, lives in Kampong Cham Province, where she is a yam farmer earning $3 per day. This is a popular crop in Kampong Cham and she is fortunate to be able to earn that much. Her husband earns about $8 per day selling gasoline from a roadside stand. These stands usually consist of a manual pump attached to a barrel of gasoline with a meter to tell how much gas has been pumped. Together they support four children.

Chhit D. would now like to take out a loan to buy her husband a greater store of gasoline since the fuel has risen past $7 per gallon in Cambodia and it is becoming difficult for him to afford to buy it even by the barrel. Some of the loan will also go towards next year’s yam crop for her.

loans.use: To buy yam seed and gasoline.

loans.name: Las Amorosas Group

texts.es:
The mornings in the city of El Alto are very cold as a result of the harsh winter, but this does not stop the association “Las Amorosas,” whose members work very early making exquisite tucumanas (fried meat and vegetable pies) accompanied by a variety of salsas that are offered to-go on moving carts that are designed for this purpose. Currently they want to grow their business and they need to contract helpers to make and sell the meat pies, in addition to acquiring soft drinks to offer to their clients. In this way they will generate more income for the good of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Las mañanas en la ciudad de El Alto son muy frías a consecuencia del crudo invierno por el que se esta pasando, pero esto no impide a la asociación “Las amorosas” que trabajan desde muy temprano elaborando exquisitas tucumanas (empanadas fritas de carne y verduras) acompañadas de una variedad de salsas , que luego las ofrecen de manera ambulante en singulares carritos adecuados para este tipo de oficio, Ahora quieren ampliar su negocio por lo que necesitan contratar ayudantes para la elaboración y venta de sus empanadas, además de poder adquirir gaseosas para ofrecerlas a su clientes de este modo generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus numerosas familias

loans.use: They need credit to recruit helpers and to acquire soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli is 23 years old. She has two children, ages 2 and 4. Batuli sells both charcoal and chapatti, a kind of cake. She began her business in 2008, and works everyday from 6 AM to 6 PM.

Batuli hopes that with her loan, she can purchase more charcoal and continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Titilope Rebecca

texts.en:
Titilope Rebecca F., 41, has been a fashion designer since 1991 and sells clothing that she sews and clothes that she purchases from companies. She learned how to sew clothes three years ago. Titilope lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria with her husband and three children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for resale and a sewing machine, so that she can meet the demands of her numerous customers.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Marié et père d’un enfant, T. Koffi est né le 23/11/1983 à  Agbodjan Kopé dans la préfecture des Lacs. Sa conjointe est femme au foyer sans revenu. Ils habitent le quartier Dabara Kondji à Lomé. Il sollicite ce crédit pour ouvrir un magasin d’alimentation générale et vente de produits pharmaceutiques génériques. Ce crédit lui permettra d'améliorer ses revenus et les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Married and the father of one child, Koffi T. was born on November 23, 1983 in Agbodjan Kopé in the Lakes Prefecture. His partner is a housewife who does not earn an income. They live in the Dabara Kondji district in Lomé. He is requesting this loan to open a little general store where he also plans to sell generic medicines. This loan will permit him to improve his income and the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: opening a general store

loans.name: Cruz Luciano

texts.es: El Sr. Cruz tiene 35 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Villa Reconciliación  de los bomberos 6 andenes al norte, su esposa es comerciante vende frutas y ayuda a los gatos de la familia, el negocio de don Cruz es la venta de lubricantes y vulcanización, tiene diez años de estar en las ventas, el inicio con dinero que su mama le dio para que comenzara, luego ha ido invirtiendo con dinero que ha prestado a largo plazo en Afodenic. Con la solicitud de préstamos es para invertir en la compra de lubricantes y neumáticos nuevos para ofertar a su clientela. A largo plazo es poder comprar un compresor moderno y estantes para lubricante para que el cliente pueda ver sus productos con mayor visibilidad y captar más clientes
texts.en:
Cruz is 35 years old and h e lives in the region named «Villa Reconciliacion de los bomberos 6 andenes» north. His wife is a vendor of fresh fruits and she contributes to the family's finances. The business that Cruz runs is the sales of auto lube products. He has been selling these products for 10 years, a business he started with funds that were given to him by his Mom. He then acquired a series of loans from Afodenic and all funds were invested back in the purchase of lube products and new tires to offer his clients. His long term goal is to be able to purchase a modern compressor and shelving to organize his products. His clients will be able to browse the products and with greater visibility he will be able to gain more clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lube products and tires.

loans.name: Jurahon

texts.ru: Муродов Джурахон житель города НУрек. Женат. В возрасте 41  года имеет семерых детей. Два года занимается торговлей. Имеет киоск на центральном рынке . Торгуетразличными промышленными товарами , а так же газетами. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, завезти свежий товар с новым ассортиментом. Это поможет развивать бизнес , расширить торговую точку и привлечь новых клиентов . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месцев.
texts.en:
Jurahon M. lives in the city of Nurek. He is married, and at 41 years old has seven children. He has been working in sales for two years. He has a kiosk at the central market where he sells various commercial goods in addition to newspapers. He wants to use a loan to buy the latest goods to expand his selection and increase sales. This will help the business develop, expand the kiosk, and attract new customers. He will repay the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Sales

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
“I would like to sustain our business and somehow expand it in the future because it is my goal to help my husband in supporting the needs of our family, especially the education of our children,” Milagros said.

Milagros is helping her husband earn a living by collecting and selling firewood in their village.  During weekends, their children also help her collect wood. 

She is married to Gaudencio, a driver in their area.  They are helping each other provide for the needs of their family, especially the education of their children who are still studying.  They are blessed with six: Ranmil – 28 years old and a college undergraduate; Mila – 22 years and a high school graduate; Myrr – 20 years old and in the third year of college; Gaudencio Jr. – 19 years, a vocational course graduate in automotive repair; Mae – 14 years, in junior high school; and Ralph – 13 years old and a high school freshman. 

Milagros wanted to become an entrepreneur but lack of capital prevented her from sustaining her wood business.  She has applied for a loan which she will use to compensate people who collect wood.  This will not only allow her to have enough wood to sell, but can also help her neighbors earn extra income.

loans.use: to hire people to collect wood for her business

location.town: Sitio Guingab, Masipi East Cabagan, Isabela

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Greetings from Gorette M. in Nyarugenge district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Gorette is 35 years old and the mother of 5 kids.

In 2005, Gorette started her business selling shoes for kids and adults. This entrepreneur buys shoes from neighboring countries (Uganda and Kenya) in bulk and sells them in the local markets. Her capital has accumulated to over $1150 over the past four years. She employs two people and makes about $95 every month. The loan she has requested will help her to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: A resident of Pursat Province, Cambodia, Mrs. S. makes a profit by selling palm-sugar, from village to village. She usually collects sugar from a palm-climber and sells it retail to neighbors, and she can earn in income approximately US$ 4 per day to support her family. She is married and has three children, all of whom are teenagers. Her husband is a vegetable grower. S. is requesting a loan of US$ 400 for her husband to pay plowing expenses for re-growing vegetables and also to buy cow to raise for its baby.

loans.use: To pay for plowing expenses and to buy a cow

loans.name: Carlos Modesto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Modesto, tiene la edad de 73 años habita en el barrio san José de los ríos, en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa, la cual le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene hijos pero no a su cargo, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poner un pequeño taller de carpintería y elaboración de horno para producción de pan. Él desde hace diez año trabaja como agricultor lo que el cultiva es quequisque y repollo, la mayor dificultad que ha tenido es la falta de orientación de de un técnico ya que en cultivos pasado el repollo se lleno completamente de plaga. Inicio con sus propias iniciativas, los planes hacia un futuro es establecer más cultivos de los productos antes mencionado. Con esta solicitud va invertir en productos de insumos para abonar los cultivos y tener una mejor producción y poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Carlos Modesto is 73 years old and lives together with his wife in the San Jose De Los Rios district, in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She helps him with the household expenses and has two children but no longer in her care. The plans he has for his family is to improve the living conditions and to set up a small carpentry workshop and a brick oven to make bread. For the last ten years he has been working as an agriculturer harvesting taro root and cabbage. The greatest challenge that he has met is that the lack of support from a technician, especially after some harvests were taken over by plagues. He started out on his own accord with plans towards a future, to establish more plantation of harvests previously mentioned. With this loan he will invest in products to fertilize the fields for a better yield and to sell the products at a better price in the markets.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products to improve the harvests.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores es una mujer de 43 años muy trabajadora, está divorciada de su pareja y vive de manera independiente en una casa muy humilde, de la cual es dueña, está dispuesta a trabajar duro con tal de salir adelante y mejorar su vida. Dolores tiene muchas ganas de mejorar su futuro, es por eso que trabaja arduamente todo los días vendiendo leche, sus clientes la buscan por la leche tan sabrosa y pura que vende y es que ella tiene mucho cuidado en seleccionar la leche que llevara a vender. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede pasar mucho tiempo en el campo con sus animales y ver que se alimenten bien, son 9 años los que lleva en este negocio y anhela tener un puesto donde pueda vender su leche, ya que actualmente lo hace de manera ambulatoria y tiene que caminar todo el día, lo cual hace más difícil la venta, es esto justamente lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo, pero ella sabe que el camino a su desarrollo personal no es fácil y está dispuesta a afrontar cualquier dificultad que se le presente. Es el primer préstamo de Dolores con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a ahorrar un poco todos los días para lograrlo, es una socia muy alegre en su banco comunal y es muy querida por las demás. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará más forraje para alimentar mejor a sus vacas le den más leche para vender.
texts.en:
Dolores is a very hardworking 43-year-old woman. She is divorced from her partner and lives independently in a very humble house she owns herself. She is disposed to work very hard to get ahead and improve her life. She is very eager to improve her future, and for this reason she works hard every day selling milk. Her customers seek her out for her tasty, pure milk, because she takes a lot of care to select the milk she sells. She enjoys her work, as it allows her to spend a lot of time in the country with her animals and see that they are well fed. She has been in this business for nine years and hopes to have a place to sell her milk, since she currently acts as a traveling saleswoman and has to walk all day. This is the hardest and understandably the least pleasant part of her work, but she knows that the road to her personal development isn't easy and she is ready to face any difficulty that lies before her. This is Dolores's first loan with MFP. She knows that she must pay on time and is ready to save a little bit each day in order to do so. She is a very happy member of her communal bank, and is beloved by the others. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy more forage to better feed her cows so they will give her more milk to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for cows

loans.name: Aissata

texts.fr:
Madame Aïssata D. est âgée de 32 ans et vit avec son enfant et son époux dans une famille monogame dans l’un des plus célèbres quartier de Koutiala,  Koko de la ville de Koutiala (  Région de Sikasso ).
 Pour des raisons sociales, Aïssata  n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier, ce qui explique son très vite  intéressement aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce qu’elle appris auprès de sa mère.
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités, elle opta pour le commerce d’articles divers avec la vente des plastiques, du sounbala et divers autres articles depuis 11 ans.
 Madame Aïssata est très bien sollicitée par ses clients tant à l’intérieur qu’à  l’extérieur du Mali tel  (la Côte D’Ivoire, le Burkina Faso). 
 Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle, Aïssata a décidé de rejoindre  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il  y a juste 2 mois, elle est à son  premier prêt individuel.
 Elle compte acheter, 20 paires de plastique,  5 paniers de sounbala et divers autres marchandises avec ce prêt. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Koutiala et effectue sa vente, à Koutiala,  au Burkina Faso et en Côte D’ivoire à une clientèle  constituée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son échéance, participer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille et poursuivre son activité avec le reste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aïssata D. is 32 years old and lives with her child and husband in a monogamous family in one of the most famous neighborhoods of Koutiala, Koko, in the city of Koutiala (Sikasso region). For social reasons, Aïssata didn’t have the chance to go to school, which explains her quick interest in earning money, notably commerce, which she learned from her mother. After having tried different businesses, she opted to sell diverse items in the sales of plastics, sounbala (a natural condiment), and other items for the last 11 years. Mrs. Aïssata is well sought by her clients from both within and outside of Mali (i.e., the Côte D’Ivoire, Burkina Faso). To increase the size of her business and meet the needs of her clientele, Aïssata decided just 2 months ago to join microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, where she is on her first individual loan. She plans to buy 20 packages of plastic items, 5 baskets of sounbala and other miscellaneous items with this loan. She stocks up at the large market in Koutiala and makes her sales in Koutiala, Burkina Faso and the Côte D’Ivoire to a clientele consisting of both women and men. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 100,000 CFA francs, which she will use to repay her loan, pay for her family’s needs, and continue with the business with the rest.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase miscellaneous items

loans.name: Miriam Estela

texts.es: Miriam Estela G. vive en Soyapango departamento de San Salvador, Miriam es una mujer viuda que ha aprendido a sostener  a su familia con esfuerzo y mucho trabajo. Miriam se dedica a su negocio que es la venta de ropa y zapatos, diariamente sale de su casa a ofrecer su productos , en el transcurso de la semana viaja a todos los departamentos del país yendo a uno  diferente cada día y  haciendo todas  sus ventas de manera ambulante, Miriam solicita este crédito para poder comprar más mercadería de esta manera lograra un mayor margen de ganancias .
texts.en:
Miriam Estela Garcia lives in the Soyapango neighborhood of San Salvador. She is a widow who has learned to support her family with strength and hard work. Miriam operates a business selling clothes and shoes. She goes out every day to sell her goods and, in the course of a week, she travels to every part of the country, working as a street vendor in a different place every day. Miriam is asking for this loan so that she can buy more merchandise and, in this way, increase her earnings margin.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es: Juana del Carmen V. tiene 48 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos son independientes. La actividad económica de Doña Carmen es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante ya que esta es la mejor manera de buscar a los clientes. Por lo que inicio este negocio porque tenía proporcionarles a sus hijos estabilidad en sus estudios, Doña Carmen no poseía muchos productos cuando comenzó. El propósito de para su negocio es crecer poco a poco y establecerse en determinado lugar. El financiamiento es para suministrar su negocio ya que necesita expandirse en otras líneas debido a la demanda de parte de sus clientes. Por lo que gustaría establecer una tienda de ropa en su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un medio de supervivencia para el futuro.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen V. is a 48 year old single mother. She has 5 children, 3 of whom are grown. Carmen has been selling clothing for more than 5 years. She is a street vendor as this is the best way to seek out customers. She began this business because she had to fund her children’s education; Carmen didn’t have many products when she began. Her goal is to grow her business little by little and establish herself in a fixed locale. The financing for her business is to expand into other lines based on her customer’s demands. She would like to open a clothing store in her home so that her children have a way to earn a living in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria R. D. is the owner of a small grocery and convenience store. She lives in the city of San Ignacio. This loan is for the purchase of store goods for the fall and winter. The prices have not yet risen and she wants to take advantage of this and stock up on a large quantity of goods.

loans.use: To purchase goods for a store

loans.name: Cristian Rene

texts.es: El joven Cristian Rene R. B. tiene 30 años de edad. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa y farmacos . Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Inicio por que no tenía un trabajo y decide ofrecer su ropa en las calles,ademas  Cristian ofrece medicinas para ofrecerles a sus clientes de ambos prodcutos, es una persona muy responsable por lo que recorre las calles con mucho entusiasmo. El financiamiento que solicita es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa nueva y medicinas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El deseo de Cristian es que su negocio se mantenga activo y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cristian Rene R. B. is 30 years old and married with 3 children.
He makes a living selling clothing and pharmaceuticals, and has done so for over 9 years. He started selling clothing as a street vendor because he was out of work. Cristian also sells medicines so that he can offer his customers a variety of products. He is a very responsible person which is why he goes about his work with great enthusiasm.
The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to purchase new clothing and medicines to satisfy customer demand. Cristian hopes that his business continues to thrive so that he can make improvements on his home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Raquel Rebeca

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo, en la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Raquel S. se dedica a la venta de productos personales como productos del cabello.

Actualmente, la señora Raquel tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos personales para el cabello. Espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel porque el crédito le ayudará a mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Raquel S. runs her business with great effort selling toiletries such has hair products.

Currently, Mrs. Raquel feels the need to invest in her business, so she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase more hair products. She has much confidence in Ceprodel because this loan will help improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toiletries

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.en:
Aquilino A. is from the town of Southwestern CalA. Mis. Occ. He is 47-years old. Aquilino is married and has five school-aged children. He owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community. Aquilino has been engaged in his business for over five years.

In 2006, Aquilino joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aquilino has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. He is requesting a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Aquilino from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay school tuition fees for his children. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kodjo Hobuame

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour reconstituer son stock de produits congelés et d'alimentation générale en état d'épuisement. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 2007 ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge. Célibataire, il habite le quartier Gblinkomé à Lomé où il exerce son commerce.
texts.en:
This gentleman is asking WAGES for a loan to replenish his stock of frozen foods and groceries, presently almost expended. He has been in this business since 2007 and it allows him to support himself. He is single and lives in the Gblinkomé district in Lomé where he also has his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of frozen foods and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
La señora Saturnina es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Puno, Provincia D. Puno, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 58 años D. edad, estado civil casada y es madre D. 05 hijos, La señora Saturnina estudio educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Alto Santa Rosa jr. 30 D. Agosto 927.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra D. abarrotes para su tienda. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo D. S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. arroz, leche, fideos, verduras, huevos, jugos, etc., para su tienda, la señora Saturnina también venD. pescado en el mercado central D. Puno.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando para D. alguna manera ayudar a su nieto.
A ella le gustan las reuniones que dice son divertidas
texts.en:
Mrs. Saturnina is a member of the “Nuevo Provenir” (New Proceeds) Community Bank that is located in the district of Puno, in the Puno province, in the department of Puno. She is 58 years old, is married and is the mother of five children. Mrs. Saturnina has completed her secondary studies. She lives in the Community of Alto Santa Rosa Jr. 30 D. Agosto 927. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nine years. Her first loan was for 300.00 new soles, money that she invested in the purchase of groceries for her store. This time she is asking for a loan of 1500.00 new soles in order to buy rice, milk, noodles, vegetables, eggs, juice, etc. for her store. Mrs. Saturnina also sells fish in the central market of Puno. Her desire is to continue working in some manner in order to help her grandchild. She loves reunions that she says are very fun.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, milk, noodles, vegetables, eggs, juice, etc.

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
Virginia del Carmen R., Ayda Lea G. y Mirna María L. M. son las que le dan vida al grupo Rey de Reyes. Ellas viven en el asentamiento anexo Camilo Ortega de Managua. 

Virginia del Carmen R. de 40 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella vende lecha, gas y carbón y lo que más desea es aumentar su negocio. Ayda Lea G. de 33 años por su parte vende helado, hielo, fresco y gaseosas.

Mientras Mirna María L. M. de 28 años tiene una fritanga en su casa, la fritanga es un restaurante popular por excelencia en Nicaragua. Este consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos, que están preparados solo para poner en la parrilla, por lo generar se comprar para la cena. Salgado es la coordinadora del grupo   y lo que más desea es mejorar el local de su negocio y seguir trabajando por su familia.
texts.en:
Virginia del Carmen Rodriguez, Ayda Read Mirna G. and Maria Lopez M. are the ones that promote the “Rey de Reyes“ group. They live in the Camilo Ortega area in Managua.

Virginia del Carmen Rodriguez is 40 years old and the coordinator of the group. She sells milk, gas and coal, and what she wants the most is to grow her business.

Ayda Lea G. is 33 years old and sells ice cream, ice and soft drinks.

Mirna María L. M. is 28 years old and has a fried food business at home. The fry food restaurants are very popular in Nicaragua. The fried meals are precooked and only need to be on the grill, so people usually buy them for dinner. Salgado is the coordinator of the group and what she wants the most is to improve her business and continue working for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Kaem Ing Village Bank Group

texts.en: NineteE. people who live in Hang Heng village in Takeo province made up the village bank loan and they will use the loan in different purposes. Mrs. Kaem I. is a village bank president who has beE. selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectar field to cultivate rice to earn for livI.. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder in the local village. Since this business is goI. well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breedI. and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to feed them. Her husband, Mr. Kung Meoun, is an ice cream seller who can make a small income to support the family. Mrs. Kaem I. is 36 years old and the mother of three childrE. two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attendI. the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Sadig Mirdjafar

texts.en: Sadig was born in 1986 and lives in Fuzuli region. This young man has been in the cattle-breeding business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy four calves to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Leta

texts.en: Leta P. lives in the town of Maagiagi. She is married and has six adult children. Leta owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. Leta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Leta is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST which will again be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Melida Francisca

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Melida C. es propietaria de su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos tales como perfumes, colonias, talcos, cremas, entre otros siendo exhibidos en una vitrina que ella compró para mejorar su negocio. 
Es importante destacar que ella es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo al que tiene que mantener y pagarle sus estudios. 
El crédito lo solicita para la compra de los cosméticos con el fin de venderlos y así adquirir los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandega, Sra. Melida C. is the owner of a cosmetics business in which she sells perfumes, colognes, talcum powders, crèmes, and other products. Her merchandise is kept in a display cabinet that she bought to improve her business.

It is important to note that Melida is a single mother of a child for whom she has to support and pay school fees. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy cosmetics to sell so that she can generate income to maintain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna S. is from the village of Guinawon Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Myrna is married and has 5 school-aged children.

To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the business's main source of income comes from selling fish and alimango to the local community members. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish and alimango for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana Francisca M. se ha destacado por ser una dama muy trabajadora que se ha dedicado al oficio de la costura siendo muy dedicada a esta labor ya que de aquí obtiene el dinero para mantener su hogar y los gastos de su casa.

Actualmente ella posee una máquina de pedal, una máquina eléctrica, una mesa y un turbante y espera ir creciendo cada vez más en este oficio. Actualmente ella ha solicitado un crédito con el propósito de utilizarlo en la compra de tela variada para así llevar a cabo su oficio y seguir realizando todo tipo de ropa para comercializarla y satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juana Francisca M. is recognized as a very hard-working woman. She makes a living from dressmaking and is very dedicated to her work, since that is how she earns money for maintaining her home and managing the household expenses. Juana currently owns a pedal-powered sewing machine, an electric sewing machine, and a sewing table, and hopes that her business will grow even more. She is now asking for a loan so that she can purchase assorted fabrics. This will enable her to complete her work and continue making all types of clothing to sell, and to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en:
Chuong N., 33, grows and sells vegetables at the local market of the Takeo province. She typically makes about $3 of profit every day. She is married and has two children living at home to support. Her husband is a rice farmer who typically makes $1 a day. 

Chuong N. would like to take out a loan of $700 that she needs to reinvest in her vegetable farm.

loans.use: Reinvest in her vegetable farm

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 59 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos. Norma tiene un pequeño negocio D. crianza D. pollos actualmente tiene 500 pollos, ella nos cuenta que compra pollos pequeños para hacerlos crecer y después venderlos. 
Norma forma parte del banco Comunal “Inti” D. la Asociación Arariwa, ella requiere el préstamo D. los 1000 soles, que invertirá en la compra D. alimentos  y vitaminas para los pollos. Norma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Norma is an entreprenurial and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Cuzco. She is 59 years old, married, and has three children. Norma has a little business raising chickens. Right now she has 500 chickens. She tells us that she buys small chickens and raises them to later sell them. Norma is a member of the communal bank "Inti" of the Asociacion Arariwa. She needs the loan of 1000 soles which she will invest in the purchase of feed and vitamins for the chickens. Norma is grateful for the opportunity offered this way and she is commited to making the payments according to the schedule. ("Inti" is a word from the Quechua language which translated to Spanish means "Sol")

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Norma needs the loan to purchase feed and vitamins for the chickens.

loans.name: Novelyn's Group

texts.en:
Novelyn F. is from the village of Turod. She is twenty-eight years old. Novelyn is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Novelyn F. group.

Novelyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Novelyn owns and operates a general store in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Novelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Novelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Novelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will Novelyn's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine G. was born in 1965 and she lives in Jean city. She is married and lives with her husband, her son, daughter-in-law, and her newborn grandchild. 

Armine has been engaged in trading business for a long time and in 2002, she organized her own food trading business. Armine’s son and her husband help her to manage this shop. Armine’s food shop is located in the City Market Centre and her shop is open twenty-four hours a day.

With the profits from her business, Armine provides her family's needs, makes major repairs of her apartment, and organized her son’s wedding.

Armine needs a 1.000.000 AMD loan to increase the goods assortment of her shop: sausages, canned goods, sugar, butter and some household goods.

loans.use: To increase the goods assortment of her shop

loans.name: Zipporah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 48-year-old mother of four sons and two daughters between the ages of 7 and 31. Zipporah has been selling clothes for the past 30 years. She describes herself as a very hardworking businesswoman. 

Zipporah has been able to bring up her children single-handedly. She was introduced to KADET through marketing outreach in Thika town, her home area. She says that she has benefited from KADET and was able to acquire a motorcycle through a KADET asset loan which her son uses to offer transport services and support his family. She plans to purchase more clothes stock with the loan she has applied for. She is servicing her fifth loan with KADET. Zipporah intends to buy a piece of land with the extra profit generated from the business.  Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes stock

loans.name: Awa

texts.en: Awa S. is 46 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" DIAMAGUENE1 for two years, and has had no problems repaying her loans. She sells various products: mainly groceries such as palm oil and citrus fruits, but also brushes. With this loan, Madame S. will buy more palm oil and lemons to bolster her shop. The revenues from this activity allow her to pay for her eldest children's school expenses .

loans.use: To purchase products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of condiments on the market place

loans.name: Help Yourself Group

texts.en:
James G. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Help Yourself. He is 44 years old, married, and has six children who range from one to fifteen years old. James could not continue his education through 11th grade due to lack of financial support.

For the past five years, James has been running a vegetable farm at the White Plain settlement, Liberia. He started his farm through the help of an international NGO in Liberia, but he faces problems with a shortage in tools to do his work. He grows good crops and sells them at an affordable price in order to keep customers returning. 
James plan to use his 10,000 LRD portion of this 35,000 LRD group loan to purchase more seeds for the next farming season. His goal and dream is to have more farms and improve the lives of his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, James is holding the sign. And Hawa is inset at the lower right because she was absent during interview.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds for the next farming season

loans.name: Araceli Esperanza

texts.es: Araceli Esperanza tiene 26 años, es una mujer que se siente realizada al tener una familia unida. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la pulpería, siendo sus principales fuentes de ingresos económicos. Cuando inicio pues con la ayuda de su esposo que mantuvieron de sus ahorros, logro empezar a comprar ciertos productos así fue poco a poco creciendo su negocio y tuvo la oportunidad de comprar una amplia variedad de productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento es para golosinas, pan, galletas, refrescos, detergentes, jabón y granos básicos. Desea mejorar cada día aun más su atención para aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
Araceli Esperanza is a 26 year old woman who feels fulfilled from having such a close family. For three years, she has operated a store as her main source of income. When she started her business, Araceli had the support of her husband who was responsible for managing their savings. She began buying certain products and gradually increased her business to the point that she was able acquire a wider variety of merchandise that her customers requested.

This loan will be used to buy candy, bread, cookies, soft drinks, detergents, soap, and basic grains. She wants to improve her service each day so that she can attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Karen Gisela

texts.es: Desde hace más de 3 años la Joven Karen Gisela, que se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, lo que le significo un paso muy importante en su vida pues tenía la responsabilidad de mantener a su hijo menor de edad que está a su cargo. Desde un principio ella inicio con muy poco capital y productos, pues salía a ofrecerlos a sus vecinos con el paso del tiempo ella llego a ser reconocida en su comarca. Ella en la actualidad necesita su crédito para comprar artículos en promociones, ya que tiene muchos pedidos por el momento. Su sueño es convertirse en una buena vendedora y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda pues las necesita.
texts.en:
Karen Gisela has sold general merchandise for over 3 years; this was an important step for her to take in life because she has the responsibility of caring for her young son who is under her care. At the beginning she started out with little capital and not much merchandise that she would go out and try to sell door-to-door among her neighbors in her area; in time she became well-known in her area. She needs funding to buy merchandise on sale because she has a lot of pending orders at the moment. Her dream is to become a good seller and make some needed home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise on sale.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
A. Afi s’est spécialisée depuis 2000 dans la vente de boisson locale alcoolisée appelé « Sodabi ». elle s’approvisonne à l’interieur du pays dans la ville d’havé . le crédit  qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre de s’approvisionner avec 2 tonneaux de sodabi
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
Afi A. has specialized in the sale of a local alcoholic beverage called « Sodabi » since 2000. She stocks up in the interior of the country in the city of Havé. The loan that she is requesting will permit her to restock with 2 barrels of Sodabi. She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodabi

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer L., 33, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Jerry L., a pedicab (a bicycle with sidecar that can carry a maximum of five people) driver, and is the mother of four children, one of whom is already in college while the other three are in high school.

By the grace of God, Jennifer has managed to support her older child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her remaining children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Jennifer. She, herself, has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Jennifer operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.

Jennifer earns by getting supplies at a wholesale price and selling retail. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Jennifer is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
 
Jennifer dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic V. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: computer gaming, bicycle rental, and pig fattening. She lives in F. Roska, Barangay Talisay, Santa Fe in the island of Bantayan, Cebu. Marivic has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her computer gaming, bicycle rental and pig fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 8,000. Marivic is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can have additional working capital for her computer gaming business as well as her two other businesses. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marivic aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida V. is from the village of Macate Diffun. She is 36 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Florida owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Florida has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Humberto Jose

texts.es: El señor Humberto José de 38 años de edad está casado el matrimonio cuenta con 2 hijos ambos están a su cargo. El señor se dedica a la venta de granos básicos  desde hace 20 años, pues tiene muchos clientes que llegan a su local a comprar los diferentes productos. Solicita este préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite entre otros debido a que cuenta con muchos pedidos y de esta forma poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que cuenta.
texts.en:
Mr. Humberto José is 38 years old, and is married. He has two children, both of whom he takes care of. He has been working in the sale of basic grains for 20 years, and he has many clients who come to his area to buy the different products. He is applying for this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, and oil, among other things, due to his increasing demand; this way he will be able to fill all of his current orders.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Marta Zacarias

texts.pt:
Marta Zacarias M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique viúva e mãe de 4 filhos maiores de idade apenas o mais novo é que vai a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seus 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, tem um negócio próprio que pratica ha mais de 2 anos. Vende mais frango e peixe congelado, onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00 a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum em sua casa. 

Ja teve empréstimo em outros bancos e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de residentes de seu bairro que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (frangos, refrescos, peixe e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo. No futuro pretende desenvolver ainda mais a sua actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Marta Zacarias M. was born in the city of Matola, in the province of Maputo in the south of Mozambique. She is a widow and has 4 older children; only the youngest still attends school.  Marta only studied through 6th grade, and didn't continue because of a lack of financial resources. She lives with her family in their own house and helps support two of her grandchildren who live with them.

She continues to live in Matola and has owned her own business for more than 2 years. For the most part she sells frozen chicken and fish, earning a monthly profit of around 3000 to 4000 Meticais. She uses this income to cover household expenses and occasionally saves some money at home as well.

Marta had taken out loans with other banks but decided to try something different. She found out about Hluvuku [the Kiva Field Partner] through neighbors who also work with the institution. This is her 1st loan, for the amount of 20,000 Meticais. She plans to use this money to buy products (chicken, fish, soft drinks and other items) to increase her stock of merchandise. 

She is confident that she will be able to repay the loan as indicated and take out new loans later.  In the future she would like to further develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase of products (chicken, fish, soft drinks and other items)

loans.name: Jumabubu

texts.en:
Jumabubu E. is 54 years old. She lives in Emgekchil village in the north of Kyrgyzstan and has seven children. 
Jumabubu has a higher pedagogical education, and worked as a primary school teacher at a local area for 35 years. She is characterized by her colleagues as a responsible, precise and open-hearted person. Now she is on pension and is engaged in cattle breeding.  

Jumabubu used her starting capital of 10,000 KGS to buy livestock for fattening and reselling. Thanks to her persistent and hard-working personality, she managed to enlarge the number of her livestock to five sheep, five goats, two cows and one horse. She sells milk to her customers at the local market and earns about 3,000 KGS monthly. With the revenues from livestock reselling, Jumabubu was able to  build up a barn and renovate her house. 

Jumabubu plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to buy three calves and fifteen sheep. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden out her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Angel Alberto

texts.es:
Angel Alberto C. C. tiene 50 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos solteros,  vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 9 hijos.  

Angel  pertenece a la Ventanilla Nueva Inspiración ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta perteneciente a la parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, es un grupo que se dedica a las labores de ciclo corto en su mayoría siembra maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta ventanilla tiene 13 miembros.

Angel trabaja en la agricultura siembra en ciclo corto el maíz,  arroz y fréjol  realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa y en el mercado de Ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar seguir cultivando para tener dinero y comprar un carro.
Le gusta salir hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Angel Alberto C. C. is 50 years old, married, and lives with his wife and single children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. He has nine children.

Angel belongs to the Communal Bank “Nueva Inspiración” (New Inspiration), which is in the Anchoveta precinct of the parish of Puerto Pechiche in Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of the group engage in short cycle agriculture, mostly growing corn, rice, and black-eyed peas. This Communal Bank has 13 members.

Angel is a short cycle farmer who grows corn, rice and beans. He makes his purchases in Guayaquil and then sells his products from a store in his house and at the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy more supplies to expand his business. With the help he will be receiving through this loan, Angel will be able to acquire necessities. His dream is to continue farming so that he can have money to purchase a car.

Angel likes to engage in sports.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to expand his business.

loans.name: Ervin Jose

texts.es:
