Don Ervin de 48 años de edad, su esposa Carmela Perez Picado, ama de casa que le ayuda a los trabajos agricolas y se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tienen finca en la Comarca la Ceiba Santa clara, Comalapa, donde se dedica desde muy joven a las actividades agricolas, venta de leche, Cuajada y comercializacion de Ganado de desarrollo mediante cual recibe ingresos mensuales para asumir sus compromisos de pagos y los gastos familiares siendo una persona responsable y querida por su comunidad.  

Solicita su segundo credito para compra de ternero de Desarrollo con el Apoyo de Kiva y asi salir adelante en sus negocios.  

Su mayor Sueño es crear un ambiente familiar unido y que su familia goce de buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ervin is 48 years old and his wife Carmela, a housewife, helps him in agricultural work and dedicates herself to household matters.  They have a farm in the Ceiba Santa Clara region of Comalapa, and have been involved since an early age in agricultural activities, including selling milk, cottage cheese, and cattle still in development.  In this manner, he receives a monthly income and assumes responsibility for family expenses, as a responsible and caring member of his community.

Ervin is soliciting his second loan so that he can buy a growing calf, with Kiva's help, and thus, get ahead in his business.

His major dream is to create a unified family environment wherein his family can enjoy good conditions of life.

loans.use: TO BUY A CALF TO RAISE

loans.name: Danny Alfredo

texts.es:
Danny Alfredo G. M. tiene 30 anos. Es soletero  vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hija 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Danny se dedica a la agricultura especialmente ala siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueno es mejorar económicamente.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Danny Alfredo G. M.  is 30 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the 'El Recreo' solidarity group work exclusively in farming, especially growing short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, soya and beans.  All the members of the group are from the same area San Vicente Las Lomas in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  There are 12 members in this solidarity group.

Danny has worked as a farmer, mainly growing corn, for 5 years.  He sells his products in Ventanas market.  He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer to grow his corn.  The support of this loan will help him financially to cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as infestations, diseases and changes in the climate.  His dream is to improve financially.  He likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
K. is a hard-working woman who has spent almost of her life growing crops. She is a middle-age woman and is raising  a school-aged child . Her husband appears in the photo. She owns a small plot of land inherited from  her parents in which she plants various crops. Additionally she built a pig pen and raises hogs for extra income. . K. has another plot of land which is full of grass, and it is not being farmed. 

K. is taking out a loan to clean up the grass from the land where she will raise additional crops. With the remainder of the loan, she will purchase piglets to breed.

loans.use: To clean up the grass from the land where she will raise crops.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates her grocery store which sells mainly household items such as canned goods,rice, etc.  She has been operating her business for more than 15 years and earns a monthly net income of 6,000.  Elizabeth O. is 40 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged kids.  She is from the village of Solinog, Calamba.

In 2000, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 54,000 PHP from PMPC.  This previous loan was used to purchase a motorcycle.  Elizabeth is requesting her 22nd loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for house renovation. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Azucenas De San Antonio Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA AZUCENAS DE SAN A. PORQUE A LAS SEÑORAS LES AGRADAN MUCHO LAS FLORES AZUCENAS Y ESTÁ UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE SAN A. EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTÁ CONFORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS.LA SRA. CRISTINA A. ES UNA INTEGRANTE, TIENE 57 AÑOS, Y SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA DE VERDURA (NOPALES). ELLA TIENE EN TOTAL 8 HIJOS: 3 MUJERES Y 5 HOMBRES, ACTUALMENTE SÓLO UNO DEPENDE DE ELLA Y ES UN NIÑO DE 16 AÑOS QUE ESTÁ ESTUDIANDO LA PRIMARIA, SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE NOPALES YA QUE ACTUALMENTE SUBIERON DE PRECIO DEBIDO A LA ESCACES DEL PRODUCTO. ADEMÁS QUIERE INICIAR SU CULTIVO  PARA PODER OBTENER UNA MAYOR GANANCIA, SUS CLIENTES SON PRINCIPALMENTE DE ATLACOMULCO YA QUE ES EL LUGAR EN DONDE LAS PERSONAS DE LAS DIFERENTES COMUNIDADES SE CONCENTRAN PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS DE ACUERDO A SU NECESIDAD. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR EL CREDITO LA SRA. CRISTINA SE SIENTE MUY ENTUSIASMADA YA QUE PODRA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO, ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA QUE NO SE DA POR VENCIDA ANTE NINGUNA SITUACIÓN, SIEMPRE LO AFRONTA CON ENTUSIASMO. HACE POCO FALLECIO SU ESPOSO Y HA SABIDO VER LA MANERA DE SALIR A ADELANTE Y DARLE EDUCACIÓN A SU HIJO, ESPERA QUE EL LOGRE SUS OBJETIVOS Y QUE EN CUALQUIER COSA QUE HAGA LO REALICE BIEN Y CON MUCHA RESPONSABILIDAD.
texts.en: This group is called "Azucenas de San A." ["Lilies of San A."] because the women in this group really like that type of flower and because the group is located in the community of San A. in Mexico state. The group is comprised of 10 members. Cristina A. is one of them. She is 57 years old and sells vegetables, particularly nopales [prickly pear cactus]. She has eight children total: three girls and five boys. Only one - a 16 year old boy who attends primary school - is still dependent on her. Cristina is requesting this loan to buy nopales, as the price is currently high due to a scarcity of that product. She would also like to begin cultivating her own crops in order to bring in a better income. Most of her customers are from Atlacomulco, which is a place where people from different communities gather to buy whatever products they need. As she requests this loan, Cristina feels very excited that she will be able to invest in her business. She is a very hardworking person who does not give up in any situation; she faces anything with enthusiasm. Her husband died recently but she knows that the way to get ahead is to provide her son with a good education. She hopes that he will achieve his goals and that he will do well and act responsibly in whatever he does.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (prickly pear cactus)

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis B. is from the village of Quiling, Roxas, Isabela. He is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Dennis plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $688 every harvest season.

In 2010, Dennis joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase his crop yield. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase his crop yield

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
N. Hadjah lives in the Nabulagala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Hadjah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Hadjah sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Hadjah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Hadjah include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of charcoal.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot and to build rental rooms and also to start selling by wholesale only. Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en: Mrs. Roeung N. is a villager in Tonle village, Takeo province. She was born in 1962. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. Mrs. Roeung N. is a mother of five children. One child is a motorbike middleman and another is a government worker. The others are attending in local public school. Mrs. Roeung N.'s husband, Mr. Hak Hoem, is a vice village chief and a palm juice collector who can earn some money to support his family. Recently, Mrs. Roeung N. has had a problem because her family does not have a motorbike for transportation. To improve this condition, Mrs. Roeung N. is requesting a loan to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 43 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2011, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

loans.name: Paulette

texts.fr:
Paulette est  une commerçante de HOPE Congo de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varient entre 9 ans à 24 ans.

 Connaissant sa charge, elle s'est lancée dans la vente des vaisselles en 2000. Elle vend en moyenne 15000f a 50000 f par jour. 

Avec ce second prêt qu'elle souhaite recevoir elle tient a renforcer son commerce en achetant de la porcelaine de Chine; de Sèvres; des flutes a champagnes, des verres en cristal.

 Elle s'efforce à  aider sa famille afin de pouvoir subvenir aux études des enfants qui sont a au primaire et à l'université.
texts.en:
Paulette is a 44-year old businesswoman belonging to Hope, Congo. She is married and mother to two children of nine and 24 years old. Aware of her responsibilities, she set herself up selling crockery in 2000. She has an average daily turnover of 15,000 to 50,000 francs.

With this second loan she is hoping to be granted, she is aiming to build up her business by buying china and Sèvres porcelain, champagne flutes and crystal glasses. 

She is trying to help her family with the aim of paying for her children's studies at primary school and university respectively.

loans.use: to purchase glasses, champagne flutes and crockery

loans.name: Justa

texts.en: Justa, a 68-year-old married mother of seven children, works hard to provide for her family.She has been running a general store in the Philippines for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock. Having already received and repaid 19 previous loans from NWTF, Justa is now requesting a PHP 20000 loan to buy items such as coffee, sugar, groceries, etc. to sell in her store. Justa aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Madine

texts.en: Madine is 23 years .She is married and has 1 child who is 1 year old. She sells clothes. She started this business 4 years ago. Her husband sells food. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes. In the future she hopes to expand her business by making enough savings and reinvesting in the business.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo is 57 years old and lives in the village of Dimi, Imereti Region. He lives with his wife Darejan, their son, daughter-in-law and 3-year-old granddaughter Lizi. 

The main source of income for the family comes from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow and a calf. Their cheese is sold on the local market. Also the family owns a vineyard with 1000 grape vines. Leo produces wine and sells it in the village. Along with the above-mentioned, Leo and Darejan own a grocery store in the village. 

With the requested credit the family plans to increase stock in trade in the store. This will increase the competitiveness of the store and attract more customers. The income of the family will increase and it will allow them to improve their living conditions. 

In the future the Grdzelidzes plan to invest more in the store and expand it.

loans.use: to pay for stock in trade for the grocery store.

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children.

Saddam has had a barber shop since 1989. He has a long experience in this field and has a good reputation, and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a loan of $2500 to make a sliding door and ceramic flooring for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and ceramic flooring for his shop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 2 and 5 years old. Her older child is in school and she makes a living by running a cafeteria. She has become an effective business manager thanks to training sessions provided by Faulu Kenya. In about five years, Beatrice hopes to own a large hotel. She is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kes to buy a refrigerator, blender and potatoes, which she uses to make chips.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, blender and potatoes to make into chips.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor nació en la ciudad D. Paruro del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 51 años D. edad. Actualmente, Nicanor está casado y fruto D. esta unión tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Nicanor es zapatero D. profesión y trabaja D. forma ambulatoria. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a esta profesión y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Nicanor requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales D. como goma D. zapato, clavos, tachuelas y cuero. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Unión Latina” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Nicanor was born in the city of Paruro of the department of Cuzco (Peru). He is 51 years old. At present, Nicanor is married, has three children, and lives in the city of Cuzco. Nicanor is a shoemaker and works as a street vendor. He has had this profession for 12 years and it is going very well for him, thanks to the dedication he puts in his work. At this time, Nicanor needs the loan to buy materials such as shoe glue, nails, tacks and leather. He is a responsible and hardworking person and because of these qualities the other members invited him to participate in the “Unión Latina” community bank of the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy materials such as shoe glue, nails, tacks and leather.

loans.name: Baljinnyam

texts.en:
Baljinnyam lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver who manages a taxi service business while her two sons, ages 2 and 4, attend kindergarten.

She manages a plant sowing and trading business in her town. She started her business in 2007 and her husband helps with the family business. At first she used to plant at her older brother's greenhouse. Since then she has been able to stabilize her business and bought her own greenhouse which has been built in her backyard.

Her husband's business earnings are used for the daily consumption needs of the family and her business earnings are used for savings. She is an open-minded woman who is planning to expand her business. She says, "I bought the plot of land where we live 2 years ago. However, individuals cannot get permission to live on this place, so I am planning to have another plot of land on which I can have permission to live."

She is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase seeds and to build one more greenhouse for her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and to build one more greenhouse

loans.name: Mariliza

texts.en:
Mariliza is 47 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-aged children.

Mariliza has a retail business to earn a living. She sells personal and cosmetics products in the local community. She sells items like shampoo, toothpaste, powder, lotion and perfume. She has been engaged in this business for over three years. She earns PHP 2,000 a month from this activity. She has requested a loan of 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase cosmetics products to sell.

Mariliza has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Mariliza hopes to gain more income and expand her cosmetics business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics products to sell.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is an embroidery and clothes-sewing expert and receives regular orders every month. This income helps her pay her utility bills and pay the school fee of her three children who are studying in different classes. Nusrat is also a very good housewife who manages her household responsibilities with her work very well.

Her husband operates a video games shop in the market. He offers different arcade games to the children of his community who like his games very much. 

Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her complete the orders in a shorter period of time and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for the past five years and is confident that her business will improve a lot with a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en: Amiran is from the village of Dimi in the Imereti Region of west Georgia. He is 51 years old and lives with his wife, Dariko, his 27 year old son and his 73 year old mother. Amiran actively helps his son on the family farm despite his health problems, for which he receives a relevant pension from the government. They have four cows and two calves. Dariko produces approximately 80 kg cheese per month and sells it on the local open market. The family also owns two, 400 square meter greenhouses. In the greenhouses they grow cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. Once harvested, these products are sold locally as well. The family's total average monthly income is 580 Laris, including the pensions of Amiran and his mother. Amiran has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, which will be used in the greenhouses. By fertilizing the land, the family will ensure a high quality harvest, which can be sold for a good price. The additional income will be used for the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for the greenhouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, compost, farming supplies, and liquid fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 60 years old, married, and a father of one child aged 18 years. He has been operating a hotel as a primary business and a retail shop as a secondary business for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 24,000 which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Stephen will use the loan to buy sugar, wheat flour, rice and maize meal for both businesses. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant which will help him support his family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour, rice and maize meal for his two businesses

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 41 años, se destaca por ser una mujer emprendedora, dinámica y muy creativa, es madre soltera de un niño de 11 años, quien es la razón de su esfuerzo y sacrificio, pues procura darle una buena educación. Juntos vivien en su casa que es propia y en compañía de su padre. Su trabajo consiste en la elaboración de Fariña (un producto alimentición regional, que es obtenido de la harina de yuca), por tanto debe conseguir kilos de éste tuberculo, sin embargo cuando no tiene la cantidad necesaria debe recorrer 45 kilometros donde conoce de proveedores que le venden al por mayor. Una vez preparados estas Fariñas, los lleva a la ciudad para venderlos, pues sabe que sus clientes le gusta este producto crocante, por ello se esmera en buscar lo mejor de lo mejor para que tenga contentos a sus clientes. Tiene ocho años trabajando en este actividad y hasta el momento continua haciéndolo sola, asimismo menciona que ella dispone de su tiempo, así le dedica a su hijo y a su padre. Espera con el tiempo ampliar su negocio, empezando a vender algunos productos regionales y al mayoreo. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, y afirma que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, podrá comprar más yuca e intentar traer algunos productos alimenticios de otras regiones para variar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Olga is 41 years old.  She highlights the fact that she is an enterprising woman, who is dynamic and very creative.  She is the single mother of an 11-year-old son, who is the reason for her efforts and sacrifice, so that she can give him a good education.  They live together in their home that they own, together with her father.  

Her work consists of making Fariña (a regional food product obtained from yucca flour), for which she has to use several kilos of the tuber.  When she doesn't have the necessary quantity, she most travel 45 kilometers, which is where she knows the providers who sell at wholesale.  Once the Fariñas are prepared, she takes them to the city to sell.  She knows that her customers like the products to be crisp, so she strives to find the best of the best, so that her customers will be happy.

She has been doing this work for 8 years, and continues to do it all on her own.  She also mentions that she does it on her own time, so she can look after her son and her father.  She hopes in time to expand her business, by beginning to sell several regional products, and starting to sell at wholesale.

This will be her second loan with MFP, and affirms that she will be punctual in her repayments.  With the amount requested, she will be able to buy more yucca and have a go at bringing in products from other regions to vary what she has for sale.

loans.use: to buy more yucca and additional foods from other regions.

loans.name: Ronnel

texts.en:
Ronnel is 20 years old and still single. He graduated from college last year but due to lack of job opportunities, he is engaged in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products to help his parents earn income. He aims to earn and save more income for his own future. 

He wants to ask for an additional capital of P5,000 to buy AVON, Natasha and MSE products to sell in their village. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will sell more of the products and increase his income. He is hoping that in the future, he will make the business viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy AVON, Natasha and MSE products to sell.

loans.name: Farmonkul

texts.ru: Фармонкул вот уже более 10 лет занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он держит скот за счет кормов произведенных самим из своего земли. Он начинал свой бизнес с собственными капиталами и успешно продолжает данный бизнес. Фармонкул хочет расширить свой бизнес и обратился к «Имон Интернэшнл» за помощь. Он запрашивает займ в размере 2200$ США для покупки 7 голов быка. Полученный доход от данного бизнеса он хочет использовать для улучшения своего уровня жизни.
texts.en: Farmonkul has been involved in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops for over 10 years.  He keeps livestock by using the fodder that he produces from his land.  He started his business with his own capital and continues to run it successfully.  Farmonkul wants to expand his business and went to "Imon International" for help.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $2200 for the purchase of 7 heads of bulls.  He wants to use the resulting profit to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Bughoye Twanzane Group

texts.en:
Edward is 58 years old, married, and has eight children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.

Edward has a business selling coffee and beans, which he has been doing for three years.  He started with 100,000 shillings and now has 600,000 shillings.  His challenge is limited capital; his vision is having a big store for produce plus educating his children.  Edward is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell.

loans.name: Twongerumusaruro No 29 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Marcel fait partie du groupe Twongerumusaruro no 29. Le nom du groupe signifie «Augmentons la production». Il a 43 ans et il est marié avec 12 enfants de 1 à 18 ans, dont 8 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Marcel est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire les semences sélectionnée. Dans les prochaines années, Marcel voudrait être le distributeur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marcel is a member of the Twongerumusaruro No. 29 Group. The group's name means "Let's increase production." He is 43 years old, married and has 12 children aged between 1 and 18. Eight of his children attend school. He attended primary school for 6 years. 

Marcel is a rice farmer. This is his second loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer to grow rice.

His business growth strategy is to plant a crop of selected seeds. In the coming years, Marcel would like to become a distributor of rice in his region. He will use any profits to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es: Mirna, de 46 años, es una buena mujer, es una madre ejemplar y muy corajuda, esta separada de su esposo con quien tuvo cinco hijos a quienes saco adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio diario, tres de sus hijos ya son mayores mientras que dos son aun menores y depende de ella, ella vive en una casa propia a lado de sus dos menores hijos y una hija mayor quien es madre soltera de un menor de 5 años. El trabajo de Mirna consiste en la venta de pescado fresco, sale temprano al puerto en busca de los pescados más gordos y frescos, tiene que andar mucho ya que en algunas ocasiones no logra llegar a tiempo y tiene que ir al mercado de su ciudada a comprar, de ahí se va su casa en donde arma aun pequeña mesa e inicia con su venta, lleva trabajando así por un año, pues antes se dedicaba a muchas cosas pero no le daban tiempo para estar con sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite estar en su casa la mayoría del tiempo, además de tener su tiempo libre por las tardes que utiliza para poder hacer otras actividades, además gana bien, le gustaría mas adelante tener una tienda en su casa para que signifique un ingreso más a su economía. Este será el primer préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que le brindarán la oportunidad de invertir y le dan la confianza para que pueda demostrar que es buena y muy responsable. Con el monto solicitado, comprará pescado en mayor cantidad para tener en su congeladora y no gastar en pasaje todos los días, además comprará algunas frutas para empezar a vender en su casa.
texts.en:
Mirna, 46, is a good woman--she is an exemplary and courageous mother.  She is separated from her husband, with whom she had five children, who got  ahead thanks to their daily efforts and sacrifice.  Three of her children are already grown up, while two of them are minors and depend on her.   She lives in her own house with her youngest children and an older daughter, who is the single mother of a five-year-old boy.  Mirna sells fresh fish.  She goes to the port early in the morning to find the freshest and fattest fish.  It's a long walk, and sometimes she doesn't get there in time, so she has to go to the nearest city market to buy her fish.  From there, she goes to her house, where she sets out a little table and starts selling.  She has been doing this work for a year, as before this, she did a variety of jobs, but they did not give her enough time with her children.  She likes the fact that her work allows her to be home most of the time, plus she has free time in the afternoons to do other things.  In addition, she is earning well.  

In the future, she would like to have a shop in her own home so she can earn more.  This will be her first loan with microfinance partner MFP.  She is pleased to have this investment opportunity, and it is giving her the confidence to show how good and responsible she is.  With the funding, she will buy a greater quantity of fish to keep in her freezer and will not waste time and money traveling every day.  She will also buy some fruit to start selling from her house.

loans.use: to buy fish and fruit for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas E Independientes Group

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 55 años ella es una señora muy hábil a ella le gusta aprender nuevas cosas sobre todo manualidades,  al principio lo hacía por entretenimiento pero con el tiempo  se convirtió  en su principal fuente de ingreso es así que ella prepara artículos según las festividades como el día de la madre, del padre,  san Valentín etc. Prepara todo tipo de artículos como manteles, cojines, muñecos etc. Ella realiza exposiciones de todo lo que confecciona y los vende a sus amigos, vecinos y personas que ya conocen su trabajo, las exposiciones las realiza en su misma casa, ahora se está preparando para las fiestas navideñas para eso es que utilizara su préstamo para comprar telas y  adornos alusivos a la navidad, gracias a su trabajo es que ha podido ayudar a sus 4 hijos con los estudios y de alguna manera sacarlos adelante, ella es viuda y le ha costado mucho sacrificio todo lo que ha logrado, actualmente es socia del grupo” MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES”.
* Gladys es la cuarta de la derecha esta sentada y viste de rojo
texts.en:
Gladys is 55 and a very skilled woman. She enjoys learning to do new things, above all handicrafts. Initially, she made them for entertainment but in time they became her principal source of income. Thus, she prepares items according to holidays, such as Mother’s Day, Father’s Day, Valentines, etc. She makes all kinds of articles such as  tablecloths, cushions, dolls, etc. She presents expositions of her crafts and sells them to her friends, neighbors and others who hear about her work. She holds these exhibitions in her own home.

Gladys is currently  preparing for the Christmas holidays and will use her loan to buy fabric and Christmas ornaments. Thanks to her work she has been able to help her children with their studies and in some way to get ahead. She is a widow and she has sacrificed a great deal in order to succeed. At present she is a member of the ” MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES” communal bank.

*Glaydys is dressed in red and seated the fourth from the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fabric and Christmas ornaments.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba cooks banku (fermented corn dough) to sell. She cooks banku and serves it with fried fish and hot pepper sauce. She is a single parent with 9 dependents.  She uses her income to provide for her dependents. Her business has been in existence for ten years.

Her loan, when received, will be used to buy maize and fish to cook banku to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: to buy maize and fish to cook banku for sale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine owns a food stall in Changamwe, Kenya. She began the business with her savings and the proceeds from the sale of old family assets. She is single and has four children.

Catherine was introduced to Milango by her friends and is now applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils, hotel chairs, sugar, flour and cooking oil. Catherine will use the extra income to cater to better health care and to invest for future needs. She aspires to grow her business to a large hotel rather than a food stall.

loans.use: to buy utensils, hotel chairs, sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Afuany

texts.en:
Afuany is 24 years old.  She is a married woman with three children, one of which goes to school.  She operates a business, selling tea in Bor, South Sudan and has been in business for four years.

Afuany is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee.  She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay her child’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Debora Antonia

texts.es: Debora es una emprendedora que tiene objetivos y metas en la vida, su negocio de la venta de mercadería en general lo realiza de forma ambulante en lo cual sus clientes la buscan por la calidad de producto y servicio que le brindan a sus clientes. Ella es clienta de Fundación León 2000,lo cual es una clienta que tiene un record intachable, el crédito que se le brindo anteriormente fue para la compra de mercadería. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar mercadería en general para así ofrécele a sus clientes variedad.
texts.en:
Debora is a businesswoman with objectives and goals in life. In her business as a street vendor she sells general merchandise, and her customers seek her out for the quality of her products and the service that she offers them. 

Debora is a member of Fundación León 2000 and she has an impeccable record. Her previous loan was for the purchase of merchandise. Currently she is requesting financing to buy general merchandise to offer her clients variety.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe A. is a community based Nurse/Midwife who offers preventive and maternity services in a rural health facility in Siaya District, Western Kenya. She has applied for the loan to improve her stock of drugs at the facility to ensure that all clients leave the facility with drugs. At the moment she gives them a prescription to buy drugs at a commercial pharmacy in town but many don\'t buy the right dosage resulting into re- infection or drug resistance.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for her communty pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to increase her business so that she may pay school fees for her child in secondary school

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a widow who runs a little business selling shoes at the busiest city market in Novaya Kahovka, Ukraine. She has been in the shoe retail business for 15 years.

Lending services from Nadiya Ukraine have promoted the expansion of Nila’s trade and helped her obtain needed inventory. Nila has proven to be an entrepreneur of integrity as she has faithfully repaid each previous loan. This-- together with her professionalism, determination, and tenacity--has added greatly to the success of her business venture.

Nila would like to get a loan of $1,200 to purchase new pairs of shoes for resale. She thinks that offering a wide assortment of brands and styles-–from sandals, flip-flops, espadrilles, and casual footwear to a great athletic shoe selection--will help her business stand out from her competitors and bring in extra profits. We believe that this loan will help Nila achieve a higher income and improve her entrepreneurial skills.

Ніла – вдова. Вона торгує взуттям на великому місцевому ринку в Новій Каховці. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже 15 років. Кредитні послуги „Надії України” сприяли розвитку торгівлі Ніли та допомогли їй отримати необхідний товар. Ніла – чесний та порядний підприємець, вона вчасно сплатила усі попередні позики. Її професіоналізм, наполегливість та витривалість стали тими чинниками, які допомогли їй досягти успіху. Ніла хотіла б отримати позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб придбати нове взуття для подальшого продажу. Вона вважає, що широкий асортимент моделей та стилів – від босоніжок, в’єтнамок та повсякденного взуття до широкого вибору спортивного взуття, допоможе її бізнесу вигідно виділятися серед її конкурентів та принесе їй додатковий прибуток. Ми вважаємо, що ця позика допоможе Нілі отримати додатковий прибуток та набути нових навичок у веденні бізнесу.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes wholesale

loans.name: Sochea

texts.en:
Mr. Sochea has been married since 1979, and has 2 sons and a daughter. He has been in the business of driving a remork (a motor taxi with a carriage at the back) for more than 15 years. He drives workers from the village to a garment factory site. His wife raises pigs and cows. Neither Mr. Sochea nor his wife have finished primary school, and all of their children are currently working at the garment factory.  
Mr. Sochea needs to borrow US$500 from MAXIMA to purchase a new carriage for his motor taxi and to buy a cow. With his remork and his wife's animal-raising business, Mr. Sochea will be able to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motor-taxi carriage and a baby cow

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.en:
Bobojon is a young businessman. His business is trading melons and watermelons. His business place is located in Ckalovsk, Khujand. His trade place is situated near the road, and it is very profitable place. It is a very convenient place for customers, as they have the opportunity to buy melons and watermelons without going out of their way.

Bobojon says that as the weather was very hot in summer, he sold 40 or 60 melons (watermelons) every 2-3 days. One batch of his product consists of 200-500 melons and watermelons. He buys his product from suppliers from Mastchoh, district of Khujand, Tajikistan. For today, his turnover is fast; for the future, he plans to increase his volume of melons and watermelons. For this purpose he is requesting $1200 which he will pay back over 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en: Abbass owns a clothing and flower shop. This 44 years old father always wears a smile on his face. It must be one of the many reasons why neighboring clients visit his store so often.  He needs to purchase a new inventory of clothes as the winter season comes around. He lives in the surroundings of Nabatieh, which is south of Lebanon, with his family. Abbass has a solid honest history with Al Majmoua and has always been striving to enhance his business. The uncommon idea of joining clothing and flowers proves his determination for a winning formula.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his clothing and flower shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in raw materials

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 42 year-old Erica K.. She is married with five children, aged 5,13,16,18, and 20. In 2006 Erica established a small shop selling general items, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Kikooza A(I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Eva N.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to invest in her poultry business. Eva is 43 years old and is married. She has 7 children, ranging from age 5 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Eva makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the poultry business. Eva is joined in her small group by Joanita N., Harriet N., Jane K., and Christine N..

Joanita N. is currently in the business of poultry and is requesting a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to purchase poultry feeds. Harriet N. is currently in the business of fresh foods and is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to increase stock. Jane K. is currently in the wholesale business and is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to start selling shoes. Christine N. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to buy new sewing machines.

loans.use: To invest in the poultry business.

loans.name: Hurija

texts.en: Hurija was born in 1961. She is married and lives together with her husband in Srebrenica. He works as an construction worker and he sells wood. He can earn about 750KM monthly. This monthly income is not enough for their 7 family members. Hurija does poultry farming, and this loan in the amount of 1000KM ($750) she will use for chicken feed. Her wish is to earn money by selling the chickens and also using it for buying more chickens.

loans.use: Use it for chicken feed

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a young mother from Khoost, a city in western Ukraine. She is married and has one daughter. Nataliya helps support her family with a small clothing sales business which she operates at an outdoor market in Khoost. Nataliya has had her business for about seven years. She is kind-hearted lady and loves to visit with her customers.

Nataliya has requested a loan to increase her working capital. This is Nataliya’s second loan from Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy to have this opportunity to help her run a stable, successful business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
My home is not weatherproofed and with the hot season already starting it's becoming very hot inside for my children. I'm requesting a loan of $1,2000 for the weatherproofing and making the home cooler in the heat.
Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer
A mi casa le esta haciendo falta la impermeabilización ya que empieza la temporada de calor y las casa se pone muy caliente para los niños. Solicito un préstamo $1,200.00 dlls.Para la impermeabilización de la casa y así esta más fresca la casa  ahora en calor.

loans.use: Weatherproof home / Impermeabilizar la losa de una casa

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Born in 1952, Christina is married with five children. She became a member of GHAPE and received a first loan of $30. With this loan she started a business of cassava farming and pig rearing. Cassava is a starch food product which has many uses. It is used as food when boiled and in manufacturing garri starch which is used as a bleaching agent on clothes. The income helped her pay school fees for her children.
Christina requests a loan to buy piglets, fowls, and seeds. With the profits, she will be able to pay her children’s school fees, increase her business and live well with her family. She plans to pay her loan in 24 months.

loans.use: To buy piglets, seeds, fowls, and cloth

loans.name: Morgado Pedro

texts.pt:
Morgado is 28 years old and he is from the Boane province. He is married and has a 1-year-old son. He lives with his mother and 3 younger brothers. Morgado finished high school but never lived in any other place -- he lives in his own home located in Zone 07. Morgado has been working for 5 years. He graduated from IMAP of Manhiça in 2002 and his working shifts are from 7:00am until 12:00pm, Mondays through Fridays. His monthly salary is 4800,00mt from which he saves 1000,00mt in the bank. This will be the fourth loan in Morgado's life and third through Hluvuku. His first loan came from the credit corporation Tchuma in the amount of 15000,00mt -- it was used to pay for his marriage ceremony. The second loan in the amount of 8900,00mt and the third for 15000,00mt were used to buy construction materials. This fourth loan will also be used to purchase construction materials. Morgado wishes to pay back ahead of time because he believes that the amount requested will not be enough to finish up the construction. He will need to request additional loans in order to accomplish completion.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Morgado tem 28 anos de idade, casado e pai de um filho com um ano de idade, vive com a sua mae mais 3 irmao mais novo que ele. É natural de Boane provincia do Maputo. Morgado estudou até o nível médio, nunca mudou de cidade sempre viveu na terra de origem, vive numa casa propria no bairro 07. Morgado é docente a cinco anos, formados no IMAP da manhiça em 2002 e trabalha das 7:00h até 12:00h da segunda a sexta feira. Tem um salario mensal de 4800,00mt e poupa menslamente 1000,00mt no banco. Este é o quarto empréstimo para o Morgado na vida e terceiro na Hluvuku tendo tido o primeiro na cooperativa de credito Tchuma de 15000,00mt valor que usou para despesas de casamento e o segundo de 8900,00mt, o terceiro de 15000,00mt ambos usou para compra de material de construção. Assim este quarto tambem pretende comprar material de construção. Morgado pretende pagar antes do tempo porque acha que o valor que solicita agora ainda não poderá concluir tudo que pretende na sua obra assim voltara logo que fechar solicitar outros empréstimo.

loans.use: To buy materials to build a house.

loans.name: Amina's Riziki Popote Group

texts.en:
Amina is 29 years old. She is married, and has two children, aged 5 and 3. Amina became a clothes and cosmetics vendor in 2006. Everyday, she begins work at 6 AM and ends at 6 PM. She earns a total of about $25 in profits per month.

In the past, Amina has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now hoping to purchase more clothes, and expand her inventory of cosmetics. In addition, she will share her loan with a fellow subgroup member, who also has a business in bed sheets and clothing.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Karla Geraldina

texts.es:
Karla is a woman who is very dedicated to work. She is 33 years old, lives in the Laureles Sur area, is married and has one son who is 18 years old and starting secondary school. Her husband, a mechanic, fixes cars. Karla has been selling spare car parts for four years, having started her business with her own money. She rises at 5:00 am to take care of her household chores and fix breakfast for her family, since by 8:00 am she has to be at her stand to start selling her products. She sells her wares on Altamira Street, a road that is very busy on a daily basis. The money she is soliciting is to invest into more products for various model cars, so this way she has a better variety of goods to offer to her customers. Her plan is to establish an auto parts store since the products sell well at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Karla es una mujer dedicada al trabajo, tiene 33 años de edad, habita en los Laureles sur, es casada y tiene un hijo de dieciocho años de edad que está estudiando en la secundaria, su esposo trabaja reparando motos, ya que es mecánico. Doña Karla vende repuestos de motos y tiene cuatro años de estar vendiendo, comenzó con dinero propio, ella se levanta a las cinco de la mañana para dejar sus oficios hechos y preparar el desayuno a su familia por que a las ocho de la mañana tiene que estar en su puesto para vender sus productos, el local donde vende ella es carretera Altamira, una calle muy transitada diariamente. El dinero solicitado es para invertir más en los productos de modelos para moto y así ofrecer variados productos a sus clientes. Sus planes son establecer una tienda de repuestos de motos ya que se venden mucho en el mercado

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of spare car parts to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Balimaya sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de trente cinq (35) ans et cinq (5) enfants. Elles vivent dans des foyers monogames et résident toutes au quartier Odioumabougou à Ouéléssébougou (deuxième région administrative se la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des liens de parenté et d’affaire. Elles exercent la même activité à savoir la vente de miel.

En raison de la rentabilité de cette activité et de la forte demande du miel, elles décidèrent de se regrouper et adhérer au programme de crédit Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce prêt de 25.000 FCFA par membre, elles comptent acheter chacune 30 litres de miel. Elles s’approvisionnent chaque quinze (15) jours à Bougouni et vendent sur les marchés de la localité au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes amateurs de produits naturels.

Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice prévisionnel moyen de 12.000 FCFA par membre. Avec ce bénéfice, elles désirent après remboursement de l’intérêt du prêt, investir le reste dans leur affaire.
texts.en:
The members of the Balimaya group are married women with an average age of thirty five and five children. They come from monogamous homes and all live in the Odioumabougou neighborhood of Ouéléssébougou (a second-level administrative subdivision of the Republic of Mali). They met through relatives and business connections. They all work in the same business - selling honey.

For reasons of profitability and the high demand for honey, they decided to get together and join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. With this 25,000 FCFA ($56) loan per member, they each intend to buy 30 liters of honey. They stock up at Bougouni every fifteen days and sell the honey at local markets, for cash or credit, to a clientele of men and women who are fond of natural products.

They expect to make an average profit of 12,000 FCFA ($28) per member. After repaying the interest on the loan, they want to invest the remainder of this profit in their business.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy honey

loans.name: Neiser

texts.es: Neiser, de 36  años, es padre de un hijo, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, ahora es propietario de dos motocarros, los cuales le ayudan a fortalecer la economía de su hogar, junto a Ana, su conviviente, quien se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, trabajan y se esfuerzan para solventar los estudios de su hijo. Neiser desea reparar uno de sus motocarros, ya que el vehículo se encuentra en mal estado, para ello requiere de una cantidad de dinero, para comprar repuestos y algunas piezas que harán que su herramienta de trabajo funcione de la mejor manera, además de esto, quiere dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes, tener una bodega en su casa. Apoyemos a este padre que demuestra sus ganas de seguir adelante, con tu ayuda el podrá cumplir su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Neiser is 36 years old and he is the father of one boy. His occupation is passenger transportation, something he has been doing for many years. He is currently the owner of two motorcycles and they help him stabilize the household finances. Together with Ana, his common law partner who sells prepared foods in the evenings, they both work hard to send their son to school. Neiser needs to repair one of his motorcycles, it is in a bad state of disrepair. For this he requires a sum of money, to purchase spare parts and some tools. Aside from this, he also runs a convenience store and he runs that from their home. Let us support this father that has shown such great will to become a success. With your help he will be able to meet his goal in a very short time.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a committed LAPO MICROFINANCE client who has never defaulted on her LAPO loans. Bukola sells children’s clothes and has been in this business for the past five years. She is asking for a loan of  50,000 naira ($425) so that she can buy clothing in bulk. With this extra inventory, she'll be able to meet customer demand during the festive season. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
“I will value whatever support I can get and will utilize it in a proper way,” a mother of ten children from Barangay Malamag East Tumauini, Isabela said with the blink of hope in her eyes.

Margarita B. G. is known in the village as the hard-working wife of Juan G. and a mother of five girls and five boys ranging in age from 32 to 12. She is very proud of the fact that her children are either in school or have achieved either high school or college graduation.

Theirs is an agricultural community whose villagers can plant rice, corn, tobacco and various kinds of vegetables. Margarita’s husband Juan is one of the farmers specializing in planting rice and corn while she has been operating a community-based store since 2003, opening each morning at 6:00 and closing each evening at 7:00. Margarita has been able to support the daily needs of her family through this business.

To continue to help her husband, she is requesting a loan to purchase goods for her store such as canned items, a variety of noodles, basic commodities, smoke and dried fish, beans, eggs, soft drinks, rice, etc. The money will not only meet the additional needs of the store but ensure the financial support of her two youngest children’s education - the reason Margarita and her husband work so hard in their respective livelihoods.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha O. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: two girls and a boy. She says one of her children is in the senior high school, one in the junior high school, and the other one is a lady who owns a hair dressing salon in the town in which they live. She lives with her children in Nkawkaw in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Martha works hard to support her husband in the children’s upbringing. Her husband sells minerals while she is a food vendor. She cooks rice and yam slice with stew. She buys bags of rice and tubers of yam from Kumasi and sometimes from surrounding villages. Martha has been in business for over fifteen years. Apart from the food selling, Martha also treks in maize. She distributes to food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and tubers of yam on large scale so that she can cut down on the costs of frequent trips to procure goods.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice and tubers of yam in bulk.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mrs. Mercy C. grew up in Madrangca, San Jose, and Antique. She has been blessed with two children. Her common-law husband works as a nursing attendant in Antique Provincial Hospital. 
	She buys and sells frozen foods that she makes. Her customers are neighbors and workers in her community. She also accepts orders and deliveries while waiting on customers in the store. Her loan is for additional capital to earn more income and sustain the basic needs of her family and achieve their future goals.
	She plans to have her own stall in the town market. It will be the best action and help her give a better education to her children. She is very thankful to ASHI for providing her an additional income.

loans.use: To grow her frozen foods business

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Choeun R., 26, pictured here with his mother, lives in Bati, Takeo province, Cambodia. He is single and works for a private company in Phnom Penh. His mother works at home making collars. Her earnings average the equivalent of $1.50 per day.  Mr. Choeun R. needs a loan in order to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work, which would reduce his transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ogla

texts.es:
Ogla inició el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso extra que le permitiera apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos, ya que en ese tiempo ella se dedicaba solo a la crianza de sus hijos y no se alcanzaban a cubrir los gastos básicos.

Comenzó el negocio en agosto del 2001 entro a estudiar clases de repostería en las instalaciones del IMSS y de esa manera empezó a elaborar galletas y repostería fina y salía a vender a sus vecinos y amistades.  
Su negocio ha ido mejorando de una manera muy considerable tomando en cuenta que ella ya se volvió una experta en el ramo de la repostería y al mismo tiempo aprendió nuevas recetas lo cual le ayuda para tener mas variedad de pan para ofrecer a sus clientes y ahora ya cuenta con un espacio dentro de su casa para el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,500 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para comprar materia prima para poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Ogla started the business because she needed an extra income that would allow her to help her husband with household expenses and their children's schooling. Up to then, she had worked solely on raising their children even though there wasn't enough income to cover all of the family's expenses.

She started the business in August 2001, studying pastry-making at IMSS and learning how to make cookies and fine pastries. She then started selling them to neighbors and friends and her business has been growing steadily since then. She's become an expert pastry chef and, at the same time, has learned new recipes which have helped her to provide a variety of breads to her customers. She now has a space in her house for the business.

She needs a MXN$3,500 loan, to be repaid in 8 14-day installments, to buy basic supplies for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for bakery business.

loans.name: Fotemogoban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Fotemogoban est un regroupement de  femmes du village de  Téné (région de Ségou) qui se connaissent bien. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, mariées et mères d’au moins 7  enfants. Elles mènent  une seule activité la vente de céréales (fonio, riz,  haricot  et pois de terre.)
 Pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, et accroître la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe Fotemogoban ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis trois ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 150.000 FCFA pour le cinquième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe)
 Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des sacs de fonio, haricots,  pois de terre et de riz à Fangaso et Djeli pour être revendus à San  et Koutiala.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune au cours de ce cycle un bénéfice moyen de 115 000 FCFA.
  En dehors du remboursement des prêts elles utiliseront une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courante de la famille et augmenter le fonds de commerce. 
Dans les jours à venir,  elles veulent rester fidèle a Soro Yiriwaso pour avoir un fonds consistant afin d’ouvrir une boutique de vente de céréales.
texts.en:
The Fotemogoban group is made up of women from the village of Téné (Ségou region) who know each other well. They have an average age of 40, are married, and are mothers of at least 7 children. They have a single business: selling cereals ("fonio"--a local sort of millet; rice, dried beans, and a sort of groundnuts)

To be able to satisfy their clientele which is always growing and expand the size of their businesses, the members of the Fotemogoban group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. The amount they are allowed to borrow has gone from 50,000 F CFA for their first loan to 150,000 F CFA for their fifth solidarity (group) loan.

The present loan will be used to buy sacks of "fonio", dried beans, groundnuts, and rice in Fangaso and Djeli to be sold in San and Koutiala. They each hope to make an average profit of 115,000 F CFA during the loan cycle. Besides reimbursing the loan, they will use a part of the income to cover current family expenses and increase their working capital. In the days to come, they want to remain true to Soro Yiriwaso so as to have a consistent amount of capital in order to open a shop selling cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cereals for re-sale

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta T., 39, is married with 4 children. She has 5 years of experience in the Elei Printing business. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (~50 USD). SPBD loans are Elisapeta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase paint, brush, cotton materials, design board, paints and varnish

loans.name: Katuma B Rukudo Jolly Group

texts.en:
Jolly R. is 36 years old and married with three children. She also cares for two dependents. All the children are attending school.

Jolly has been selling used clothes for over ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to increase her stock. She is an active woman whose dream is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of used clothing.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen ha pasado la mayor parte de su vida tratando de salir adelante, tiene 35 años y vive en su propia casa junto a sus dos hijos; Samuel de 9 y Maria de 7 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Siendo aun muy joven sufrió la terrible perdida de sus padres, desde ese momento supo que estaba sola y que si quería tener un buen futuro tenía que trabajar muy duro. Entonces, aprovechando el terreno que sus padres le dejaron ha podido poner un garaje para guardar carros, el cual es uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad de Puno. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizar sus quehaceres hogareños, al mismo tiempo que cuida los carros, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta es tener que despertarse en la madrugada para atender a algunos clientes que desean guardar sus autos. En el futuro espera tener otro negocio propio, la atrae mucho la idea de tener un restaurante, con el cual pueda generarse más ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo de Carmen con MFP, es muy conciente del compromiso que ha adquirido y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados hará arreglar su garaje, para tener más espacio donde acomodar los autos.
texts.en:
Carmen has spent the most part of her live trying to get ahead. She is 35, and she lives in her own house with her two children, nine year old Samuel and seven year old Maria. Her children are the motivation for all of her efforts. When she was still very young she suffered the terrible loss of her parents. From that moment on she knew that she was alone, and that if she wanted to have a better future she had to work very hard. So, taking advantage of the land that her parents left her, she was able to set up a parking garage. Her garage is one of the most used in the city of Puno. What she likes most about her work is that she is able to do her household chores at the same time that she takes care of the cars. She has been in this business for five years. What she likes the least is having to get up at dawn to tend to customers who want to leave their cars. In the future she wants to have another business of her own. The idea that appeals to her is having a restaurant to generate more income. This is Carmen’s first loan with MFP. She is very conscious of the commitment she has made, and she is prepared to make all of her payments on time. She is a very active and responsible member of her community bank. With the 1,000 PEN that she has asked for, she will fix up her garage to have more spaces to accommodate more cars.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Enlarge her parking garage

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny tiene 22 años, acaba da formar su familia y está esperando un hijo, por el momento están viviendo en la casa de sus suegros y tiene muchas ilusiones de emprender una nueva vida con su pareja. Al no contar con sus propias chacras, su madre le ha cedido una parte de sus tierras sembradas de café a punto de cosechar para que Marleny no pase carencias económicas. En consecuencia, ahora está esperando que el café se uniformice en sus frutos y proceda cosechar, mientras que va sembrando sus propios cultivos.  Durante toda su vida Marleny tuvo inclinación por los  trabajos agrícolas, ya que creció en este ambiente, además que considera que es una actividad muy rentable, a pesar de requerir mucha inversión, pero en las épocas de cosecha se recupera todo lo invertido. Con la siembra de sus propios productos planea ir ahorrando dinero para comprar sus propias tierras y terreno donde construir su casa. Para el futuro desea tener un negocio compra y venta de frutas muy próspero en la ciudad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, se está integrando en el quinto ciclo de su banco comunal, por lo que hace compromisos de pagar responsablemente cada una de sus cuotas señalada por su asesora de crédito. Lo que más le atrae del trabajo con un banco comunal son los ahorros que realizan. El dinero que solicita lo utilizará para contratar peones que realicen la limpieza de las chacras donde sembrará sus primeras plantas cafetaleras.
texts.en:
Marleny is 22 and has just started her family, with a baby on the way. For the time being she and her husband are living with her in-laws, but she has hopes that they can start a new life together. Since she doesn't her own fields, Marleny was loaned some by her mother, planted with coffee that's just about ready to be harvested, so she won't be without income. Now she's waiting for the berries to ripen so she can harvest them, and in the meantime she's planting her own crops. For her entire life Marleny has had a penchant for farming since she grew up in that environment. Furthermore, she sees it as a very profitable business, and while it requires a big investment, that's all recouped at harvest time. By planting her own produce she plans to save money to buy her own land and a plot where she can build her house. In the future, Marleny hopes to have a thriving business in the city buying and selling fruits and vegetables. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she is joining her village bank's the fifth loan cycle, so she is committed to responsibly making each and every one of the payments scheduled by her loan advisor. What has attracted her most about working with a village bank are the savings she realizes. She plans to use her loan to hire laborers to clear the fields where she'll plant her first coffee bushes.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire laborers to clear her fields.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia Florentina, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos, entre sus actividades del hogar ella se dedica también al comercio minorista, ella vende comida en la plazoleta de Urcos, ella misma cocina y lleva a vender la comida cacera, lo hace todos los días de la semana, para esto ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar insumos y elaborar los diferentes platos y así mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, ella es madre y padre para sus niños y desea darles una buena educación e invertir parte de ese dinero en la adquisición de muebles y artefactos, también en los pasajes de sus niños y otros usos más. 

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida y valora el préstamo y la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Florentina belongs to the Siempre Unidos Community Bank. She is from the Santiago neighborhood in the city of Cusco. She is 46, single, and she has two children. In addition to her household chores, she is also a small business woman. She sells food in the small plaza in Urcos. She cooks and then takes the homemade food to sell. She does this every day of the week. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies to make her different dishes. This way she can improve her quality of life and that of her family. She is both mother and father to her children. She wishes to give them a good education. She will use part of the money to buy furniture and kitchen utensils. She will also buy tickets (transportation) for her children among other things. She is very grateful, and she appreciates the loan and the opportunity it offers. She promises to repay according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food sales in the small plaza in Urcos

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin V. is 35-year-old farmer and married woman. During the morning and in the late afternoon she works with her farming tools in the field. She normally grows cabbages, cucumbers, and morning glories from her own farmland that was inherited from her grandmother years ago. She will sell her crop when it matures, every two months after she begins planting.  Her husband helps her in the field. Rin V. dreams of having a moto to use for her family’s traveling needs but she does not enough money to buy it. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a motorcycle. This moto will help her to cut costs by no longer hiring taxis.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: İsmayıl

texts.en:
Ismayil J. is dedicated to the business of livestock. He distinguishes himself by having a lot of experience when it comes to livestock. He supports his spouse and five children and also provides for their education. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to support his children so that they can get ahead.

Ismayil is hoping for the support of Aqroinvest with the goal of obtaining a loan of $2000 US. The loan will allow him to purchase young cattle, raise and breed them, and in this way, to earn more. Both Ismayil and his loving family will benefit from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita T., 47, has been buying and selling farm produce like bananas, sweet potatoes, tomatoes and other fruits and vegetables in season in her village in Silang, Cavite for six years. These agricultural products are abundant in her location.

Elenita earns P12,000 a month from buying and selling agricultural produce. Her three adult children take turns in assisting her, particularly in the transport of items she buys and sells from the farm to the market.

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 and has since been enjoying its many benefits for women entrepreneurs. Elenita has just finished repaying her previous loan from CCT and has applied for a new loan of P18,000.

She wants to have her house refurbished. Elenita also dreams of owning a tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar) for easy transport of the agricultural produce she buys from the farms.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business / house repair
